story:
Hello My name is Brian. Thank you for taking the time to check out my new product, Profix. This is my first invention and I will admit it has been probably the hardest thing I have ever done just to get to this point. ( I guess if it was easy everyone would do it). I hope you will like my Profix. If so, please help me by taking advantage of one of our perks and if that is to much then any donation would be appreciated  and only with your help can we bring Profix to market. 




HAS THIS HAPPENED TO YOU?

Imagine this: You’re driving home from work looking forward to spending the weekend with your family and friends. Suddenly out of nowhere a semi-truck pulls out in front of you and kicks up (a rock). You see it coming right at you but there is nothing you can do about it. Then BOOM: it happens. The rock makes contact with your windshield glass. 


You look up to see the impact of what just happened and there it is; a chip in your windshield. After shaking your head in disbelief, you think to yourself: “just one more thing I am not looking forward to dealing with this weekend.”

THERE HAS TO BE A BETTER WAY

As the inventor of ProFix and 20-year veteran in the windshield repair industry, I discovered the current way of repairing a cracked windshield yourself was too time-consuming and confusing. Not to mention, the products are not reusable and can leave a mark, increasing the chances of the crack returning. All that changes with ProFix – the most advanced DIY equipment ever made and the only one that uses the patented cartridge technology. 



With ProFix, you don’t have to replace the equipment after every use, just the cartridge.  ProFix comes with a new line of accessories like the corner adapter that helps reach places on the windshield competing products can’t reach; or the big pit adapter when faced with an oversized chip that is too large for regular DIY equipment.


HOW DOES PROFIX WORK?

Pro Fix’s DIY Windshield Repair Kit works like this:

  • Take out the ProFix unit from its hard-carrying case. Attach the base to the cylinder.  Take out the UV cartridge, remove the tape at the bottom and insert it in to the unit.
  • Attach the ProFix unit to the glass and place it over the center of the pit.
  • Screw the cylinder all the way to the glass using the suction cups to secure it to the surface. 
  • Once secured, unscrew the plunger upwards through the cylinder. This is when the air gets extracted from the windshield chip.
  • Apply the UV cartridge by pushing down on the plunger. This activates the cartridge inside the cylinder by pushing the resin down to the bottom of the cylinder and then applying pressure by screwing the plunger downwards and putting force behind the resin and pushing it into the break.

Following this process will allow for the resin to remain free from contaminants. The cartridge keeps the resin away from the air extraction process until it is ready to be injected into the crack.  

PROFIX versus THE COMPETITION


When you think of our competition and how their systems works, imagine this: try letting air out of a balloon while at the same time trying to put water into it. You see the problem you will have in doing that right? Eventually the water will fill the balloon but not without spillage. That is how the current DIY windshield repair systems works. It is called gravity feed. The air remains in the cracks while the resin is applied, possibly leading to contamination of the chip and resulting in an incomplete repair.

Now imagine completely letting the air out of the balloon first, then refilling the balloon with water. Now you have a water balloon. That is how the ProFix DIY Windshield Repair system works. Our repair equipment takes the air out of the crack prior to applying the resin into it, eliminating any contamination. This makes the repair of the crack a superior one.
PRODUCT TIMELINE

FAQ

How long does a windshield repair take using ProFix?

On average, repairing a chip takes about 10 minutes

Where can I get the ProFix DIY Windshield Repair Kit?

Our kits will be available for purchase on our website, online, and at department stores

When will I receive my ProFix DIY Windshield Repair Kit?

We plan on processing our first orders by this summer

Is the ProFix DIY Windshield Repair Kit reusable?

Yes it is. The only items you will have to replace are the resin cartridges

Can you store ProFix inside your car?

Yes. ProFix's DIY retail version can fit inside the car's glove compartment, with the wholesale version fitting underneath the seat.

story:
Story - Bamboo & Why 

Hi, my name is Antti and thank you for your time. My partner Jason and I started this venture 1 year ago in the beginning of 2015 and we have slowly worked up to now where we believe our idea is good enough to be presented to everyone. Both he and I worked in Corporate after we graduated University and we ended up working in the field of exports and quality control. I was a chief project manager of a large European retailer and my partner was likewise for a large supermarket retailer from the United States. We were both in China in the field of enforcing quality control and environmental standards for export products. Over the few years we saw many inspirational stories of businesses and individuals making a difference as well as many problematic issues that we are facing in the degradation of the environment. Over the years we became good friends and one day we two decided to do something for ourselves, but we decided it must be something that not only reflects our personal values but also something that peaked our interests and that we have a passion for. 

For over half a year we were brain storming but we honestly had no idea until we were both invited to a wedding in Anji China. Anji is well known in China for being “the land of bamboo” for its natural bamboo surroundings to also being one of the largest bamboo cultivation areas in China, we however had no idea at the time. Being hospitable, our friend introduced us to his hometown and their specialty which is bamboo cultivation and processes. We quickly realized that there were many products already substituted by bamboo but not many if at all for our household goods.

For about a year now, me and my partner have been developing slowly our product line and designs and we have made concepts and sample products. We have also launched a basic website and have taken some photos and we believe we are ready to take the next step. Our goal is to push the idea of this material into the western market and explain to both businesses and consumers the benefits of using this material as a substitute and alternative to plastic. Not only is it more green and ecofriendly we found that we can also match the pricing of all the current plastic products on the market. Our thinking is; if the quality is the same and it is better for the environment for an equal price, then why not give it a try?

IRRI Lunch Box

For our Business Plan Introduction - DL link here

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxBPpblj_BgcdF...

For our FAQ on why bamboo and explaination of chart below - DL link here

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxBPpblj_BgcNH...

IRRI Children's Set



How we Will Use The Funding

We will use the stated funds for production of our product line, with the goal of selling our designs  directly to our consumers in the United States and Europe, online and eventually in stores as well. We will use the funds to manufacture our product line and for operational costs  in the United States. 

Any funding past our states goal we will use to 

1) attend trade fairs to present and promote our idea, with this we can convince larger retailers of our idea and give us a try. 

2) Establish more partner stores either online or offline to build a network for distribution.

With that we hope the bamboo material and its use as an Eco-friendly alternative will increase.

The greatest advantage we have is that our cost of production can be matched to our competitors in plastic and our idea simply offers the consumers a choice. We believe that retailers would view products offering consumers more choices as a good thing, and people would like the idea of an alternative biodegradable material to replace plastics but that also doesn't burn a hole in our wallets. 


Introduction – What is IRRI, What Are Our Products?

  IRRI is the name of the brand that my partner and I created over a year ago and it holds a special meaning to us. It represents to us our concept of using new ideas to face the problems of the future generation. We always believed in the green concept but that it also should be cost effective for the consumer and sustainable economically as well, so we decided to use bamboo as an ecofriendly alternative to plastic for our essential everyday household goods. Many of us already know about the environmental problems that we all face from the overuse of plastics, and because plastic is non-biodegradable it eventually ends up in huge piles within our oceans. Bamboo contrary to most peoples initial perception is not a tree but rather a grass, and because of this bamboo grows at an exponentially faster rate and is one of the world’s fastest growing plants. Because of this, bamboo can be cultivated on farms which can be harvested seasonally like our food and vegetables. Bamboo has already started substituting hardwoods as an alternative solution to deforestation and soil erosion in the United States and we hope to take the concept one step further. (You can read about this in detail within the FAQ below)

Our products consists of our own designs of everyday household goods using 100% biodegradable bamboo fiber material. We started with dining items (cups, forks, plates) etc and a children’s set we are very proud of. We also made smaller standalone items such as coffee cups and compartment trays for organization and snacks. We hope to expand to much more categories as we grow and mature. 

Bamboos Properties and how it Effects Quality

§  Bamboo has a higher compression strength then wood, brick and concrete and its tensile strength is similar to that of steel.

§  Due to the durability of bamboo plants, no pesticides or chemicals are needed to encourage the maturation process, and they require much less water than trees.

§  Bamboo products are 100% decomposable naturally. Once they do, they return and eventually become reusable in the form of nutrient-rich composted soil. This is in stark contrast to the plastics which we use now, which cannot be processed by nature and so it accumulates in garbage dumps and eventually into our oceans.

IRRI Bear & Horse Basket Set

Risks & Challenges

Where We Get Our Bamboo

Our bamboo is cultivated and grown in Anji County Zhejiang China. We make sure for our products, we only order bamboo from certified cultivation center that grow and harvest on its own farm. This way we can guarantee that we are not buying bamboo from illegally harvested areas such as environmental projects that are fighting soil erosion. 

Our Promise of Transparency

We want to be as transparent as possible with our project and so once we make production we will publicly publish our costs of production on our website. We also promise to document our experience at the trade fair and show how we used your contributions to help us advance our stated goal. Both Antii and I having most of our experiences in manufacturing and quality control understands the consumers worry over ethical standards as well as quality. This is why we believe as a standard of our new global & digital world to be as transparent as possible every step of the way. We believe it is the only way to gain and maintain the trust of our customers which is our ultimate goal.

  Finally, we promise to take all our contributors opinions to heart as you are the ones that make it possible, so we are open to new products and items that you would like to see and we would be happy to try make it for you guys. Ultimately the goal is to have a dialogue with all the people that believed in us and our idea, we believe that its about building a community and slowly but surely that is our way to success

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you that see our page but cannot contribute we still greatly appreciate your support. Please help us spread our idea by supporting us on our Facebook page.  

https://www.facebook.com/irribrand/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/irrihome/

also be sure to check out our website

http://www.irrihome.com/

to contact us directly please email: jason@irrihome.com / antti@irrihome.com

Please help us spread the word and share!

story:
Brothers And Founders

We are Michael and Sean Pannke, and we need your help to start a family run Aquaponic farm and fish hatchery in Flagstaff, AZ.  The $200,000 will go towards purchasing farm land, building greenhouses, aquaponic systems, and much much more.

We were exposed to urban farming while attending college in Milwaukee, WI where we were amazed and inspired by the positive impact Growing Power had on our city.   Following this inspiration, we successfully designed and built our home an aquaponics system, and had great success growing greens and other produce as well as breeding fish on a small scale.  The projects instilled in us even more passion for sustainable agriculture, and that is why we need your help, in order to expand these principals into a profitable commercial aquaponic farm.  These experiences have been driving forces behind our desire to spread the same type of community supported agriculture to yet another wonderful city.  Your donation to our cause, no matter how big or how small, will be used to build and work towards a more sustainable future for us all.

Flagstaff is a great place to live, to work and to visit.  It's surrounded by beautiful mountains and forests, and has a thriving local community who are dedicated to forward thinking and sustainability.  There is, however, a growing demand here (as in most cities) for more sustainable and local agriculture.  By supporting the creation of Pannke Farm, you'll help us fill in the void and supply fresh local produce and fish to our northern Arizona community and charities, as well as the many restaurants, grocers and markets also doing business here.

Aquaponic farming will allow us to be productive and innovative throughout the year, while constantly reinvesting in the local community through education, volunteer work, and food donations.  Our farm will not only serve as a home for us, but also as a small bed and breakfast for people interested in an immersive experience at our farm. 


What is 'Aquaponics'?

Aquaponics is a farming system symbiotically combines both aquaculture (fish farming) and hydroponics (growing plants without soil) to create a single, much more efficient system. This is made possible by the natural microbial process that breaks the down the toxins in fish waste into the nutrients plants need to thrive.  The plants and microbes act as a filter, providing the fish farm with purified water in a closed loop. This combined with effective composting creates a farming system with very little waste. This ultimately means aquaponic systems produce more pounds of food per acre than traditional farms, while greatly reducing the environmental impact.  Because the systems can be housed inside of greenhouses, aquaponics will allow us to produce organic food locally, and consistently regardless of seasonal and/or climate changes. 

For Example, "Growing Power" (an established 3 acre aquaponic farm) in Milwaukee WI,  currently generates 1 Million pounds of fresh organic produce, over 10,000 fish and 500 cubic yards of compost each year.  We would hope to eventually match if not exceed these numbers per acre, based on our favorable climate and sun here in AZ.

Pictured above: Inside of a Growing Power greenhouse, in Milwaukee WI

If you would like to learn more about aquaponics and see some of the farms currently driving the movement, below are some helpful links

  • Wikipedia
  • Colorado Aquaponics
  • Aquaponics.com
  • BackyardAquaponics.com
  • FriendlyAquaponics.com


Many Fish thrive in aquaponic systems, such as:

  • Tilapia
  • Perch (Pictured above)
  • Trout
  • Catfish
  • Bluegill, Crappie, & Sunfish
  • Colorful pet fish: Mollies, Platies, Swordtails, and Guppies
  • Ornimental Koi
  • Carp/Goldfish
  • Many more, including freshwater mussel and crayfish.

Plants that do well in Aquaponic systems include:

  • Leafy lettuce and greens
  • Basils and mints
  • Tomatos
  • Peppers
  • Watercress (is commonly fed to the fish)
  • Chives
  • Squash and cucumbers
  • Broccoli
  • Bananas, dwarf citrus trees, and so many more!


The Plan

The mission of Pannke Farm is to sustainably and efficiently raise and grow a variety of healthy organic fish and produce, to supply our local community, restaurants, and markets. We aim to educate and will partner with groups, schools and universities for tours and field trips, as well as internships and research.  

These funds will be used to purchase land, and to set up the farm and aquaponic systems.  Our goal by mid-late summer 2016 is to have our initial greenhouses and aquaponics systems up and running. We aim to then begin our first harvests of produce, followed by fish starting in the fall and winter of '16. 

The small bed and breakfast will be built during these months, and opened after the farm is established and productive.  Renting cabins on site will allow us to offer guests a chance to experience and learn from our aquaponic farm first hand, for days or weeks at a time. We hope to have the B&B with cabins up and running in early to mid 2017.

As the land we develop will also serve as our home we plan to develop a small area into a homestead.  There we will set up our personal gardens and small greenhouses, as well as raise our own goats and chickens that will provide us with fresh milk and eggs.

Our goal is to become a leader in the innovation and implementation of aquaponics systems, but we need to start small.  We aim to help the movement in any way we can as local and sustainable agriculture spreads around the world.


 What We Will Need the Funding for:

  • Land  (Expected Down payment of 20k+, as well as monthly mortgage, and yearly taxes)
  • Greenhouses and fish warehouses.  (Depending on size, pre-made commercial aquaponic set ups sell anywhere from: $10k-30k for the smaller systems, to more than $50k+ for large systems)  
  • Aquaponic Supplies (Pumps and tubing, grow-beds and grow media, fish-tanks, monitoring equipment, filters, etc..
  • Fish fingerlings
  • Plants/seeds 
  • Multiple water cisterns ($1,399/3000Gal) and water delivery plumbing.
  • Septic system(s) (nat. average $4,600 ea.)
  • Roads cut and gravel laid (Average $2300/12'x50' of road)
  • Solar Panels ($900/panel) and Electrical systems
  • Living Spaces -For people: (30k for this log cabin) and for animals: (Chicken coop - $800 , 4X8 goat house $1,899)
  • Chickens and Goats
  • Storage Barn/Warehouse ($2099 12'x20' Steel Building)
  • Farm Equipment - purchase and/or rental
  • Contractor, construction, and farmhand work - $$/Hr
  • Materials and other expenses


Our team is full of awesome people!  It Includes:
  • Architects
  • Engineers of multiple disciplines, including Environmental, Civil, & Mechanical
  • Graphic Designers
  • Farmers who have worked & studied in the aquaponics industry.
  • Greenhouse Managers
  • Biologists and Chemists
  • Mycologists and Botanists
  • Composting Experts
  • Photographers
  • Chefs
  • Journalists and Authors
  • The many Flagstaff locals who have already pledged their support in the form of their time and hard work, and those who are an excited future customer base!


  How else can you help?
  • Donate to our cause!
  • Share this campaign with friends and family.
  • Contact us via Email at PannkeFarm@gmail.com if you know of a group, organization or individual who may be interested in helping our cause.  
  • Work with us!   Once things start moving, we will appreciate all the extra help we can get. 
  • Consult with our team. If you have any advice or sage tips of the trade you would like to share with us, or if you have questions about our plan and want more information about the farm, please email us at PannkeFarm@gmail.com

building greenhouses, aquaponic systems, and much much more.We were exposed to urban farming while attending college in Milwaukee, WI where we were amazed and inspired by the positive impact Growing Power had on our city.   Following this inspiration, we successfully designed and built our home an aquaponics system, and had great success growing greens and other produce as well as breeding fish on a small scale.  The projects instilled in us even more passion for sustainable agriculture, and that is why we need your help, in order to expand these principals into a profitable commercial aquaponic farm.  These experiences have been driving forces behind our desire to spread the same type of community supported agriculture to yet another wonderful city.  Your donation to our cause, no matter how big or how small, will be used to build and work towards a more sustainable future for us all.Flagstaff is a great place to live, to work and to visit.  It's surrounded by beautiful mountains and forests, and has a thriving local community who are dedicated to forward thinking and sustainability.  There is, however, a growing demand here (as in most cities) for more sustainable and local agriculture.  By supporting the creation of Pannke Farm, you'll help us fill in the void and supply fresh local produce and fish to our northern Arizona community and charities, as well as the many restaurants, grocers and markets also doing business here.Aquaponic farming will allow us to be productive and innovative throughout the year, while constantly reinvesting in the local community through education, volunteer work, and food donations.  Our farm will not only serve as a home for us, but also as a small bed and breakfast for people interested in an immersive experience at our farm. What is 'Aquaponics'?Aquaponics is a farming system symbiotically combines both aquaculture (fish farming) and hydroponics (growing plants without soil) to create a single, much more efficient system. This is made possible by the natural microbial process that breaks the down the toxins in fish waste into the nutrients plants need to thrive.  The plants and microbes act as a filter, providing the fish farm with purified water in a closed loop. This combined with effective composting creates a farming system with very little waste. This ultimately means aquaponic systems produce more pounds of food per acre than traditional farms, while greatly reducing the environmental impact.  Because the systems can be housed inside of greenhouses, aquaponics will allow us to produce organic food locally, and consistently regardless of seasonal and/or climate changes. For Example, "Growing Power" (an established 3 acre aquaponic farm) in Milwaukee WI,  currently generates 1 Million pounds of fresh organic produce, over 10,000 fish and 500 cubic yards of compost each year.  We would hope to eventually match if not exceed these numbers per acre, based on our favorable climate and sun here in AZ.Pictured above: Inside of a Growing Power greenhouse, in Milwaukee WI
If you would like to learn more about aquaponics and see some of the farms currently driving the movement, below are some helpful links



Wikipedia


Colorado Aquaponics


Aquaponics.com


BackyardAquaponics.com


FriendlyAquaponics.com





Many Fish thrive in aquaponic systems, such as:


Tilapia
Perch (Pictured above)
Trout
Catfish
Bluegill, Crappie, & Sunfish
Colorful pet fish: Mollies, Platies, Swordtails, and Guppies
Ornimental Koi
Carp/Goldfish
Many more, including freshwater mussel and crayfish.


Plants that do well in Aquaponic systems include:


Leafy lettuce and greens
Basils and mints
Tomatos
Peppers
Watercress (is commonly fed to the fish)
Chives
Squash and cucumbers
Broccoli
Bananas, dwarf citrus trees, and so many more!


The Plan
The mission of Pannke Farm is to sustainably and efficiently raise and grow a variety of healthy organic fish and produce, to supply our local community, restaurants, and markets. We aim to educate and will partner with groups, schools and universities for tours and field trips, as well as internships and research.  
These funds will be used to purchase land, and to set up the farm and aquaponic systems.  Our goal by mid-late summer 2016 is to have our initial greenhouses and aquaponics systems up and running. We aim to then begin our first harvests of produce, followed by fish starting in the fall and winter of '16. 
The small bed and breakfast will be built during these months, and opened after the farm is established and productive.  Renting cabins on site will allow us to offer guests a chance to experience and learn from our aquaponic farm first hand, for days or weeks at a time. We hope to have the B&B with cabins up and running in early to mid 2017.
As the land we develop will also serve as our home we plan to develop a small area into a homestead.  There we will set up our personal gardens and small greenhouses, as well as raise our own goats and chickens that will provide us with fresh milk and eggs.
Our goal is to become a leader in the innovation and implementation of aquaponics systems, but we need to start small.  We aim to help the movement in any way we can as local and sustainable agriculture spreads around the world.





 What We Will Need the Funding for:


Land  (Expected Down payment of 20k+, as well as monthly mortgage, and yearly taxes)
Greenhouses and fish warehouses.  (Depending on size, pre-made commercial aquaponic set ups sell anywhere from: $10k-30k for the smaller systems, to more than $50k+ for large systems)  
Aquaponic Supplies (Pumps and tubing, grow-beds and grow media, fish-tanks, monitoring equipment, filters, etc..
Fish fingerlings
Plants/seeds 
Multiple water cisterns ($1,399/3000Gal) and water delivery plumbing.
Septic system(s) (nat. average $4,600 ea.)
Roads cut and gravel laid (Average $2300/12'x50' of road)
Solar Panels ($900/panel) and Electrical systems
Living Spaces -For people: (30k for this log cabin) and for animals: (Chicken coop - $800 , 4X8 goat house $1,899)

Chickens and Goats
Storage Barn/Warehouse ($2099 12'x20' Steel Building)
Farm Equipment - purchase and/or rental
Contractor, construction, and farmhand work - $$/Hr
Materials and other expenses




Our team is full of awesome people!  It Includes:


Architects
Engineers of multiple disciplines, including Environmental, Civil, & Mechanical
Graphic Designers
Farmers who have worked & studied in the aquaponics industry.
Greenhouse Managers
Biologists and Chemists

Mycologists and Botanists
Composting Experts
Photographers
Chefs
Journalists and Authors
The many Flagstaff locals who have already pledged their support in the form of their time and hard work, and those who are an excited future customer base!



  How else can you help?



Donate to our cause!

Share this campaign with friends and family.

Contact us via Email at PannkeFarm@gmail.com if you know of a group, organization or individual who may be interested in helping our cause.  

Work with us!   Once things start moving, we will appreciate all the extra help we can get. 

Consult with our team. If you have any advice or sage tips of the trade you would like to share with us, or if you have questions about our plan and want more information about the farm, please email us at PannkeFarm@gmail.com

story:
Help SWAN get started!

WE NEED $40,000 to help support 40 women & families! 

Our aim is to celebrate women's resilience and capacity to sustain our communities.  The SWAN Project is an initiative by Pi Network Inc. to raise $40K as a local pilot project to support women.  As a social enterprise, we promise to deliver 100% transparency and accountability in this project.

Manon Germain is the founder of Pi Network Inc., a single mother, entrepreneur, humanitarian and philanthropist ~ and is about to celebrate turning 40! In this celebration of life, Manon is welcoming people locally and globally to support this initiative. Thanks to the incredible help of women and community members who will be steering and visioning this work forward, our hope is to take this project from local to global to bring forth incredible stories of women making a difference around the globe.  We will be offering support through micro-crediting, grants, gifts, and more to help serve the needs of children, women and our global community!

Our vision is to have SWAN projects happening in over 40 countries!  We will be documenting and piloting our first project in Ontario, Canada to enable others to join the local to global movement via SWAN's 40 for $40,000 initiative.

***

JOIN MANON & Spring into SWAN's 40 for $40K to kick-start this crowd-sourcing and social enterprise initiative.


This pilot project is run entirely through volunteer hours and pro-bono services rendered via Pi Network and Community Partners.

***


How it works?

SWAN's projected financial breakdown is encapsulated in SHE-RA.


Social Pillar – 20%:  People are social beings by nature - which helps us feel alive, engaged and connected.  Let's provide resources for women to have fun family and community adventures.

Anything from A - Z! For example;

  • Arts: Tickets to museums or theatre productions.
  • Zumba: Dance class passes for women and children.

Health Needs Pillar – 20%:  Our team is passionate about people before profit!  For women to be active agents of change, they need access to healthy food, dental care, safe transportation and welcoming communities.  Help us succeed in giving the gift of health to women and children!

Examples include covering costs or gifting for;

  • Basic health needs such as access to dental care for moms (and their kids), eye glasses, homeopathic support, massage therapy, chiropractic care, etc.
  • Safety needs such as access to transportation, monthly bus passes, critical car repairs (i.e. brakes, tires, oil changes, etc.), car seats, strollers, bikes, helmets.

Entrepreneurial Pillar – 20%:  We are proud to pilot a local micro-crediting initiative for youth and women to help us explore creativity, innovation and skills development. 

  • 13 Social Entrepreneurs will receive access to micro-crediting loans
  • All projects will address sustainable approaches to business planning and environmental stewardship.

Relief Pillar – 15%:  This category is a bit more challenging to describe and can seem to be co-joined to our other pillars – as it can include diverse relief categories that have direct or in-direct costs in relation to helping women find solstice from their everyday struggles.

Examples include covering costs or gifting for;

  • Clothing for business attire or recreational outings
  • Spa treatments
  • Daily or monthly kids’ passes to the YMCA, local kids play parks, day passes to the Zoo, Art Galleries, etc.
  • Support for care-givers
  • Backing for outreach projects supporting women, aboriginals, new immigrants and minorities.

Administration – 25%:  SHE-RA will be possible by dedicating 0% to operating salaries! 

  • 8% campaign fees (Indiegogo, PayPal, banking)
  • 15% estimated tax costs (as an incorporated business / social enterprise, Pi Network Inc. needs to pay government taxes at year’s end).  We are hoping to keep this at the lowest amount possible.
  • 2% marketing / fundraising direct costs (website, email hosting, major fundraising events)

The Impact

SWAN’s 40 for $40k will enable community members, women entrepreneurs and business owners to donate their time, money and resources to help celebrate other women’s resilience.  Too often women’s stories or resilience are unheard – we hope to provide a platform for incredible stories, initiatives and dreams to become ‘real and positive’ news. 

Stay tuned via our website www.swanproject.ca for how the $40K will help 40 local women & girls achieve their dreams, serve the needs of their families, as well as become innovative leaders in their communities.

We are allies of the LGBTQ+ community, minorities and marginalized groups!


Risks & Challenges

As a social enterprise, our challenge is to get people to trust our accountability and processes.  Our founder has over 18 years of experience operating and supporting non-profit organizations.  Our fundamental nature is keeping administration low, to ensure that at least 75% of all funds are utilized to support women and people through this initiative.  Our approach to resolve this challenge is to provide 100% transparency and accountability. 

SWAN’s 3 C’s approach! 

CONNECT < COMMUNICATION < CELEBRATE

  • CONNECT with us to receive or contribute to SWAN’s support systems!
  • COMMUNICATE your story with us or sponsor us to help market SWAN!
  • CELEBRATE women!  Are you 40? Hold a 40 for $40K event 4 SWAN!


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us connect with women who need support and help us enable them to achieve their dreams!

HOW?

  • Share our Indiegogo Campaign with your Network
  • Like and Follow us via social media
  • Contribute to our initiative as a skilled volunteer
  • Become a donor – Individual, Group or Corporate donations welcome
  • Join the pass-it-forward movement by sending us gift cards for women (to enable them to buy clothes, food, and more for their families).  All gift cards are welcome, for example; clothes, book, music, restaurants, grocery stores, community-supported agriculture shares, museums, galleries, gas cards, etc.

COMMUNITY & CORPORATE PARTNERS WANTED!

Are you interested in supporting the SWAN Project?  For community or corporate supporters interested in donation $4K+ to our initiative - please contact us via pinetwork@outlook.com to find-out more about our SWAN Pillar Partner Levels!

***

The SWAN project celebrates the resilience of women by capturing the true stories of women who are agents of change in their families and communities.

THANK YOU ~ MERCI for Caring & Sharing!!!

***

story:
canihaveabite began as a simple idea to help my pilates clients eat healthy meals. What began with a handle of clients grew into a carryout buried in a building with precarious parking. But the fervor for delicious healthy food prevailed and the much-needed next step is here - a new location that will meet the needs of an ever-growing demand for organic dishes. I have grown this business with nothing more than creativity and hard work, but now I need your support! A exciting part of this expansion will be the addition of a Healthy Belly Beverage Bar with tonics, elixirs, kombucha and teas. So what exactly will this new location mean for you? 

  • We Do The Cooking For You Whether you can’t cook for yourself or just don’t have the time to do so, canihaveabite provides a delicious solution. Our easy online menu makes ordering fast and simple and pick-up is easy and convenient. Once you get your dishes home they go from package to plate in a matter of minutes. Or you can dine in by choosing from our distinctive “Create Your Own” refrigerated case filled with dishes that are delicious alone, or can be combined to make your own perfect lunch/dinner. YOU will create your new favorite craving!
  • A Solution For Those With Food Allergies and Sensitivities A color-coded kitchen system makes it easy to keep separated food preparation stations, eliminating cross contamination worries. 
  • Food As Medicine Our dishes are made with local and organic ingredients which means they are fresh, full of flavor and nutrient dense. My menu is inspired by local farmers: grass fed meat, pasture raised chickens, and raw milk cheese. And the rainbow of produce - pink turnips, merlot potatoes, dandelion greens, watermelon radishes - becomes my palette.
  • Healthy Belly Bar Studies have shown that cultivating good gut bacteria is the key to health. The Healthy Belly Bar will provide Wellness Tonics to start your day, Healing Tea Blends to boost your body, Kombucha to aid digestion and Elixirs to punch up your energy.
  • Community Space I believe in treating the whole body, so I am creating a Healthy Belly Happy Hour that will be a one on one evening of wellness professionals and you. Wouldn’t you love to be able to ask a yoga teacher questions before you venture into your first class? Or find out what are the treatments a chiropractor provides? Or learn more about meditation? I love giving parties and this will be a weekly party with all the right elements – fantastic food, beverages, interesting people and you!

I need YOU to make this happen! I believe passionately that there has never been a greater need for prepared dishes that you can eat at home or on the go that contain nothing more than the pure ingredients that nature provides. Thank you for helping me fund this project. Every contribution is greatly appreciate no matter how large or small. Your contribution helps you, your friends, those challenged with illness or food allergies, those who are unable to cook, local farmers and the surrounding neighborhood and community.

story:
Short Summary

Let me tell you about Me and My Product.

  • But first. Please consider the quantity of resources we use too generate heat.
  • Still trying ?, well please consider all the uses we have found for heat.
  • And just for a brief second, how would life be without it ?.

O.K, sorry about that !, but worry not, WE STILL HAVE HEAT. and always will.

our nuclear power stations will still operate. we can still eat, wash and desalinate water. However Today, im talking about a simple household heater. to begin with.

The First Application for This new, simple and reliable technology, will pave a way for a future that allows people of our wonderful planet too all have access too our day too day amenities.  -  in time we wont just be saving 90% on our heating bill. but we will also save 90% of our hot water bill, stoves, ovens, and on the commercial side. The Power Stations will save 90% too, *grins* I AM SO Excited about getting this technology Kick Started on Indegogo. IT WORKS, NOW. and needs your support. this is the start of a revolution.  This Technology has been Freely Released on the Internet and it available too any Skilled Electronics Hobbiests - THE Device is Called the "Rosemary-Ansile-COP-Heater".  FREE DOWNLOAD from GOOGLE. 

This is my Hobby and Occupation - I found this great Design on Google, Built it, and now i need money too Develop it.  Please donate or Buy the First Model

(Designed Specifically too Last 40 Years or more)

It is the biggest advancement in electrical efficiency arguably in 100 years. 

Our technology will provide Heat at only 10% of the traditional cost


According too the US. Energy Information Administration. Americans household spending on energy is 40% for heating and cooling.

And in England The Price of Powering a Standard small household heater (as above) all year around will cost $3000,  - The very same heaters with my Modification will reduce that cost too only $300, Do you want too purchase a Piece of The Future too use and too invest and a Future Antique (like Having Americas first Farnesworth TV)

This Technology is READY AND WORKING, - on the workbench !.

we need too build lots of them,


  • We need too build LOTs of these Heaters
  • We need too sell, lots of these heaters.
  • We need your help. Really

In the words of Buzz Lightyear, TOO INFINITY AND BEYOND

Our First Manufacturing Run of Small Domestic Heaters. will look and operate identically too a tradition Old Fashioned Bar Heater. and will be just as effective and reliable. with a Designed Lifespan of 40+ years, - at minimum.

At the end Our First Manufacturing Run, Sometime in July-August, when all of our contributors have received their product, and we have created many new markets in which too sell our product into. we will Launch our website with our next Alternative Energy Product, and our Thankyou List, will the names and counties (etc) of everybody who helped float this Dream beyond and above my Shed.


What We Need & What You Get (Template)

Break it down for folks in more detail:

    • Our Electronics are Already Designed, working.
    • We Need;
    • Print our circuit boards and manufacture them.
    • Install our electronics inside an Existing Quality Chinese-based Heater Product, - especially chosen because of its simplicity - made from Iron,Steel,Copper and Nichrome - Nothing at all too wear out. WE Supply 100% of the electronics. --- (no fans, no rotation, nothing too break)
    • Then here in Australia we Print out a label, Back in its Box, and off too Market.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • .
  • .
  • .My Brand IGE, Infinite Generation Electronics. will Start Reliably and continue

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.


  • .
  • Non @ all that will stop us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Buy our Product,
  • Spread love across humanity

And that's all there is to it.

We need too sell, lots of these heaters.

In the words of Buzz Lightyear, TOO INFINITY AND BEYONDOur First Manufacturing Run of Small Domestic Heaters. will look and operate identically too a tradition Old Fashioned Bar Heater. and will be just as effective and reliable. with a Designed Lifespan of 40+ years, - at minimum. At the end Our First Manufacturing Run, Sometime in July-August, when all of our contributors have received their product, and we have created many new markets in which too sell our product into. we will Launch our website with our next Alternative Energy Product, and our Thankyou List, will the names and counties (etc) of everybody who helped float this Dream beyond and above my Shed.
   What We Need & What You Get (Template)
 Break it down for folks in more detail: 

Our Electronics are Already Designed, working.
We Need;
Print our circuit boards and manufacture them.
Install our electronics inside an Existing Quality Chinese-based Heater Product, - especially chosen because of its simplicity - made from Iron,Steel,Copper and Nichrome - Nothing at all too wear out. WE Supply 100% of the electronics. --- (no fans, no rotation, nothing too break)

Then here in Australia we Print out a label, Back in its Box, and off too Market.



   The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:  . . .My Brand IGE, Infinite Generation Electronics. will Start Reliably and continue
    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  

 .
Non @ all that will stop us.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Buy our Product,
 Spread love across humanity   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello there! My name is Peggy, I am 27 years old and I live in Leipzig, Germany.
Due to many events in my live I got sick with depression and had to go to a clinic in 2015 to get some help before it could get really bad. It was the first step in the right direction. In my few years I have already piled up a lot of things that burden me and they made me sick. I did not know that until it was already to late. In my family there is not much talking about feelings and I had always high expectations on me. And even when my family was not expecting anything, I had it in my subconscious and started to think that it was me having those high expectations.
After graduation I did as I was told. I wanted to study Japanese Studies but I went into training as a programmer for three years far away from family and friends and all I knew until then. In the new town and in professional school i could not make new friends and was alone for 3 years. After that I was unemployed for a year before I did what I wanted 4 years earlier: go studying! But it was to late. I lost the interest in Japan while I was in the university for two years and could not go on because of financial difficulties.

Today I want to find a therapist to help me deal with my past AND try to start my own small business because I probably can not work in an office with my depression.
I want to raise money for a new monitor, a mouse and a printer so i can build my own small office at home.
I have the dream of creating my own crochet patterns and sell them in my online shop. Also I will sell my finished projects and would love to give workshops wherever possible. I already started creating the first patterns I want to sell. But before that I will have to make a nice and attractive PDF with pictures. That is why I want to build my little office as soon as possible.

Often people ask me what I want to do as a job but I can not imagine anything without creativity. And all the creative jobs are a lot of stress which i can not handle with my sickness. So I would love to work from home in my own speed at my time ( I am a night owl!).
At the moment i am living from something like social security and that is not enough to build my own office.

I will be extremely grateful for every single donation and I would love to send everyone a little selfmade, crocheted gift you like. I would be very happy to give my time and work as a thanks back to you!

story:
Honey, without thinking much about it you slap it on your toast in the morning or pour it on your porridge.

But for thousands of farmers in rural Uganda it's a vital source of income that can make the difference between having a proper home to live in or sending their kids to school. 

Typically those beekeepers have used traditional method but these are often ill-efficient and wasteful. 

Even more of a problem is that the farmers live faraway from their main markets and are at the mercy of middlemen who buy the honey for cheap and keep prices down. That means basically that farmers struggle to get paid the right amount for the honey they produce.

And that is where we come in. 

Malaika Honey was set up by Australian Simon Turner back in June 2006 with the aim of helping Ugandan farmers get a fairer price for their honey and training them in modern beekeeping techniques.


We provide a direct link between the farmers in distant rural communities with the producer -- us. This cuts out the middlemen and allows the farmers to get the money they deserve for the work they do. 

Simultaneously, we have run workshops across the country to train up farmers, supply them with beehives and equipment so that they can work more effectively and be more reliable honey and hive product suppliers. Essentially it's a win-win situation for both them and us.


 



Some of our successful initiatives include research and development where have authored a practical beekeeping guidebook book in transitional beekeeping techniques for the poor farmer, a hive tool specially designed for a KTB hive in association with Design without Borders (Norwegian NGO) and pioneering the commercial output and production of propolis tincture (a broad spectrum natural antibiotic from the beehive).

Currently we are now developing an improved KTB hive to increase honey production and planning for a queen rearing project that would expand on the productivity of commercial beekeeping here in Uganda for the farmers as well as improve colonization in hives with new queens!

We also constructed a Bee fence along Queen Elizabeth national park to protect farmers from elephants coming and destroying their crops. See full story Here


Don't get us wrong. We are a for-profit organization. That is because we see the only way of creating sustainable development in the sector is for there to be a functioning market and that is what we want to help create.

Obviously, however, some things are beyond our humble means for now but that doesn't mean we can't set our sights high. 

That is why we're asking you to help fund the building and creation of the honey resource centre as a permanent place where we can train up and help equip farmers to help them go from just scraping by to providing their families with a regular income


We've saved up some $45,000 for the project but are looking for another $260,000. It may sound ambitious but it is a dream -- not just for us but for the thousands of families in rural Uganda it will help. 

Thanks so much for your support!  Webale nyo, nyo!

Simon and the team at Malaika Honey

story:
Short Summary

SageTV is a cross-platform networked DVR and media management system.

I have been a user and add-on developer for SageTV since 2005 and have produced numerous plugins including a dynamic menu system (ADM).  A major development effort and improvement to SageTV has been the Gemstone UI replacement where I was one of the main developers (along with a great small team) as well as a contributor to the Phoenix services for SageTV. Now that SageTV has become an Open Source project, there are even more opportunities and challenges available.

Windows Installer: An important part of any project is ensuring new and current users can get up and running quickly and safely... therefore the need for a Windows Installer is high on my priority list.  This is key to the success of this Open Source project in order to bring on new users.

Gemstone 2.0: As existing users and new users ramp up their use of the Open Source SageTV, we need a solid and fresh UI that brings on new features, becomes mobile/tablet friendly and resolves any remaining issues raised from previous releases.

This project is Open Source so your contribution will go towards building a good testing and development environment to ensure the installer and Gemstone UI function well under numerous environments.

What We Need & What You Get

The major need for this project is my time and effort, however there are always investments to be made in hardware to assist in testing various scenarios for the installer and user interface changes.

Your contributions will help towards acquiring various hardware such as a HDHomeRun unit as well as various other devices for testing (small TV/Monitor, touch screen devices/tablets, Android Devices, etc.).

Any remaining funds will be used as incentive to keep building a better SageTV Open Source product.

Along with your contribution suggest a special feature/function that you would like to see and I will do my best to move it up the priority list.

If the goal is not reached then I will use the funding to acquire hardware and keep working through my priorities as well as users suggestions to make the product better.

The Impact

 SageTV is a solid yet highly customizable DVR solution that needs an even larger Community behind it.  Growth of the user base and community can only come from investing time and your contributions into a solid installer and a great user interface. My commitment to this great product will only be made stronger by your support and contributions.

Risks & Challenges

Building a Windows Installer certainly has it's challenges with limitations by the toolsets available as well as the large number of existing SageTV installs with different hardware and OS versions.  My previous experience in this space is limited so I will commit to resolving issues as they are raised through the community to get a solid solution in place for installing SageTV on Windows.

The user interface as well can be challenging however this is an area where I have proven experience with a large group of existing users on the SageTV forum to attest to a great experience.  Changes to the UI to work better on tablets and other touch interfaces may require core changes as well that could be beyond my level of experience however this would just be another challenge to make the task more interesting. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who cannot contribute financially you can still help out through testing and suggesting features on the SageTV user forums as well as getting your friends and families to jump on the SageTV Open Source bandwagon.

story:
1.  Summary

For any cultural sector to be dynamic it needs to maintain a high profile in community life. Young Norfolk Islanders were traditionally raised in an environment that taught them their local language, history and traditional knowledge and skills, but many ways of passing on these traditions and skills are disappearing. Therefore, our school, cultural organisations and civil society must now play a key role in protecting and promoting our cultural heritage. The portrait photographs and Exhibition entitled, ‘Faces of Norfolk: Spirit of Self-Determination’, will raise the visibility of culture on Norfolk Island (NI).

The project will engage a professional photographer to document a selection of members of the NI community. Thirty-two (32) of the best of these portraits will be selected to comprise a 33 piece black and white collection. The Exhibition will be officially launched on July, 2016 at the NI Centre for Democracy by the Norfolk Island People for Democracy (NIPD). The date of July 1, 2016 is significant as this is the day the Commonwealth ‘officially’ takes full control of Norfolk. The exhibited photos will be compiled into a coffee table book, printed and available for sale. Both exhibition entry fees and subsequent book sales will be used to as a sustainable revenue base for the Centre for Democracy to enable it to continue its important work on the Island.

An exhibition of 33 black and white prints (40 x 50cm) will be developed for exhibition. These images will represent a visual record of the people of NI in their fight for self-determination.  This project also represents a sound approach to achieving a goal of NIPD to protect and preserve NI heritage for future generations.

2.  Background

Norfolk Island was discovered in 1774 by Captain James Cook. Situated between Australia, New Zealand and New Caledonia, the Island was originally settled to supply the new British colonies with flax and timber. Between 1774 and 1856, the Island was used as two distinct penal colonies - the second being the most brutal ever established by Britain.

In 1856 the island became the homeland of the Pitcairn Islanders, the descendants of the Bounty Mutineers and their Tahitian wives who bought with them to Norfolk, their own system of democratic self-government, and a distinct language and culture[1]. Between 1856 and 1896 the Pitcairn Islanders continued their self-government, until this right was taken from them.

Between 1896 and 1979 Norfolk’s affairs were administered first by the Colony of New South Wales, and then after Australia's Federation, by the ‘Commonwealth’ of Australia. After a long crusade, the NI People were granted a limited form of self-government in 1979. 

During this period of self-government, Norfolk supported itself financially. However, as a result of the Global Financial Crisis (GFC), and with tourism numbers down significantly in 2010, the Norfolk Island Government was obligated to sign a ‘Road Map’ for change with the Commonwealth of Australia. This agreement saw Norfolk dependant on funds provided only on the ‘condition’ of meeting milestones dictated by the Commonwealth through funding agreements.

Regardless of the views of the NI community and the promised Road Map, the Commonwealth was already moving to dissolve Norfolk’s democratic institutions through the Territories Law Reform Act (2010). As a consequence, the Norfolk Island Legislative Assembly and Government lost control over the Norfolk Island fiscus; and the proposed laws passed by the Norfolk Island Legislative Assembly became in all cases subject to the approval of Australian authorities.

Finally, in 2015, the Norfolk Island Legislation Amendment Act abolished the NI Legislative Assembly and placed the legislative and executive powers in the hands of the Commonwealth. An unelected Advisory Council was appointed by the Federal Minister.

Today, the room which housed the Legislative Assembly chamber is now bare, as is the former committee room. No physical evidence remains on site of the most senior law making institution and instrument of governance that Norfolk Island has ever possessed. Every tangible object of Norfolk’s political culture and heritage no longer belong to the Norfolk people.

3.    Project Participants

·  Rhonda Griffiths

The project will be managed by Rhonda Griffiths, a Norfolk Islander of Pitcairn Island descent. She is a former Member of the Norfolk Island Legislative Assembly (MLA) and Cultural Affairs Adviser for the Pacific Community. Rhonda has continuously opposed the imposition of Commonwealth authority on the Island believing that, ‘while other places are moving forward in their political and democratic governance, Norfolk has been taken back to the colonial days’.  Rhonda is a member of ‘the Midshipmen; a loosely formed group of Islanders who share her views.

Rhonda has managed many cultural, creative and innovative projects including a 25 piece exhibition representing the living cultures of all member states of the Council of Pacific Arts. This exhibition remains permanently displayed through SPC headquarters in Noumea, New Caledonia. Rhonda has also created, managed and curated an Exhibition of Maori ‘weaving’ works, in partnership with the Norfolk Island Museums. Accompanying this 2-week exhibition, were 5 renowned weavers and a traditional elder from New Zealand; during this event, they conducted workshops and gave demonstrations and presentations to the local community. 

·  Hari Frohling

The photographer, Hari Frohling is a Norfolk Islander of Pitcairn Island descent. He is a professional photographer based in Sydney, Australia.  Hari’s interest in photography began when he was 18 years old and doing an apprenticeship as an automotive mechanic, mixing and producing music on the side. This was the beginning of Hari’s creative pursuits. At 22 Hari studied graphic design, learning composition, colour theory and print standards.  Hari is currently studying for an advanced diploma in screen media. In 2015, Hari was awarded ‘Best Cinematographer (Documentary)’ for his film ‘Cobbler’. This exhibition will be the first major photographic exhibition for this award-winning up and coming young Island talent who says photography, ‘is what I love doing. I believe with persistence and motivation you can achieve anything’.

·  Norfolk Island People for Democracy (NIPD)

NIPD is an incorporated Civil Society Organisation[2] (CSO) that comprises over 1000 members of the Norfolk Island community (including the Norfolk Diaspora). NIPD was formed following the abolishment of the Norfolk Island Parliament. It is a representative, professional, committed and informed association planning for the long-term[3]NIPD’s Vision is: ‘Norfolk Island Listed as a Non-Self-Governing Territory with the United Nations;  its mission: “Assist the Norfolk Island community make informed decisions about their future governance. NIPD seeks to ensure democracy on Norfolk Island is assured for future generations.  This Exhibition aims to begin the nation-building activity essential prior to any vote of self-determination.

.

·  The Community Subjects

Norfolk Islanders are the ‘Children of Polynesia’; a distinct and separate People with a unique language, traditions and culture. The physical beauty of their heritage has been remarked on for centuries. From their Tahitian foremothers, they received the gift of ‘beauty’; George Robertson, master of the first English ship in Tahiti noted, ‘when all our boats returned to ship all the sailors swore they never saw handsomer made women in all their lives’.  

Joseph Campbell in his report on Norfolk Island and its inhabitants in 1879 stated, ‘the race are, as a rule, good looking, well made, affectionate, simple in their manners and ideas, and very intelligent’. Ian Ball in 1973 noted the hazel eyes and Polynesian brown faces are the living record of the 2 inherited bloodlines. Harry L. Shapiro, an anthropologist who studied the people of Pitcairn Island in 1936, stated the Islanders, ‘have never had to eat the bitter bread of social or economic injustice. Isolated in their fertile Island…they have an abundance of food, nutritious and varied. They are inferior to no one’. 

The exhibition will feature 4 representatives from each of the 8 families that arrived on Norfolk are represented by the Council of Elders. The subjects will range in age from young people through to the elderly. The portraits for this exhibition will depict the physical beauty, character, humour, charisma, and intelligence of the Islanders, so noted by past historians. There will be a gender balance in the portraits and subsequent Exhibition.

4.  The Exhibition

The medium of photography has undergone remarkable transformations recently. Technology has changed the world and a good photo has the potential to change mind-sets. The old adage, ‘a picture tells a thousand words’ is appropriate given the story this community has to tell. The sustainability of the Exhibition will come from the visitors to the Island. A quality book depicting faces of the community will make a wonderful gift for friends and family. It will also provide a mechanism in which visitors to the Island which support the fight for the Islanders self-determination to provide assistance. Depending on the popularity of the coffee-table book, the concept of this visual memory may be continued in following years.

·  The Coffee Table Book

A Momento photo book is a priceless keepsake that can be enjoyed for generations. Momento offers quality printing and binding in order to preserve these images for years. Momento products are made in Sydney, Australia. Momento offers the first 10 pages of any publication free and offers discounts of 25% on orders of more than 50 copies.

One page will be dedicated to each image. Each page will also contain (an appropriately attributed) verse or phrase relating to democracy, self-determination and/or fundamental freedoms.

·  The Centre for Democracy

NIPD’s Centre for Democracy (CD) is a former retail outlet located in the Centre of Town. It has been provided free-of-charge by a local resident to NIPD to conduct their education and outreach activities. Being in the centre of town, the CD will have a high volume of foot traffic offering a excellent opportunity for visitors and locals alike to visit the centre and also demonstrate their support for the Islanders fight for self-determination.


[1] The female descendants of the Bounty mutineers were among the first of the world to enjoy equal suffrage from 1838, until his right too, was taken from them.

[2] CSOs are voluntary organizations with governance and direction coming from citizens or constituency members, without significant government-controlled participation or representation. http://www.cn.undp.org/content/dam Accessed 28 July, 2015

[3]NIPD recognises that if Norfolk is to have the same opportunities as Pitcairn ( a UN recognised Non Self-Governing territory with the right to a vote on Self-Determination), then it is important that Norfolk grows its visibility, communications with and develop partnerships with potential partners including CSO’s, nations and territories and specialised multilateral development agencies. This Exhibition is one tool that can potentially commence these communications.

[4] One extra photograph will comprise the empty NI Legislative Assembly Building which remains vacant, a tangible monument to the Island’s loss of democracy.
