loosely formed group of Islanders who share her views. 
Rhonda has managed many
cultural, creative and innovative projects including a 25 piece exhibition
representing the living cultures of all member states of the Council of Pacific
Arts. This exhibition remains permanently displayed through SPC headquarters in
Noumea, New Caledonia. Rhonda has also created, managed and curated an
Exhibition of Maori ‘weaving’ works, in partnership with the Norfolk Island
Museums. Accompanying this 2-week exhibition, were 5 renowned weavers and a
traditional elder from New Zealand; during this event, they conducted workshops
and gave demonstrations and presentations to the local community.  
· 
Hari
Frohling
The photographer, Hari
Frohling is a Norfolk Islander of Pitcairn Island descent. He is a professional
photographer based in Sydney, Australia.  Hari’s interest in photography
began when he was 18 years old and doing an apprenticeship as an automotive
mechanic, mixing and producing music on the side. This was the beginning of
Hari’s creative pursuits. At 22 Hari studied graphic design, learning composition,
colour theory and print standards.  Hari
is currently studying for an advanced diploma in screen media. In 2015, Hari
was awarded ‘Best Cinematographer
(Documentary)’ for his film ‘Cobbler’. This exhibition will be the first
major photographic exhibition for this award-winning up and coming young Island
talent who says photography, ‘is what I love doing. I believe with persistence
and motivation you can achieve anything’. 

· 
Norfolk
Island People for Democracy (NIPD)
NIPD is an
incorporated Civil Society Organisation[2] (CSO)
that comprises over 1000 members of the Norfolk Island community (including the
Norfolk Diaspora). NIPD was formed following the abolishment of the Norfolk
Island Parliament. It is a representative, professional, committed and
informed association planning for the long-term[3]NIPD’s Vision is: ‘Norfolk Island Listed as a Non-Self-Governing Territory with the United
Nations;  its mission: “Assist the
Norfolk Island community make informed decisions about their future governance.
NIPD seeks
to ensure democracy on Norfolk Island is assured for future generations.  This Exhibition aims to begin the nation-building activity essential prior
to any vote of self-determination.
.
· 
The
Community Subjects
Norfolk
Islanders are the ‘Children of Polynesia’; a distinct and separate People with a
unique language, traditions and culture. The physical beauty of their heritage
has been remarked on for centuries. From their Tahitian foremothers, they
received the gift of ‘beauty’; George Robertson, master of the first English
ship in Tahiti noted, ‘when all our boats
returned to ship all the sailors swore they never saw handsomer made women in
all their lives’.  
Joseph
Campbell in his report on Norfolk Island and its inhabitants in 1879 stated,
‘the race are, as a rule, good looking, well made, affectionate, simple in
their manners and ideas, and very intelligent’. Ian Ball in 1973 noted the
hazel eyes and Polynesian brown faces are the living record of the 2 inherited
bloodlines. Harry L. Shapiro, an anthropologist who studied the people of
Pitcairn Island in 1936, stated the Islanders, ‘have never had to eat the
bitter bread of social or economic injustice. Isolated in their fertile Island…they
have an abundance of food, nutritious and varied. They are inferior to no
one’.  
The
exhibition will feature 4 representatives from each of the 8 families that
arrived on Norfolk are represented by the Council of Elders. The subjects will
range in age from young people through to the elderly. The portraits for this
exhibition will depict the physical beauty, character, humour, charisma, and
intelligence of the Islanders, so noted by past historians. There will be a
gender balance in the portraits and subsequent Exhibition. 
4. 
The Exhibition
The medium of
photography has undergone remarkable transformations recently. Technology has
changed the world and a good photo has the potential to change mind-sets. The
old adage, ‘a picture tells a thousand words’ is appropriate given the story
this community has to tell. The sustainability of the Exhibition will come from
the visitors to the Island. A quality book depicting faces of the community
will make a wonderful gift for friends and family. It will also provide a mechanism
in which visitors to the Island which support the fight for the Islanders
self-determination to provide assistance. Depending on the popularity of the coffee-table
book, the concept of this visual memory may be continued in following years.
· 
The
Coffee Table Book
A Momento photo book is
a priceless keepsake that can be enjoyed for generations. Momento offers quality
printing and binding in order to preserve these images for years. Momento
products are made in Sydney, Australia. Momento offers the first 10 pages of
any publication free and offers discounts of 25% on orders of more than 50
copies. 
One page will be
dedicated to each image. Each page will also contain (an appropriately
attributed) verse or phrase relating to democracy, self-determination and/or
fundamental freedoms. 
· 
The
Centre for Democracy
NIPD’s Centre for
Democracy (CD) is a former retail outlet located in the Centre of Town. It has
been provided free-of-charge by a local resident to NIPD to conduct their
education and outreach activities. Being in the centre of town, the CD will
have a high volume of foot traffic offering a excellent opportunity for
visitors and locals alike to visit the centre and also demonstrate their
support for the Islanders fight for self-determination. 


[1] The female descendants of
the Bounty mutineers were among the
first of the world to enjoy equal suffrage from 1838, until his right too, was
taken from them.



[2] CSOs are voluntary
organizations with governance and direction coming from citizens or
constituency members, without significant government-controlled participation
or representation. http://www.cn.undp.org/content/dam Accessed 28 July, 2015



[3]NIPD
recognises that if Norfolk is to have the same opportunities as Pitcairn ( a UN
recognised Non Self-Governing territory with the right to a vote on
Self-Determination), then it is important that Norfolk grows its visibility,
communications with and develop partnerships with potential partners including
CSO’s, nations and territories and specialised multilateral development
agencies. This Exhibition is one tool that can potentially commence these
communications. 



[4] One extra photograph will comprise the empty NI Legislative Assembly Building
which remains vacant, a tangible monument to the Island’s loss of democracy.

story:
What do I want to do?

People dance, people fly, people cry, make love, fight wars even, and I wanna sail and share the feeling. So I thought, why not making a sailing club for catamarans in Jelsa, on island of Hvar, Croatia. I started to sail with Hobie cat 17, and even though it's a small boat (5 meters long, 2,5 meters wide and has a mast 9 meters high), but it's an extremely fast boat (up to 40 km/h). But the most important of it all, it has nothing but sails. 

As I love the sea, the island of Hvar and sailing, I've decided to form a sailing club where people will be able to share the sailing experience and learn how to sail with those kind of boats. The sailing club will also encourage and hold lectures, ateliers and presentation from diverse, but compatible areas: culture, education, sport, sustainable development, multimedia and wellness.
It's base camp will be placed in our family vineyard, which is right on the shore of the sea. There I've planted Mediterranean plants (olives, lavender and so on) and arranged all the field to be people friendly.
So now I'm stepping forward in search for people that share a passion for creating good and positive stuff. Before my head explodes from ideas and desire to create meaningful things worth living for, I 'm asking you, to help me make this project come true. Contribute to our project and be a  part of better tomorrow. By doing that, you will help to make yet one more positive place on the planet whose doors will be opened for all of you.
All the contributors will be awarded with gifts: our products (olive oil, wine, lavender oil etc.), t-shirts with Ka Boom logo, possibility to sail with us, Ka Boom postcards handwritten by me and my eight year old nephew (he doesn't know that yet, but he will :), guided tours on the island, seven days stay in Jelsa and so on.

OUR PERKS AS YOUR BIRTHDAY PRESENT!
Invest in our project and let us send our perks as your birthday present, or even a Christmas, New years present!, to someone you care about! Just provide us with the address, and we'll make sure she/he receives back all the love you gave us with your help. :)
After rain, there will be Sun and than we sail! :)

And for daily updates of the project, you can follow this link:

https://www.facebook.com/kaboomsailing/


Who are islanders and why should we sail?


Following is a detailed description of the project:

Who am I?

I've been living with passion ever sense I was born. When I loved, I loved truly, when I was hurt, I cried sincerely, and when I go, I'll know I gave everything I had in my heart to life itself.
I am a thirty three years old professor of social sciences (sociology, philosophy, politics, ethics, economy and logic) and I used to work in bilingual school in Zagreb, Croatia. I was teaching mentioned subjects on French, English and Croatian. Besides that, I worked as a librarian, tourist guide, skipper, waiter, journalist, and even as an actor/director. Bunch of stuff, all in all. And, I am proud to say that where ever I went or worked, people where happy and willing to share their time with me. I love people and  believe we must search everywhere for a way to make them smile, because their smile will be our own fulfillment. 
I was born in Banja Luka (Bosnia and Herzegovina), but I've spent most of my life in Croatia. My mother is from Bosnia (Banja Luka) and my father is from Croatia (Jelsa, island of Hvar). Therefor I am a mix of Bosnian heart (for those who don't know; Bosnian heart is full of laughter and love) and islands persistence and will. As everybody, I also have my flaws, but I try to correct them daily.
During my lifetime, I've finished university (master of science), learned to speak three languages fluently (unfortunately I haven't been using German for years, and I'm kind of rusty, but it will come back), lived in only three states (Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and France), worked all over the place, managed to earn enough money to make a movie, that I believed in (it was shown on a few film festivals), had an exhibition of sculptures (that I make, when I have some free time), recently learned to play guitar, and went into sports (triathlon and sailing).
I am sincerely driven by will to create and to fully live and experience  life, and that is what I have to offer to the world.


What am I aiming at?
Ever sense I was a little boy I used to go to work in our fields with my brothers and our father. My brothers and I, we were the rarest ones, of young people, who still worked in the filed, thank to my fathers scary look. Even though I hated it when I was fourteen, as anybody would at that time, now I am proud of my heritage. 
Today, as I love sailing and immense beauties of island of Hvar, I want to develop a sailing club in Jelsa, island of Hvar. A club that will offer both: experience of sailing with catamarans and the experience of island of Hvar.  The club itself will hold various lectures, events, presentations, practical experience of sailing with Hobie cat, but also gather people who want to learn and share.



What will you be helping to create?
  • From social point of view - you will help to create a place where people come to share and learn. A place that will provide a start point for those who want to share with others, and present themselves to others, through lectures, presentations, exhibitions etc. A place where languages and  cultures will be exchanged.
  • From business point of view - you will be investing in the club that will employ people: sailing instructors, tourist guides, linguists, participants of further different projects etc.
  • From development point of view - multi-hull (catamaran) sailing is rather unknown in Croatia, and you will be making it more accessible in here. And also you will be investing in development of rural region.
  • From human point of view - once, you will come, you will see what you helped to create, and we will sit down, I'll poor you a glass of wine, I'll thank you from the bottom of my heart and we'll enjoy the day.


What have I done regarding the project until today?

I had approximately 5000€ saved and through one year: 
  • I bought a boat (Hobie cat 17) and brought it to Jelsa from Slovenia.
  • I've learned to sail with it.
  • In our field/vineyard, that will eventually become a sailing base camp: I've fixed most of the stone walls. That makes around 100 meters of stone walls, high between one and two meters, and wide around half of meter. I've shoveled all the terraces and planted new plants (in Dalmatia, on the islands, we have terraces in the fields. As the ground is not flat, people created years before terraces.)
  • I've made a sewer system (which will be later on connected to the base hut, a small structure, which will be used for lectures, presentation,  safekeeping the equipment and so on.)
  • I've planted olive trees, grapes, lavender, and other Mediterranean plants.
  • I've officially started and registered an association called Ka Boom with an aim of promotion and development of culture, sustainable development, physical activity and healthy living  (Klub alternative Boom, meaning Club of alternative Boom; boom is a part of the boat. Starting an association is rather complicated in Croatia, it took me over a month time; which is actually great. Making a sewer system was way easy comparing to administration :)
  • I've a applied for Erasmus+ in Sports, and even though I missed the deadline (as it took a long time to get all the documents from administration), I've established communication with different organisations all around Europe wiling to participate in events yet to come.
  • As the land, where our sailing base will be placed, was never officially divided between owners (grandma and her relatives), it took me a year to get all the documents in order. But now it's done. (That means I've payed a lawyer and the court.)
All of it, with 5000€ and lots of muscle work.
(the picture was taken right after all the works, so it will take time for the plants to grow)


What We Need & What You Get


We need:

  • financial aide
  • people that can afford themselves to come and give me a hand with work in the field
  • people that can help me with making an internet presentation
  • people that want to create

All the investments will be spent to accomplish the following:

  • bringing the water supply line to the field (currently we are 100 meters away from a water supply line),
  • establishing electricity supply system with usage of solar system,
  • finish the work in the filed/ex-vineyard (meaning: finishing the stone walls - there is 30 meters left. Connecting a sewer system to the base. Making the field accessible to people.),
  • making a hut where all the equipment will be held and where people will be able to participate in club activities (not a house, but a Thai shack),
  • opening a sailing club,
  • making a refrigerator that works using wind (I found the instructions how to make it, on the pages of university in Canada. Some awesome young people patented it.)
  • making an internet platform,
  • of course, for sending different gifts and gratitude expressions to all the investors
  • and hopefully, if possible, buying an additional catamaran. 
What can we do for you:
  • we will ship all our products mentioned in the perks (of course, depending if we can ship food to your country: it depends of export-import law) and provide you with all other services pointed out in the perks
  • and when everything is done, you all will be invited for the grand opening (food, music, sailing and laughter. If you can't come, we'll have to do it again, no other way :))
Where the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal:

  • I will reach the goal, no matter what. I came until here using my hands, will and my time. The sum of money that I'm asking for is really nothing compared to where I'm going and if the money is the only reason to give up, than there is no reason at all.

The Impact


There are diverse positive influences of your investment:

  • for parents: You have kids and you wish them the best. They are often on social networks and nothing seems much important to them. One of the ideas that will follow Ka Boom is employment or volunteering internship for young people, where they will be thought and obligated, while working, to use different languages, to respect the nature and others, and gain confidence in themselves, by managing a sail boat and learning new skills.
  • for a business-man or a business-woman: we will create a possibilities of a team building adventures. Dependence on each other is the most explicit on the sea. And after it, confidence and joy is what it stays for all time.
  • for local society and enterprises: revitalization of islands in Croatia.
  • for economy in general: creating a product that brings added value to the table.
  • for NGO-s: possibility to participate in our events as a partners and to use our spaces (or aide) for their own presentations.
  • for an average person: you helped to create a small business, and when in need, you'll receive all the aide, within our power, from us. 


Risks & Challenges


  • The biggest challenge is following your own dream. I have let go of everything and now for a year and half I'm constantly working on development of this project.
  • My tactics is rather simple: keep on going with opened heart, strong will and never stop trying. Work and be persistent. The only thing I can loose is myself, by letting go of a dream.
Challenges:
  • development of a creative businesses in a small rural area and cooperation with others
  • obtaining all the needed documents from government to be eligible for businesses 
  • have the strength and courage to enter in a new area of expertise 
  • learning how to communicate with different organisations and enterprises
  • connecting with others with the intention to create events and finding people willing to participate
  • finding a market


Other Ways You Can Help


  • send the word out
  • send me an e-mail with your thoughts about my idea. When one is walking by himself, sometimes a worm word can mean all the world.
  • maybe you can come and volunteer, we'll work on the filed, we'll go out sailing, we'll make better tomorrow.

Thank you for your time, for it's the most valuable thing we have.

story:
My name is Jane Copeland and I am a chef/entrepeneur opening Lift Breakfast Bakery Ltd in Lower Lonsdale, North Vancouver very soon!

With classic European training in culinary arts and a broad range of kitchen experiences since including Chamber (Vancouver, BC), The Wickaninnish Inn (Tofino, BC), Mission Hill Family Estate Winery (Kelowna, BC), Arzak (3 Michelin Star, Spain), and El Bulli (3 Michelin Star, Spain), I return home to apply the best of what I have learned to the food I love to cook (and eat!) -  baking and breakfast!

Lift will not only showcases the finest food I can possibly make, it will also embody my love affair with the concept of a neighbourhood corner (fittingly accurate!) bakery.  I want to build a place where people always feel at home whether they are rushing through for a loaf of bread, coming for a special treat, or relaxing over weekend brunch.  

The design process has been more challenging and drawn-out that anticipated largely due to the building's heritage status.  These delays in opening have compounded extra expenses on top of this project.  But I am not about to let this stop me because I believe that Lift is meant to be at 101 Lonsdale and if you do too, unite and help BRING LIFT TO LIFE!

Here is what I propose because I would never ask for help without feeding you in return!

Contribute to BRING LIFT TO LIFE and rest assured that your hard-earned money will translate into delicious baking, eggs bennies, or even a private dining experience down the road (see perks).

Collectively we can reach the $25,000 goal which will cover the kitchen exhaust system necessary to be accommodated in this unique heritage building.

Help make my dream a reality and give a shout out to women in small business as an important part of your community. If you are unable to support financially but believe in the project, please spread the word!
story_txt:
My name is Jane Copeland and I am a chef/entrepeneur opening Lift Breakfast Bakery Ltd in Lower Lonsdale, North Vancouver very soon!
With classic European training in culinary arts and a broad range of kitchen experiences since including Chamber (Vancouver, BC), The Wickaninnish Inn (Tofino, BC), Mission Hill Family Estate Winery (Kelowna, BC), Arzak (3 Michelin Star, Spain), and El Bulli (3 Michelin Star, Spain), I return home to apply the best of what I have learned to the food I love to cook (and eat!) -  baking and breakfast!
Lift will not only showcases the finest food I can possibly make, it will also embody my love affair with the concept of a neighbourhood corner (fittingly accurate!) bakery.  I want to build a place where people always feel at home whether they are rushing through for a loaf of bread, coming for a special treat, or relaxing over weekend brunch.  
The design process has been more challenging and drawn-out that anticipated largely due to the building's heritage status.  These delays in opening have compounded extra expenses on top of this project.  But I am not about to let this stop me because I believe that Lift is meant to be at 101 Lonsdale and if you do too, unite and help BRING LIFT TO LIFE!
Here is what I propose because I would never ask for help without feeding you in return!
Contribute to BRING LIFT TO LIFE and rest assured that your hard-earned money will translate into delicious baking, eggs bennies, or even a private dining experience down the road (see perks).
Collectively we can reach the $25,000 goal which will cover the kitchen exhaust system necessary to be accommodated in this unique heritage building.
Help make my dream a reality and give a shout out to women in small business as an important part of your community. If you are unable to support financially but believe in the project, please spread the word!

story:
Hello

Write A House is a twist on the traditional writer's residency. We award permanent homes to emerging writers in the city of Detroit to create long term residents in vibrant communities struggling with long-term vacancy. We renovate vacant, dilapidated houses while providing job training on our construction sites for Detroiters. We've already awarded three homes to writers—forever, for keeps—and are now fundraising for our fourth house. With your help, we'll be able to complete the house by September 2016.

A donation of any size helps us turn a blighted house into a home for a talented, creative individual committed to living in Detroit. These homes provide a space for writers to focus on their craft, explore a city emerging from a financial crisis, and participate in a lively, diverse Detroit community. Our apprenticeship program with Detroiters Working for Environmental Justice bridges the gap between job training and full-time employment so that we can ensure that there is a place for everyone in Detroit's revitalization, particularly for people who may have struggled to find employment opportunities in the past. 
Learn more at writeahouse.org

What We Need 

Your donation will have a direct impact on: 

  • community stabilization 
  • literary arts 
  • AND job training.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand. But there are other ways to help by getting the word out. Some ideas:

  • Email everyone you know
  • Tweet about @Writeahouse
  • Mention us on facebook
  • Follow us on instagram 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who is Gem City Fine Foods?

Gem City Fine Foods is a dedicated gluten-free bakery, certified by the GFCO and CSA, located in West Valley City, UT. 

Blossom Fine Foods was founded in 2005 by Beverly Hill, and opened for business in 2006 as a neighborhood bakery in Salt Lake City, Utah.  Richard (Ricky) Kent partnered in Blossom Fine Foods as a venture capitalist in 2006.  In April 2010, Beverly sold her portion of the business to Ricky, who retained 100% ownership and reorganized management of Blossom Fine Foods. In 2015, as a result of a trademark dispute, the company name changed from Blossom Fine Foods to Gem City Fine Foods, LLC (GCFF.) 

Our Mission is to build the Gem City brand as the premiere provider of delicious gluten-free desserts.

"I just want to make millions of people happy!" says our Owner and Managing Member, Ricky Kent.
Gem City desserts fill a niche for a truly delicious alternative to the typical gluten free sweets available on store shelves. Celiacs, gluten intolerant, and health conscious eaters who look for premium natural ingredients are all served by our company as we provide an array of cheesecakes, flourless chocolate torte, carrot and vegan chocolate cake and brownies to retail and food service establishments around the country.

But we need to continue to expand our facility, product line and distribution in order to reach these consumers who try our product and express gratitude that suddenly they can eat dessert again!

Straight from the mouth of our owner himself: 

"We are building a national brand that serves a customer whose diet is otherwise compromised. We want you to be able to be proud to be involved in taking a small company and building a national brand. When you see our product on the shelf, you can say, 'Wow! I helped!' We have worked hard over the past few years to build and maintain relationships with retailers, distributors, brokers, and professionals engaged in serving the celiac and gluten free population. And we have built a loyal customer base around the country, of not only celiac and gluten intolerant diners, but those who enjoy a truly high quality specialty dessert."

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $120,000 to take our business to the next level of national brand building. How will we use your contribution?

1. Increase presence at trade shows, gluten and allergen free and celiac events, and in the media ($60,000); and 

2. Develop and launch four new products in the next 12 months ($60,000).

Facts: 

  • Participation in a trade show or expo costs an average of about $5,000.
  • Sending samples to, negotiating with a prospective retail or food service buyer, requires a lot of time and money, on average about $3,000.
  • Promoting product through ads, postcards and other media avenues- well, that can be pretty pricey!
  • Retail placement fees can be as high as $5,000 to $30,000, and distributors require promotional deals for new store openings and new points of distribution. 
  • Maintaining visibility and relationships requires all of the above as a company builds its brand and increases its market. 
  • Introduction of new items on a regular basis helps keep us visible with retailers, distributors and of course, hungry customers! 
  • An enrober, which puts ganache around our number one selling Flourless Chocolate Torte, will save about 50% on labor spent at this task.

We are offering a number of unique kitchen- and bakery-related perks for contributors, including coffee mugs, aprons, lunch bags, cookbooks, and our delicious Gem City Fine Foods desserts! And you will gain the satisfaction of knowing you help employ good people AND provide gourmet gluten free goodies to people who otherwise would not be able to enjoy  such a dessert.

Each contribution will be measured against the most pressing need, so that all contributions will be used toward a timely goal from the above list. 

Any money raised in excess of our goal will be used to help retire a lease for equipment purchased to allow us to meet increasing orders ($60,000);

The Impact of Your Help

Gem City Fine Foods is a dedicated gluten free bakery, certified gluten free by both the Gluten Free Certification Organization (GFCO) and the Celiac Support Association (CSA.) Dual certification is rare in the industry, and demonstrates our commitment to providing gluten free desserts that pass the strictest testing standards. 

Celiac disease affects 1% of healthy, average Americans. That means at least 3 million people in our country are living with celiac disease—97% of them are undiagnosed. Type 1 Diabetes affects 3 million people; 6% (180,000) of those diagnosed also have celiac disease. (Celiac Disease Center of the Chicago Medical Center)

A 2015 Gallup poll reported that 1 in 5 Americans actively include gluten free foods in their diets.

Challenges and How We Will Meet Them

The food industry is very competitive. Building a national brand is incredibly time consuming and requires really standing out. The money we will raise in th is campaign will help us maximize those efforts. 

How are we particularly qualified to pull this off with your help?

  • We have been in business, a solid team under a dedicated owner, for five years, building relationships with food  industry professionals and celiac and gluten free consumers. We know how to maneuver in the industry. 
  • We are dedicated. About half of small businesses fail within the first four to five years (The Washington Post 2014), but we are still here, confident in our ability to become a household brand for those whose diet is compromised, as well as fine dessert lovers at large. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to our campaign, you can help spread the word:

  • Please tell your celiac, gluten-free and other friends who appreciate a fine dessert.
  • Use our Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign on Facebook.
  • If you refer a friend who contributes to our campaign, we will send you a thank-you goodie.

Thank you for helping us build a national brand of gluten-free desserts for those suffering from celiac disease, gluten intolerance, and otherwise appreciate a top quality gourmet dessert!

story:
Hello,

We have our space officially leased at Selby and Victoria! So many thanks to people who have donated to this idea in our first round. We wanted a round 2 to give people more opportunities to get in on the restaurant perks before we open. Please stay connected to our facebook page for updates. 

Some more notes: 

-Ramen Party is on the 20th of August, and may be extended to 2 days if we go over limits on ticket sales.


-Phase 2 is all about pre sales on our party and of course, ramen! Our ramen is going at a rate of $10-$15 per bowl, so you will save if you purchase now. Why? Your donations will help us acquire the needed equipment so we can have a strong start. We have the lease as stated above, but we need to make sure that every piece of our restaurant is assembled well before we open the doors. Your help will get us there. 


-Our food is currently being set up with organic, free range, and local products. This is huge. This means a local noodle maker is making our noodle recipe as we speak, free range birds are being supplied from only the best purveyor (being raised right now), and produce that is GMO free being either wild or organic, depending on the seasons of course. Only 5% of our menu will be made from products not acquired or made in this state. Minnesota ramen anyone? 100% of our menu will not contain corn syrups, GMO's, artificial flavors or colors, MSG, and processed ingredients. No ramen shop in the nation can make this claim.

-Our recipes are tried and true, evidenced by Ramen Monday's and many publications, local and national. Vegetarian recipes will not be overlooked, only the best for non meat eaters. 


Thank you everyone,

Jason&Asiya

story:
The Alfaro family is ready for adventure.  Steph, Jorge, J.D., Isaac, Maire and Snip, our semi-toothless mini-schnauzer, all plan to move to Kauai from Boston in July.  As soon as we arrive, we will be using funds to start Waimea Picnic Tours.

Waimea Picnic Tours will offer guided tours of Waimea Canyon (the Grand Canyon of the Pacific) and Koke'e State Park with a gourmet picnic en route served by their driver, Jorge aka Koki (that guy in the picture above). 

This project grew out of the fact that Steph (woman in the picture above) drove up Waimea Canyon by herself and nearly passed out.  Steph, you see, is not a fan of heights.  Another thing that happened while climbing the canyon road was that she got hungry and wished she had packed a picnic or, at the very least, a snack.  The parks are very large and can take several hours to cover completely.  Thus, Steph started thinking about ways this great tourist attraction could be made more accessible and comfortable to the average (and hungry!) tourist.  To her surprise, there was only one dedicated tour of the area and was offered in a large bus, not exactly an intimate experience.  Further, there are absolutely NO picnic tours offered on island which means there is potential for Waimea Picnic Tours to expand to other areas in future years.

Your pledge will help us fund all things included in this venture from expenses getting to the island  to the van itself.  

Once in Kauai (goal date is July 15, 2016), all steps will be completed to make Waimea Picnic Tours fully operational by September 1, 2016.    We have already established the beginning of a partnership with a small market on island called Living Foods Market and Cafe in Poipu (http://shoplivingfoods.com) to provide the fresh, local, organic catering for the tour.  Further, we have made connections on island to help promote and book our business once there.  

How will you know how it's going?  Luckily, Steph is a writer who has been keeping a blog for a couple years and has just purchased the domain name for it.  The blog can be found at www.tiredirish.com.  She will write about all the adventures in starting up this business there and will be sure to mention you by name for any help you offer! If you wish, terms for advertisement space on the blog and future company website could be arranged for larger contributions.  Further, Steph also has a standing offer to write a column for The Garden Island Newspaper in which she will be writing about the adventures of moving a family from Boston to Kauai as well as Waimea Picnic Tours, of course.  

By helping fund Waimea Picnic Tours, you'll be giving an awesomely quirky little family the chance to offer something no one else on island is offering.  Further, you have the chance to claim a "perk" and reserve a tour today for when you visit!  Claim a VIP Champagne Picnic Tour and you will be driven from one end of the island to the other while being wined and dined the entire way.  That is worth its weight in gold as it is one of the most amazing places you'll ever visit and to see it in gourmet comfort is unbeatable. 

Please join this adventure and make it your own as well!  We'll be waiting with leis and champagne.

Mahalo!

story:
F♀unders Project will interview inspiring women entrepreneurs around the world and tell their stories through a docuseries. We all know Steve Jobs, Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, all amazing entrepreneurs. What about the women? Our goal is to identify, connect and promote female role models so women can be inspired and empowered to take the first step to create amazing companies, and leave their mark! 

We need your commitment and contribution to kick-off  this project!
During this first year we will go to more than 20 countries to interview women entrepreneurs on 5 continents, and key players who are connected with their local entrepreneurial environments. In addition to the docuseries, we'll do market research and networking, and test several ideas to further support women entrepreneurship such as: a knowledge base for teenage girls to learn about entrepreneurship; global mentorship platform for beginning women entrepreneurs; designing a matchmaking environment for investors and women entrepreneurs.

We need your support to cover our costs during this first year. Your contribution will bring these stories to life and help us with equipment, transportation, lodging, and other expenses.

Interviews started in  July 2016 and we estimate that the episodes will begin to air starting February/2017.

Women entrepreneurship must be supported in every possible way by men and women. It is the key to help us grow economically and socially.

We created great perks and we will share with you our discoveries and amazing stories while we are on the road.

Take a look at the perks' list and select one that most suits you!

Reaching our campaign goal will be awesome, but bringing these stories and further support women entrepreneurs will be even more amazing!!!

Our Plan 

Our selection represents a mix of countries where women face highly favorable conditions for entrepreneurship and others where they don't.

They will come from different industries, all ages, and most importantly, have gone above and beyond to pursue their business ideas!

Contribute by donating to our campaign and sharing it with friends and family!

Follow us on social media and receive regular news from the road!

Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Our Webpage

Thank you so much!! Looking forward to seeing you on the road!

Fernanda &Taciana

story:
Leni braucht Liebe! (und Eure Moneten <3 )


Liebe Gemeinde, treue Fans und Beischläfer, 
Erinnert Ihr Euch noch daran, wie trist und grau es alles war, bevor das Tirrée in Euer Leben gekommen ist? Nein? Richtig, denn Ihr habt diese furchtbare Zeit VERDRÄNGT - zu Recht! :-)))

Wer ist Leni? 

Weil wir ja die Mission haben, *ganz* Moabit glücklich zu machen und nicht nur den Osten, sondern auch den Westen unserer Insel, soll das Tirrée eine kleine Schwester an der Gotzkowskybruecke bekommen: Das "Leni"! 
Wir, Roland und Stefan, haben uns auf den ersten Blick in Leni verliebt... na gut, zumindest in die Idee von Leni, denn real ist der Platz noch eine ziemlich heruntergekommene Bruchbude. Aber Fantasie war ja immer schon unsere Stärke...! *hust*


Warum muss das alles so sauteuer sein???

Wie immer kostet die ganze Renovierung natürlich wieder viiiiiieeeel, viiiiiieeeel mehr als ursprünglich geplant. Und da der Ferrari auch schon in der Werkstatt und die Rolex kaputt ist, schnorren wir jetzt ungehemmt unserer treue Gemeinde an! :-) 

Du kriegst auch was dafür! 

Von nix kommt nix, wissen wir auch... 

Deshalb haben wir uns TOTAL TOLLE DINGE ausgedacht, die Du bekommst, wenn Du uns hilfst, unseren Traum vom "Leni" wahr werden zu lassen: 

Wolltest Du immer schon mal eine Nacht mit Stefan.... na-ha-hein, VIEL besser: 

Zum Beispiel eine Tirree Spezial Cocktail-Schule oder ein Drink im "Leni", der nur nach Dir benannt ist! 


Egal, ob es 5 oder 5000 Euro sind, die Du beisteuerst: Wir freuen uns über Deine Unterstützung und Geburtsthilfe für "Leni"! 


Ach, und: Teilt, teilt, teilt diese Kampagne! Ich will uns auf Facebook und Twitter sehen! <3 


Danke!!!!! Love!!! 

Stefan & Roland & Karl 

(und alle, die "Leni" kennenlernen wollen)
story_txt:
Leni braucht Liebe! (und Eure Moneten <3 )Liebe Gemeinde, treue Fans und Beischläfer, Erinnert Ihr Euch noch daran, wie trist und grau es alles war, bevor das Tirrée in Euer Leben gekommen ist? Nein? Richtig, denn Ihr habt diese furchtbare Zeit VERDRÄNGT - zu Recht! :-)))Wer ist Leni? Weil wir ja die Mission haben, *ganz* Moabit glücklich zu machen und nicht nur den Osten, sondern auch den Westen unserer Insel, soll das Tirrée eine kleine Schwester an der Gotzkowskybruecke bekommen: Das "Leni"! Wir, Roland und Stefan, haben uns auf den ersten Blick in Leni verliebt... na gut, zumindest in die Idee von Leni, denn real ist der Platz noch eine ziemlich heruntergekommene Bruchbude. Aber Fantasie war ja immer schon unsere Stärke...! *hust*

Warum muss das alles so sauteuer sein???Wie immer kostet die ganze Renovierung natürlich wieder viiiiiieeeel, viiiiiieeeel mehr als ursprünglich geplant. Und da der Ferrari auch schon in der Werkstatt und die Rolex kaputt ist, schnorren wir jetzt ungehemmt unserer treue Gemeinde an! :-) Du kriegst auch was dafür!  Von nix kommt nix, wissen wir auch... Deshalb haben wir uns TOTAL TOLLE DINGE ausgedacht, die Du bekommst, wenn Du uns hilfst, unseren Traum vom "Leni" wahr werden zu lassen: Wolltest Du immer schon mal eine Nacht mit Stefan.... na-ha-hein, VIEL besser: Zum Beispiel eine Tirree Spezial Cocktail-Schule oder ein Drink im "Leni", der nur nach Dir benannt ist! Egal, ob es 5 oder 5000 Euro sind, die Du beisteuerst: Wir freuen uns über Deine Unterstützung und Geburtsthilfe für "Leni"! Ach, und: Teilt, teilt, teilt diese Kampagne! Ich will uns auf Facebook und Twitter sehen! <3 Danke!!!!! Love!!! Stefan & Roland & Karl (und alle, die "Leni" kennenlernen wollen)

story:
Hello!

My name is Lydia Cowles and I’m the owner of Twenty-Seventh Heaven, LLC a scratch bake shop I am trying to open on the South Hill of Spokane. I am a Navy Veteran, a certified Pastry Chef, and I love baking. There is a problem. Currently if you want to get heavenly coffee cake, fresh bread, or cupcakes  in Spokane you would have to make multiple stops to get all of the items on your list. Especially if you want your baked goods made from scratch and with as many local ingredients as possible. My bake shop will offer heavenly coffee cake that will be the best in Spokane. I will also be the one stop shop for all your baked good needs. No need to drive all over town to get all the things on your list! 

At Twenty-Seventh Heaven I already have my LLC certificate. I will specialize in heavenly coffee cake, fresh breads, and cupcakes, all baked from scratch using the most local ingredients I can get my hands on. You can choose any of these delicious items and sit down to have a cup of coffee to enjoy with your treats if you’ve got a few minutes. My shop will have a modern-retro feel as soon as you step through my door. A hand painted, vintage-inspired “open/closed” sign on the front door, simple kraft boxes tied with baker’s twine to take your order to go, and antique appetizer plates with matching cups if you’re going to enjoy your treats while you are there.

I graduated from Whitworth College in 2005, worked retail for about 5 years, then decided to join the Navy as an officer. As my time in active duty was nearing its end I started thinking about what I wanted to do when I got out. So I tinkered with baking scratch vanilla cupcakes. The flavor difference between them and what you get from the store or a box was incredible! They were amazing! Ever since, I’ve been hooked. I love seeing how much others enjoy what I have made and getting to incorporate my creative side as well. 

I went to Spokane Community College to get my baking certification and finished that this past winter. As I’ve gone through the Integrated Business and Entrepreneurship program and getting into the nitty-gritty of owning my own business, I’ve come to realize I can’t do it alone. So I plan to have one employee working for me to start and we’ll go from there. I found some very influential mentors going through the baking program. Both Harry and Katie have vast experience, though very different, in the baking industry. I know I can always go to them for advice and tips when I need them.

This campaign is important to me because it would really give me a huge jumpstart on getting my business open. If my network of friends, family, and acquaintances all average $50 in contributions, I will reach my goal.

What I Need & What You Get

I need approximately $30,000 to get all of my initial equipment and supplies to get my bake shop open. Getting more than that would help out with lease payments and other financial obligations I will have.

Anyone who contributes to my campaign will receive a handwritten Thank You note and a custom Twenty-Seventh Heaven sticker for your car. The sticker will only be given to people who donate to my campaign so you will be part of a very special group! For those who contribute $20-$45 will receive a free cupcake, your choice of flavors. Those who contribute $50-$75 will receive one dozen cupcakes of your choice. Those who contribute $100-$500 will receive 1 full year of Friends & Family Discount (10% off) to enjoy baked goods. Those who contribute $500-$1,000 will receive TWO years of Friends & Family Discount, one whole Coffee Cake, and your name will be added to a plaque that will hang on the wall of my shop for you to be publicly and permanently thanked for your contribution. For those fantastic people who are able to contribute $1,001 or more to my campaign, they will receive a LIFETIME Friends & Family Discount, two whole Coffee Cakes, free Coffee on each visit to my shop, and your name will be added to a plaque that will hang on the wall of my shop to publicly and permanently thank you for your extremely generous contribution to my business.

If I don't reach my goal, I will still use the funds to get as much of my needed equipment and supplies as I can. I will then need to utilize more funds from business loans, which will cause my business to take longer to make a profit.

The Impact

My shop will provide coffeecake that you can’t get enough of, along with fresh artisan breads and delicious cupcakes in one stop. My shop will also benefit the Inland Northwest as I will utilize as many local ingredients as I can get my hands on to support other small businesses. 

Risks & Challenges

I have over 10 years of customer service experience. I finished at the top of my class for the Professional Baking Certification program and my passion for baking surpasses those around me. I believe that my desire to be successful is very strong and I will work tirelessly to make my dreams come true. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily, please spread the word to all ofyour friends and family in hopes that they can contribute. Maybe they'll share their perk with you! If you ever have a campaign, please try out Indigogo and share your links with me and I'll do what I can to help you succeed! Thank you so much for your contribution!

story:
Why do you drink craft beer?

     We believe in making hand crafted beers that are un-intimidating, true to the styles that generations of brewers before us created, and can be enjoyed by all varieties of beer drinkers from the newest craft drinker to the enthusiast.  We want to brew using true and tested ingredients while still adding just a bit of our own styling. Further, we want to use the money that we make while creating this great beer to aid charities in need of support.  So, you get great beer and you help great causes, its like winning twice!

How can you help and what's in it for you?

Opening a brewery, of any size, is expensive. There are multiple licenses, an exhaustive list of equipment and myriad other expenses for which we need capital.  We know that we are asking you to trust us with your hard earned cash, and you can rest assured that we are in this to make something happen.  We know how to make great beer, but we need your help getting some initial capital. You get to help us with our dream, and you get some really sweet swag (rewards) for contributing.

                    Natural Leather Coasters


Stainless Steel Carabiner Bottle Opener      


                 24 oz Ceramic Stein



Hamburgo Stein                        



Psst...hey you....you wanna know a secret? CLICK HERE

What your contributions can do!

Look, we know that craft beer is huge right now.  There are breweries opening everywhere and all of them are vying for your dollars in one form or another.  We understand that it isn't likely to completely fund a brewery from a crowdfunded campaign, but you can make a difference.  Our name and organization are founded on our Christian principles.  Our plans are three fold:

  • Contribute 10% of all profits to local charities, whether it be Homeless Shelters, Women's Shelters, Soup Kitchens, and many others.  This of course may take time, first we need to make a profit. So, in the mean time, we will host special tour nights at the brewery (when opened) where a portion of the proceeds goes towards a specific charity.
  • We will provide opportunities to veterans transitioning from service to civilian life.  Preference will be to vocational rehabilitation and  wounded or disabled veterans. At first it will be unpaid internships, but as we are able to pay salaries will progress to both paid and unpaid internships.
  • We will provide vocational opportunities to ex-convicts.  We will focus on providing opportunities for those trying to get their lives back on track after incarceration.  Our justice system is necessary, but has often failed at the aspect of helping ex-convicts to gain employment and job recommendations.  

We feel like craft beer has become all about the beer.  While obviously it should be about the beer....(it's in the name), craft brewers should follow the suit of other craftsman.  They are members of the community and should help support and give back to that community.

We will prevail....at least that's the plan!

Look, we have given you a rosy colored picture of this whole idea and we mean each word of it.  However, like any business there are inherent risks to attempting to run a business.  Among the many challenges are:

  • Licensing and the time table to get it done.
  • Equipment cost and the time to get it.
  • Monthly costs, they are many and add up, but we'll cut where we can while providing a quality product.
  • Financing, it takes a tremendous amount of money, much of which will be bank financed.
  • Getting the word out about our cause and our product, we need people to demand our beer and champion our plan so that we can grow to provide all the support that we want to support.

You're contributing to an idea...to a product and company that you feel like you can get behind. We appreciate your confidence in us and belief in our mission, but remember, businesses sometimes run into complications. Rest assured, we are in this for the long haul and plan to put our "all" into it!

Spread the word!

We understand that many of you may not be in the position to contribute.  Both of us are working individuals with families and regular lives.  We aren't rich (we wouldn't be asking you to help if we were) and we understand financial strain.  So, what can you do to help, even if you can't contribute?
  • Like and Share our Facebook page, the more people that know, the better off we'll be!
  • Share this Indiegogo campaign with as many of your friends as possible. The more people that know, the more likely we are to be able to make it happen.
  • Spread the word by mouth! If you can't get the word out online then tell people about it.  Next time your having a craft brew at you favorite watering hole or restaurant, tell the waitress, the bartender, the manager and anyone else that will listen about us!Follow us on Facebook


Follow us on Facebook          Follow us on Instagram

story:
Higher Mind Incense: New Heights

 

Behind the Smoke

Hi, my name is Evan Purcell, founder of Higher Mind Incense. I am dedicated to preserving the ancient incense traditions of the world. The philosophy behind our incense is based on the traditional and cultural uses of incense as ancient aroma therapy and its power to restore emotional, mental and spiritual harmony. 

 

 

Our Vision 

Higher Mind Incense is a leader in sustainability, eco-friendliness and integrity in the Western incense market. We support organic cultivation, sustainable wild-harvesting and ethical sourcing of natural incense materials from small companies. Higher Mind has grown from a kitchen table operation to a small business with over 100 commercial accounts.

At this time, we believe we're facing a period of significant growth and we strongly believe in keeping a small business mind-set in our business practices and the way we work with our sources and customers. We're determined to remain humble, focused on our customers and conscientious of the Earth, no matter how large we grow. We are striving to bring the heart back into the mainstream incense industry. 

Where We’ve Been

Higher Mind Incense was established in 2011. In the past few years we've been working towards "greening" our business on many levels. Last year we switched all shipping materials to 100% post-consumer, recyclable and compostable materials. We've successfully “greened” some of our product packaging by using recycled/able materials. We've launched a new line of incense using 100% Organic and Wild-harvested ingredients, ethically sourced from sustainable sources. And we've successfully launched our first online teaching program on the ancient art of incense crafting and the roots of aromatherapy. 

Challenges We Face

In 2015, we purchased an industrial incense cone press from overseas. We've invested hundreds of hours of testing, lots of mental and physical energy, hours of communications with the manufacturer and hundreds of pounds of plant material trying to get the machine to produce reliably.

Unfortunately, we have concluded that the machine was not properly constructed. We're now working with a machinist to convert the machine into a working stick incense machine and we still need to convert several parts including hydraulic pumps, to achieve our goal.

 

 

Of course, like any small business, we have other challenges we are addressing, including our bulk inventory purchases which are much larger than ever as we expand our customer base and create new products. Our primary challenge stems from our support of smaller artisan companies, which leads to higher overhead costs.

The best way to keep costs down with costly organic ingredients is to make larger purchases. In addition to many things, this crowd funding campaign will act as a jumpstart for our inventory, allowing us to overcome the challenging stage of needing more funds to acquire lower bulk pricing from artisan companies.

As you probably know, large international incense companies use chemicals and synthetic fragrance oils in their products. These companies make a great deal of profit by adopting lower standards and adding chemicals to their incense instead of true natural materials. This reality saddens us and should deter customers.

Higher Mind is leading by example, showing smaller US incense companies that by supporting each other, organic farmers and ethical sources, we can bring integrity back to the ancient art of incense crafting and change the direction the mainstream incense industry is heading.

 

 

Where We’re Headed

The greater goal for Higher Mind Incense is to source herbal ingredients as much as we can locally. Creating lasting relationships with local growers in our community not only makes sense, it will also greatly reduce our carbon footprint and create a healthier, more prosperous community.

Another goal for us is to have all of our product packaging be 100% eco-friendly and sustainable. This is part of our effort to attain a Green Business Certification. We must meet rigorous conditions for the certification and it costs a lot of time and money. Nevertheless, we are determined to do everything we can to get certified. This campaign will aid in this process.

Because our cone press has not functioned as we expected, we currently use incense cones processed by another company, which we infuse with aromatic plant oils. A local machine shop  is helping us convert the machine to incense stick production. This campaign will help us continue that conversion process and ultimately enable us to exert more quality control over our materials and processes.

 

 

We have wanted to offer an artisan essential oil line for many years. The mass production of essential oils in the modern essential oil industry is simply not sustainable at such a massive scale. We envision the crafting of artisan oils using plants grown with sustainable, organic farming practices as well as sustainably wild-harvested plants. We will limit our line of essential oils to a select few, and will produce only small batches, intended for traditional aromatic and sacred purposes.

This small-batch production requires a 30 gallon still and other distillation equipment. This equipment will enable us to not only create our own line of essential oils, but also to produce our own oils for our current product lines, saving thousands of dollars a year on purchases of bulk essential oils. 

Moving Forward 

This crowd funding campaign acts as an umbrella that will support many smaller projects that we've put on hold for the past 2 years, ultimately taking Higher Mind Incense to the next level into 2017. As a small company with limited capital, various factors have limited our ability to grow and expand. We admit that our strong beliefs of ethical and natural sourcing and the higher costs in supporting other small businesses contribute to our challenges - but we will never give up our ethics in the name of growth.

This fundraiser will provide the following in this order:

1. Machine parts and shop time for incense machine - $1,400

2. Bulk “Green” packaging for existing products (eco-friendly, sustainable, post-consumer, recyclable and compostable) - $2,250

3. Bulk eco-friendly packaging for new stick incense line - $1,450

4. Bulk materials for new stick incense line - $1,350

5. Meeting Green Business Certification criteria and cost of certification - $1,200

6. 30 gallon still and distillation equipment - $6,000

7. Bottles and labels for artisan essential oil line - $1,350

All additional funds raised will go toward the launching of my new school, The Northwest School of Aromatic Medicine. We've been developing the school for over a year. We need funding to build and maintain the website, develop various teaching materials, and to secure a video camera for online classes and workshops.

Creating lasting relationships with local growers in our community not only makes sense, it will also greatly reduce our carbon footprint and create a healthier, more prosperous community.Another goal for us is to have all of our product packaging be 100% eco-friendly and sustainable. This is part of our effort to attain a Green Business Certification. We must meet rigorous conditions for the certification and it costs a lot of time and money. Nevertheless, we are determined to do everything we can to get certified. This campaign will aid in this process.Because our cone press has not functioned as we expected, we currently use incense cones processed by another company, which we infuse with aromatic plant oils. A local machine shop  is helping us convert the machine to incense stick production. This campaign will help us continue that conversion process and ultimately enable us to exert more quality control over our materials and processes.  We have wanted to offer an artisan essential oil line for many years. The mass production of essential oils in the modern essential oil industry is simply not sustainable at such a massive scale. We envision the crafting of artisan oils using plants grown with sustainable, organic farming practices as well as sustainably wild-harvested plants. We will limit our line of essential oils to a select few, and will produce only small batches, intended for traditional aromatic and sacred purposes.This small-batch production requires a 30 gallon still and other distillation equipment. This equipment will enable us to not only create our own line of essential oils, but also to produce our own oils for our current product lines, saving thousands of dollars a year on purchases of bulk essential oils. Moving Forward This crowd funding campaign acts as an umbrella that will support many smaller projects that we've put on hold for the past 2 years, ultimately taking Higher Mind Incense to the next level into 2017. As a small company with limited capital, various factors have limited our ability to grow and expand. We admit that our strong beliefs of ethical and natural sourcing and the higher costs in supporting other small businesses contribute to our challenges - but we will never give up our ethics in the name of growth.This fundraiser will provide the following in this order:1. Machine parts and shop time for incense machine - $1,4002. Bulk “Green” packaging for existing products (eco-friendly, sustainable, post-consumer, recyclable and compostable) - $2,2503. Bulk eco-friendly packaging for new stick incense line - $1,4504. Bulk materials for new stick incense line - $1,3505. Meeting Green Business Certification criteria and cost of certification - $1,2006. 30 gallon still and distillation equipment - $6,0007. Bottles and labels for artisan essential oil line - $1,350All additional funds raised will go toward the launching of my new school, The Northwest School of Aromatic Medicine. We've been developing the school for over a year. We need funding to build and maintain the website, develop various teaching materials, and to secure a video camera for online classes and workshops.

story:
My name is C.J. Allen and I'm a family-friend of the Canadays.  They gave me my first job as a teenager and were always there as a source of advice or comfort when I needed it.  

They poured their life's savings into a beautiful barn in hopes it would turn into a thriving business they could retire on and eventually leave to their children.  Just as their funds were depleted, the project was finished, or so they thought.  Upon inspection, the county decreed the barn would need a $50,000+ sprinkler system before it could be used to host money-generating events.  

Around that same period of time, Kenny was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer. Doctors could slow the progression, but wouldn't be able to cure it.  All of the Canaday's extra time, effort and money was diverted to extending Kenny's life.  Despite his own troubles, all Kenny could think about was completing the barn before his passing.  For the first time in his life, he swallowed a lifetime of pride and decided to ask the community for help.  

We offered to film their story in order to spread the word and help raise the needed money.  I'm ashamed to say that we took too long editing the project and Kenny passed away before we could share the video and start this campaign.

Our request is simple:  Please help us to raise the money by donating what you can and spreading the word.  Share it on any social media channel you're on with as many people as you can.  Thanks for your support.

story:
Hi and welcome to my campaign!


My name is Eddie Cabrera. I'm a native New Yorker, first generation born Puerto Rican in my family. I have 4 wonderful kids and a sweet but spoiled granddaughter LOL. The mother of my children and I are dear friends, a relationship for which I am always grateful. I've led a diverse career. I started as a Classical musician, freelancing in NYC for over 30 years as a Bassoonist. In 1997 I changed careers and became a Technologist within the financial sector. I was very fortunate to have great mentors and teachers, so I excelled in my career. In 2007 I moved to the Public Safety business and have been doing that for the past 9 years. Now I have chosen to work for my myself in a line of business that I am very passionate about; the Cigar business.

I've been smoking Cigars for over 24 years. You may ask yourself, what makes a person smoke cigars? What draws them to what some may refer to as a smelly habit? Well, I can only speak from my experiences as a human being who chooses to smoke cigars.

Like fine wine, fine coffee, fine spirits, there is a discernment about Cigar smoking that awakens my taste buds. Explosions of cocoa, starchy flavors, toasted almonds, coffee, filling my mouth and nostrils with those wonderful organic aromas.

Cigar smoking has also granted me opportunities to meet and converse with some of the most wonderful human beings I have ever met. Strong fellowships were built that have lasted for decades.

Now to let you know what my goal is:
There are many people who I have met and who I have developed long relationships with and they consistently ask me, what do I look for in a cigar? How do I develop my taste buds for different cigar makers and regions? How do I buy Cigar-related gifts for my loved one?

As a result of these conversations, I decided that I would incorporate products and gift packs that help address these very questions, building the Cigar community, and helping them to slowly develop their knowledge about the Cigar world.

So here we are!! I'll leave you with this sentiment: Cigar smoking is more than just a hobby. When I smoke, I participate with a Cigar community, I think deep thoughts, I laugh, I cry, I welcome the future, while I say goodbye to the past. Come experience this with me!

What We Need & What You Get

Currently I have raised 30k, but need an additional 15k to cover startup costs for technology automation, engineering designs, A&E work and permits.
If I am unable to meet my goal, whatever amount I do collect, I will add to my start up fund and continue to work on this possibility. I am committed to be successful.

My success will be primarily driven by my self commitment. My passion will be the secondary driver. On top of these two powerful forces, I have my practical experience, which include the following skills:
Financial Management
Risk Assessment
Customer Service
Transparency

These, in conjunction with what I indicated earlier, will help create the possibility of great success. As a result of these skills, we already have the retail space negotiated and we start construction in mid-September of 2016.
Come join us!!

story:
.. A creative event for the female entrepreneur who is looking for real and authentic connections, build her awesome network for collaborations, genuine friendships and a supportive community.

THE BACKGROUND

The idea all started by Renee Dimitrovski, a single mom, entrepreneur, a daughter and a friend who is passionate about what she does, inspired by those in her life and committed to helping others. She also knows that in order to succeed, you need a tribe of amazing people who have your back.

She started producing events such as The Original Wedding Soiree and The Original Petite Soiree eight years ago.  She then launched COCOLILY Magazine which molded into a lifestyle brand for celebration and inspiration. 

Renee believes in being authentic, community over competition and she also believes in The COCOLILY Social : a creative event for the female entrepreneur - and she is hoping that you will too.The COCOLILY Social is very near and dear to her heart as she is trying to bring together a community of women who will be there for each other and support one another while providing a unique experience and inspirational event.

Renee is striving to start a movement that allows for women to know that they are not alone on their journey and putting it out there that when women support each other, incredible things happen.  Society has done enough damage where we are accustomed to be catty, competitive and mean.  She is trying to change that and bring together women who also believe in the COCOLILY manifesto. Be kind, be real, speak words of wisdom, support each other and help someone - not because there is something in it for you, but because it feels amazing for the soul.

With your support and contributions, this event will be possible and it will start a new community of wonderful things to come.  An eternally grateful heart for the believers and dreamers who help make this dream come alive.  It will let others know that when you have hope in your heart, anything is possible.

THE BREAKDOWN

The funds being contributed and received will assist towards the total bill for food & beverage at the venue in addition to event rental space.  The fees at the venue:
1. venue rental...$8750
2. meals for 150 guests (breakfast, lunch and dinner and breaks) $25,410
3. audio visual/electrical $3500

That is just the venue alone and does not include insurance costs, decor, rentals, and printing.  The $15,500 will help to cover some of the cost for the meals - asking for over $25K is shooting for the stars.

Coming to realize this, Renee knows she can’t do this alone. COCOLILY has been built by one person, Renee, and she does not have a team of mavens.  She is the accountant, bookkeeper, marketing manager, sales manager and logistics coordinator - and she simply doesn't have the manpower or marketing funds to go full throttle unfortunately. 

This event is not for profit and the goal is to come together as a community, build your tribe, celebrate, dream, relax, collaborate, learn from each other and share experiences.
A lot of us chase those dreams alone but Renee is trying to change that. Have your dream, take it with you to The COCOLILY Social, share it with your new tribe and know that you have a lot of support. Whether it’s asking a simple question, needing advice or letting go of those fears of failure. 
You have a dream...now what? You have an idea...now what?  You’re scared and feel alone and lost...you don’t have to feel that way.  A lot of us have been there and Renee knows how it feels to turn on the computer, try to be the best mother/wife/daughter/friend, juggle everything, be surrounded by your family and friends but still feel alone. An idea pops into your head but there’s no support system like you have when working at a company.  She gets it - and that’s why she is giving this her all to make this event work and bring together all of those who felt what she felt.

THE IMPACT

With The COCOLILY Social you get to be yourself and come as you are rather than pretending to be something you are not just so others perceive you in the light you think they should. 
You get to actually talk to other like-minded female entrepreneurs who ‘get you’ while having a coffee. 
You get to be inspired with the workshops run by the top business-savvy women. 
You get to be motivated and talk in depth about what YOU choose to attend as each session is ‘choose your own’ so you can pick which workshops and sessions you would like to take part in, that will actually help you rather than being forced to attend workshops on an agenda that don’t interest you at all. And the Tea Talks are there for the purpose of being honest and open about a topic with 6-8 other women; sharing experiences, advice and learning from each other. 

That’s a true intimate and interactive experience for actually getting to meet your kindred spirit, making those connections for future collaborations and knowing that when you turn on the computer on Monday morning - you’ll have your tribe who will support you.
Renee wants women to walk away from this event saying “I can’t wait for the next one” and smile. 

THE CHALLENGES

Building an unparalleled event like this from scratch requires a passionate heart, creative thinking, courage and, an even greater amount of financial support.

By lending your support and your leap of faith in supporting the event and  vision to come to life, you will be a part of an incredible new chapter and movement for women entrepreneurs everywhere!

Renee has produced numerous events and some events back to back along with other challenges such as road closures one year for a St. Patrick's Day Parade, time changes, etc. But she always overcomes those challenges and does what she promises to do and what is within her control.  While she cannot control if people attend events but she can control how she produces them - gracefully and honestly with passion.  With The COCOLILY Social she is still going full speed ahead with the marketing plan, partnerships and a PR campaign but she knows that won’t be enough. 


THANK YOU FROM RENEE

I graciously ask that if you cannot contribute financially, then please help spread the word about the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to notify your friends and make some fierce noise.  
Please share it with your social media portals and friends who you think might love to contribute or even attend.  

By building this event, I am trying to build on the vision and message that we're all in this together and you're not alone - BEHIND EVERY SUCCESSFUL WOMAN IS A TRIBE WHO HAS HER BACK - that's The COCOLILY Social. And most importantly, be your authentic self - as that will attract the right people into your life.

If I have your full support, then I will be eternally grateful.  I know in my heart that the right people will step forward and support the event.  I'm doing my best to make it absolutely wonderful - but I am only one person and I can't do this without my tribe and community of fabulous supporters with a kind heart.

Thank you for taking the time to read this.

With love and gratitude,
Renee Dimitrovski - Founder

story:
For the first time in Africa! Oasis Training in Zimbabwe!

The Oasis training is a full-time 8 day intensive program, hosted from 27th of June till July 5th, for African youth to learn in an interactive way community-building skills in direct interaction with a socially challenged community in Zimbabwe. 

30 participants from Zimbabwe and other African countries are invited to a guided learning experience of engaging communities in participatory processes with the implementation of collaborative solutions that can drive new leadership practices in your work and personal life through Elos Philosophy methodology, Oasis Game. 

Our intentions behind this training
In the process of 8 days the 30 participants will mobilize over 200 community members in realizing  a collectively constructed project. More over the participants go back to their own communities to replicate the work, based on their acquired experience and skills, creating a wave of actions across Zimbabwe and Africa. 

We are inviting the co-founder of this methodology from Brazil to come, to guarantee the best learning experience, so that community as well as the young leaders participating leave empowered and equipped to transform realities.

“The greatest empowerment of the Oasis training is that a form of leadership is cultivated where talents are recognized and local stories and resources build the energy to realize collective dreams”

Why this campaign?
We’ve been preparing for this training 1,5 years. We are already halfway, but we still need all support possible to guaranteeing three goals;

  1. Partial Scholarships for 20 young participants. We have 20 bright young people ready to participate, but not all can afford the participation fee.  
  2. Bringing the Instituto Elos Facilitator from Brazil to facilitate the training
  3. Transport, Food and accomodation

Given the challenges being faced by young people in Zimbabwe, your contribution especially makes it possible for 20 young people from Kufunda Leadership Program to be able to participate.

What is oasis game?
Kufunda Village has hosted four successful Oasis Games in rural and urban parts of Zimbabwe before. This methodology originates from Brazil and will be the first training guided  and facilitated by the founder of Instituto Elos from Brazil; Rodrigo Rubido Alonso, hosted by Kufunda Village in Zimbabwe. Here is a small video that briefs Oasis Game.


For Kufunda and the African Warriors this is an important impulse to creating a new wave of bottom-up community projects and strengthening the network of young leaders that take the future into their own hands. 

Impact of Oasis trainings around the world

Oasis training has been applied in different parts of Brazil, the Carribean Island, Europe and propelled various movements of which you can find stories of impacts on on the Elos Foundation website. Please follow this link ( http://www.elosfoundation.org/in-action/5-cases-of-impact.html )

In Zimbabwe the underlying methodology is used as way of supporting young people within their six months leadership program as a way to brace  them with a dynamic and vibrant way to engage communities in collaborative solutions; and co creating tangible change with a local community and  getting tools to boost their own local development processes going forward.        

How you can support?

First of we’d be very happy with your contribution to our campaign. Find out also what perks we have for each donation.

Besides donating, there are many others ways you can support us. We kindly invite you to share this campaign within your circles of friends and family. If you know someone who could possibly benefit from this training, here is the link you can share with them so that they join this adventure: http://www.kufunda.org/#!oasis/c357

THANK YOU :)
