story:
• If you love beer...
  • If you are a homebrewer...
  • If you want a relaxing and enjoyable environment...

Ceremony has what you're looking for! Ceremony will offer a bottle shop, taproom, brew supply store, educational courses, and a nano-brewery within a comfortable and relaxing environment. More information on each below.

 

The bottle shop will provide beer for carry out purchases or to enjoy on site. Focusing on craft beer the world over and specializing in the rare and hard to find. Our knowledgeable staff can direct you to the perfect beer.

 

Our goal is to have a minimum of a dozen draft beers for your enjoyment. You'll be able to cozy up to the bar or fill a growler to go. There will be no static lines and regular changes to our draft list which will feature a wide array of styles focusing on craft beer from around the world.

 

If your a homebrewer you're options for supplies are limited. Many of your products need to be ordered online which could take weeks to receive and who knows what you're getting. Ceremony will offer a fully stocked brew supply store including a wide variety of grains, hops, yeast, and equipment.

 

Interested in learning more about beer? Are you a homebrewer and want to hone your craft? We offer a full series of classes such as; learn to brew, hop profiles and tasting, water treatments, and much much more. We will offer classes on a regular basis for the novice and expert alike. 

 

As a homebrewer myself, I'm very excited to be able to brew my recipes and share them with our guests. Ceremony is about highlighting the vast talent and diversity in the industry. Therefore Ceremony will occupy few tap lines and feature rotating and experimental offerings.  Brewing is about creativity, pushing the envelope, and our brewing will exemplify this bold attitude by creating new and unique recipes. Ceremony believes in sharing the knowledge and skills of the community therefore will be serving up guest brews made by brew club members, our patrons, and visiting brewers.

 

 

The beautiful and walkable downtown Bonita Springs, FL is surrounded by quaint family neighborhoods. The crown jewel of this community is the impressive Imperial river with the popular Riverside Park and Bandshell to the south and the historic Everglades Wonder Gardens to the north.

Downtown Bonita has all the makings of a bustling and charming community. It is my dream to see growth and positive development in the area; to make Downtown Bonita Springs a social destination full of unique and independent businesses, to draw tourists and visitors from the surrounding communities. 

As a local myself, it is my goal to become a part of the new Bonita Springs identity. I want to make something that locals can be proud of. I fell in love with this community, that's why I moved from Naples to Bonita five years ago and that's why I want to bring Ceremony to this charming city.

 

 

 

My name is Zach. As a native I have spent years in search of the perfect local watering hole to enjoy a craft beer with friends. I wanted a place that felt more like a coffee shop or someone's living room , something intimate. Through my travels I would often discover fun and exciting concepts in other cities and wondered why these concepts weren't in SWFL. It's for this reason that I am opening Ceremony Brewing. 

I have well over a decade of experience in the hospitality industry. I started as a busboy and have worked every position in hospitality including management. Later transitioned into event planning creating fundraisers, beerfests, concerts, and food shows. Three years ago my love for craft beer lead me to homebrewing which in turn got me involved in a local brew club in which I became one of the officers. With this experience and my deep community roots I feel Ceremony will be in good hands.

 

 

Ceremony Brewing will require at least $200,000... an intimating number by any means. Banks will finance the majority but I'll need some additional capital to get this off the ground. Our first priority is the build out of our location. Nothing in the downtown corridor is built to suit a concept quite like this, therefore extensive renovations will be required. After construction we will begin purchasing equipment and inventory to stock the store. 

I have a goal of $55,000 but have high hopes that we can exceed that goal. I assure you that every cent gained from this IndieGoGO campaign will be spent on Ceremony Brewing. I will do everything within my power to make my donors proud and build a concept that they can enjoy. 

Every dollar adds up and even small contributions can go a long way. I am tremendously grateful to all of the backers. 

 

 

I have worked hard to create a perk list that is rewarding and enticing at each and every price point. You'll get everything from sweet swag like shirts, stickers, and pints, to private parties, permanent recognition in the bar, or even free beer for life! If you don't see what you're after or would like to make adjustments just let me know and I would be happy to work with your feedback to create a meaningful perk. 

Remember, every perk compounds! You will receive the perk you select PLUS every perk that was listed before it at a lesser value. All perks will be picked up at Ceremony after opening unless required otherwise. 

 

 

Ceremony cannot happen without your help. The fact that you're even reading this is cause for celebration. I cannot thank you all enough for your support and dedication. I know that if we reach our funding goal I can create something badass...something I will be proud of, that my friends and family will be proud of, and that you will be proud of as well. I look forward to the day we raise a glass in Ceremony and I can thank you in person. CHEERS!

 

 

We need exposure! Please post, share, retweet, and talk about Ceremony with everyone you know. Help this campaign spread like wild fire. Even if your unable to contribute, your help in spreading this campaign could lead to invaluable marketing opportunities and possible backers. 

 

Add us on Facebook, Instagram, and check out our website

Insta: @CeremonyBrewing

Facebook: www.facebook.com/CeremonyBrewing

www.CeremonyBrewing.com

story:
Calistoga, CA -- Summer of 2006

This is where it all started. Literally, in this very vineyard off of the Silverado Trail in Calistoga. A little over 10 years ago, I signed up as a harvest intern with Cakebread Cellars, and was put up in a trailer (not pictured) between these rows of their Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot vines.

After a year, it was time to head back to Maine and leave wine country behind. But as time passed, it became clear that one thing in particular truly had been left behind for good, as there  wasn't a single thing like it east of the Sierra Nevadas. This thing was the winery tasting room, and is something that only the tiniest fraction of Americans are able to enjoy. 

There just one reason that separates this tiny group of tasting room "haves"from the rest of us millions of have-nots, and it’s not about to change anytime soon -- geography. There are some folks that can jump in their Tesla and within minutes -- especially in Ludicrous Mode -- be enjoying the latest release of Opus One on a terrace overlooking the winery's estate vineyard, nestled between Napa's mountains and valley floor. Unfortunately, for me to get there and back for a tasting, we’re talking about at least 6,400 miles on the ‘ol Jetta...

Now granted, these luxury experiences can be absolutely unforgettable, and it would be cool if something like them were a little more accessible.  But as special and beautiful as they are, they're not actually the most important thing that the rest of us are missing out on, because  they teach us almost nothing about wine. That's right -- while drinking ultra-premium wine at the site where it's made can be a life experience and take your Instagram to a whole new level, it'll do little more to make you a wine connoisseur than asking for a restaurant's most expensive bottle on a date.

No, that's not what I miss, and it's not what New England needs. When I was an intern, we'd schedule our one day off per week to include as many winery visits as time permitted. If the wineries focused on different varieties, and/or different subregions (Carneros vs. Stags Leap, for example), so much the better. At the end of those whirlwind days, we'd have tasted dozens of wines that -- if sold in bottle, and at retail -- were worth literally thousands.

However, the cost for the whole day never added up to more than that of a single decent bottle. We'd go to bed totally exhausted, but with all five senses still fully activated, and a head full of knowledge that far surpassed what we'd learned working in the winery the other six days that week.  Plus, we still had a few dollars in our pocket when it was all over, and hadn't suffered any consequences for dumping out the wines that we didn't care for. I remain convinced to this day that this method -- trying as many wines as possible in a short period of time -- is by far the best, fastest, and least expensive way in existence to learn about wine.

So Now What?

OK, then, so if proximity to the vineyards and spectacular surroundings aren't essential to learning about wine, why are there more than 1,200 tasting rooms in Napa Valley alone, and basically zero in New England? You can't ship Sonoma itself out here, but you sure as hell can ship their wines, and we do exactly that to the tune of millions of bottles per year. So if geography isn't the problem, who's to blame for this??  Well, for starters:

Global mass-production wineries. Let's pick on Veuve Cliquot for a random example. Is their yellow label Champagne twice as good as most options that cost half as much? Of course not. But their marketing department has a 200-year head start, and they sell 1.5 million cases (that's 18 million bottles!!) of the stuff every year, so a small California winery isn't going to open a tasting room or otherwise invest in building awareness in a market that is already dominated by one of these behemoths (e.g., Maine).

-Distributors. Scouring the world -- or even a small corner of the country -- for the most amazing boutique wineries is extraordinarily hard. These vintners bottle just the tiniest amounts of their magic potion each year, and chances are that they've sold it all by the time you find them. On the other hand, buying a truckload of something mass-produced, sending that truck directly to Hannaford or BJ's, and mustering up the energy to find a bank branch at which to cash the check...is not hard. There are notable exceptions to this this course -- Martignetti in MA and Crush in ME, for example -- but overall it's the distributors that are closest to the source, and that far prefer money to wines of incredible value and distinction. It's mostly because of them that it's so hard for you to find a decent bottle of wine. 

Sommeliers. It kills me to say this about my industry brethren, but as averse to scouring the world as distributors are, most somms are the opposite. The problem is that they often forget that they're scouring on someone's behalf (yours), and not for themselves. They bring back obscure wines from obscure places, which is why you're going to have an easier time finding an Estonian Hasanski Sladki than a Californian Chardonnay at many wine bars these days. They try incredibly hard, but often fail to help the average consumer that's simply trying to figure out what producers to trust and what wines they like at the stores in their hometown. 

Culture. The wine country on the west coast of America is one of the most magical, magnetic, and utopian places on earth. That's why most of the people that love American wine live there. And while there are obviously a good number of amazing wine professionals on the east coast, most of the career options available to them are in the ultra-traditional areas of restaurant and retail. The ones that would like to innovate have a hard time doing so because of limited inventory in the area (see how it always comes back to the distributors??) and ancient, pro-distributor regulations that choke progress. 
 

Time for a Change

So there you have it. For those reasons, plus a few others, that's why there's nowhere around here -- YET -- that:

  • Offers a wine retail experience that's interactive and educational
  • Features a "producer spotlight" -- i.e. sample a handful of one winery's lineup, the way you would in their tasting room, to get a feel for their "house style" across different varieties
  • Works tirelessly to bring in the best and most interesting wines in the country such that there's always something new to taste no matter how often you visit
  • Loves its customers even more than its wines, and is small enough to know each one by name and work as hard on keeping their favorites in stock as they do at finding them new discoveries.
  • Offers tasting opportunities for wineries that don't have their own tasting rooms and/or aren't open to the public.
  • Gives wine education and appreciation that you can actually use right away 
  • Offers an in-depth exploration of a specific region and/or variety -- for example, discover how Pinot Noir did in the (amazing) 2015 vintage by tasting several examples of the variety from different vineyards and subregions within Sonoma
  • Lets you explore the difference from vintage to vintage by tasting a "vertical", or a flight of wines from the same producer, variety, and vineyard, but from consecutive years.
  • Is a food and wine experience that's new, exciting, and entertaining
  • Gives a guided tour of wine that's focused on making you comfortable and engaged. No showing off or lecturing.
  • Is always trying to perform miracles for its regular customers, and inviting them in try limited allocations of rare, special wines that might not exist anywhere else in New England. 
  • Offers a quick, inexpensive, and grown-up diversion in downtown Freeport, not to mention a terrific place to pre-game when the line at Azure is out the door.
  • Is an experiential retail concept, but founded and operated by a career management consultant that would absolutely love to host a team-building tasting event for your group that blends the fun of wine tasting with professional development.
  • Promises that you'll fall in love with a bottle of wine (or a producer) without the expensive, trial-and-error process of buying entires bottles of wine you've never tasted, and holding 100% of the risk in the event that you don't love them. (This process too often ends with the consumer throwing in the towel and just sticking with a wine they're not crazy about, but it at least the devil they know)
  • Offers a glass or small pours of wine that are in another world of quality and enjoyment than you're used to. Restaurant by-the-glass programs are run by two criteria alone:
    • Finding wines that are designed to be simple and sweet, i.e. "crowd pleasers" AND
    • Enough mass production to ensure years' worth of continuity -- i.e. when the 2016 Kendall Jackson sells out, an allocation of the 2017 KJ is guaranteed, so that customers that have become used to it aren't asked to switch

It may all sound too good to be true, but with your cherished support, it soon won't be. We've flown into SFO at least 20 times in the last two years -- each time trading sleep for new discoveries, and shaking hands with winemakers that are chomping at the bit to show you the fruits of their labor. Now, the project is finally entering its final stage, having already:

-Signed a lease on the space (pictured above) adjacent to L.L. Bean's flagship store in downtown Freeport
-Secured town and state licensing to serve wine and food
-Completed its naming and branding project
-Incorporated as an LLC and secured its Federal employment credentials
-Worked with a local architect to plan the layout of the space
-Begun design of the tasting bar itself
-Procured numerous pieces of equipment
-Secured supplier commitments from a number of family-owned wineries in CA and WA
-Established relationships with local distributors, all of which have agreed to clear small lots of wine for us in order to support our business model as well as to lift up the overall Maine wine scene.

However, we need to raise one more round of capital in order to purchase furniture, exterior signage, bar construction materials, additional starting inventory, and a commercial-grade dishwasher. Once that is accomplished, there will be nothing holding us back from opening our doors and delivering on the promises outlined above. This won't be possible with your support, and as such, we've designed this campaign such that the rewards for contributions are not only generous, but geared towards creating a long-term relationship with our backers and making Toast feel like a place of their own*. Which is exactly how it should feel for anyone that gives to this cause and takes real action towards raising the profile of this amazing town, state, and region.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*We tried really hard to come up a wide range of contributions and rewards, as well as special things that would only be available to this group of supporters (guided tour of Sonoma, anyone!?). That said, if you're interested in supporting this campaign, but have ideas or needs that aren't represented by any of the reward bundles that are listed, please contact me to put together something totally custom. IndieGoGo allows us to create a private contribution/rewards set, so if what you dream up is even remotely reasonable, you better believe we'll consider it.
story_txt:
Calistoga, CA -- Summer of 2006This is where it all started. Literally, in this very vineyard off of the Silverado Trail in Calistoga. A little over 10 years ago, I signed up as a harvest intern with Cakebread Cellars, and was put up in a trailer (not pictured) between these rows of their Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot vines.After a year, it was time to head back to Maine and leave wine country behind. But as time passed, it became clear that one thing in particular truly had been left behind for good, as there  wasn't a single thing like it east of the Sierra Nevadas. This thing was the winery tasting room, and is something that only the tiniest fraction of Americans are able to enjoy. There just one reason that separates this tiny group of tasting room "haves"from the rest of us millions of have-nots, and it’s not about to change anytime soon -- geography. There are some folks that can jump in their Tesla and within minutes -- especially in Ludicrous Mode -- be enjoying the latest release of Opus One on a terrace overlooking the winery's estate vineyard, nestled between Napa's mountains and valley floor. Unfortunately, for me to get there and back for a tasting, we’re talking about at least 6,400 miles on the ‘ol Jetta...Now granted, these luxury experiences can be absolutely unforgettable, and it would be cool if something like them were a little more accessible.  But as special and beautiful as they are, they're not actually the most important thing that the rest of us are missing out on, because  they teach us almost nothing about wine. That's right -- while drinking ultra-premium wine at the site where it's made can be a life experience and take your Instagram to a whole new level, it'll do little more to make you a wine connoisseur than asking for a restaurant's most expensive bottle on a date.No, that's not what I miss, and it's not what New England needs. When I was an intern, we'd schedule our one day off per week to include as many winery visits as time permitted. If the wineries focused on different varieties, and/or different subregions (Carneros vs. Stags Leap, for example), so much the better. At the end of those whirlwind days, we'd have tasted dozens of wines that -- if sold in bottle, and at retail -- were worth literally thousands.However, the cost for the whole day never added up to more than that of a single decent bottle. We'd go to bed totally exhausted, but with all five senses still fully activated, and a head full of knowledge that far surpassed what we'd learned working in the winery the other six days that week.  Plus, we still had a few dollars in our pocket when it was all over, and hadn't suffered any consequences for dumping out the wines that we didn't care for. I remain convinced to this day that this method -- trying as many wines as possible in a short period of time -- is by far the best, fastest, and least expensive way in existence to learn about wine.So Now What?OK, then, so if proximity to the vineyards and spectacular surroundings aren't essential to learning about wine, why are there more than 1,200 tasting rooms in Napa Valley alone, and basically zero in New England? You can't ship Sonoma itself out here, but you sure as hell can ship their wines, and we do exactly that to the tune of millions of bottles per year. So if geography isn't the problem, who's to blame for this??  Well, for starters:Global mass-production wineries. Let's pick on Veuve Cliquot for a random example. Is their yellow label Champagne twice as good as most options that cost half as much? Of course not. But their marketing department has a 200-year head start, and they sell 1.5 million cases (that's 18 million bottles!!) of the stuff every year, so a small California winery isn't going to open a tasting room or otherwise invest in building awareness in a market that is already dominated by one of these behemoths (e.g., Maine).-Distributors. Scouring the world -- or even a small corner of the country -- for the most amazing boutique wineries is extraordinarily hard. These vintners bottle just the tiniest amounts of their magic potion each year, and chances are that they've sold it all by the time you find them. On the other hand, buying a truckload of something mass-produced, sending that truck directly to Hannaford or BJ's, and mustering up the energy to find a bank branch at which to cash the check...is not hard. There are notable exceptions to this this course -- Martignetti in MA and Crush in ME, for example -- but overall it's the distributors that are closest to the source, and that far prefer money to wines of incredible value and distinction. It's mostly because of them that it's so hard for you to find a decent bottle of wine. Sommeliers. It kills me to say this about my industry brethren, but as averse to scouring the world as distributors are, most somms are the opposite. The problem is that they often forget that they're scouring on someone's behalf (yours), and not for themselves. They bring back obscure wines from obscure places, which is why you're going to have an easier time finding an Estonian Hasanski Sladki than a Californian Chardonnay at many wine bars these days. They try incredibly hard, but often fail to help the average consumer that's simply trying to figure out what producers to trust and what wines they like at the stores in their hometown. Culture. The wine country on the west coast of America is one of the most magical, magnetic, and utopian places on earth. That's why most of the people that love American wine live there. And while there are obviously a good number of amazing wine professionals on the east coast, most of the career options available to them are in the ultra-traditional areas of restaurant and retail. The ones that would like to innovate have a hard time doing so because of limited inventory in the area (see how it always comes back to the distributors??) and ancient, pro-distributor regulations that choke progress.  Time for a ChangeSo there you have it. For those reasons, plus a few others, that's why there's nowhere around here -- YET -- that:
Offers a wine retail experience that's interactive and educational
Features a "producer spotlight" -- i.e. sample a handful of one winery's lineup, the way you would in their tasting room, to get a feel for their "house style" across different varieties
Works tirelessly to bring in the best and most interesting wines in the country such that there's always something new to taste no matter how often you visit
Loves its customers even more than its wines, and is small enough to know each one by name and work as hard on keeping their favorites in stock as they do at finding them new discoveries.
Offers tasting opportunities for wineries that don't have their own tasting rooms and/or aren't open to the public.
Gives wine education and appreciation that you can actually use right away 
Offers an in-depth exploration of a specific region and/or variety -- for example, discover how Pinot Noir did in the (amazing) 2015 vintage by tasting several examples of the variety from different vineyards and subregions within Sonoma
Lets you explore the difference from vintage to vintage by tasting a "vertical", or a flight of wines from the same producer, variety, and vineyard, but from consecutive years.
Is a food and wine experience that's new, exciting, and entertaining
Gives a guided tour of wine that's focused on making you comfortable and engaged. No showing off or lecturing.
Is always trying to perform miracles for its regular customers, and inviting them in try limited allocations of rare, special wines that might not exist anywhere else in New England. 
Offers a quick, inexpensive, and grown-up diversion in downtown Freeport, not to mention a terrific place to pre-game when the line at Azure is out the door.
Is an experiential retail concept, but founded and operated by a career management consultant that would absolutely love to host a team-building tasting event for your group that blends the fun of wine tasting with professional development.

(This process too often ends with the consumer throwing in the towel and just sticking with a wine they're not crazy about, but it at least the devil they know)
Offers a glass or small pours of wine that are in another world of quality and enjoyment than you're used to. Restaurant by-the-glass programs are run by two criteria alone:
Finding wines that are designed to be simple and sweet, i.e. "crowd pleasers" AND
Enough mass production to ensure years' worth of continuity -- i.e. when the 2016 Kendall Jackson sells out, an allocation of the 2017 KJ is guaranteed, so that customers that have become used to it aren't asked to switch


It may all sound too good to be true, but with your cherished support, it soon won't be. We've flown into SFO at least 20 times in the last two years -- each time trading sleep for new discoveries, and shaking hands with winemakers that are chomping at the bit to show you the fruits of their labor. Now, the project is finally entering its final stage, having already:-Signed a lease on the space (pictured above) adjacent to L.L. Once that is accomplished, there will be nothing holding us back from opening our doors and delivering on the promises outlined above. This won't be possible with your support, and as such, we've designed this campaign such that the rewards for contributions are not only generous, but geared towards creating a long-term relationship with our backers and making Toast feel like a place of their own*. Which is exactly how it should feel for anyone that gives to this cause and takes real action towards raising the profile of this amazing town, state, and region.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*We tried really hard to come up a wide range of contributions and rewards, as well as special things that would only be available to this group of supporters (guided tour of Sonoma, anyone!?). That said, if you're interested in supporting this campaign, but have ideas or needs that aren't represented by any of the reward bundles that are listed, please contact me to put together something totally custom. story:
Hello, My name is Ishmael. Ivan Ishmael.

I am a father of three beautiful girls. I have been working at my current job for the last 15 years. Though I love working with the people at work, I feel its time to reach for something bigger. I have had vegetable gardens for a great many years. Talking to people about the gardens I have noticed that people are reluctant to invest time in a vegetable garden because they feel that it may be too challenging. 

My Back Yard Farm La is here to simplify everything. This is an opportunity to provide a service that may have the potential to improve the quality of life for a great many people. We go to your home. We prep the ground install the frame, mix the soil, and plant the seeds. We do this on a 4 foot by 4-foot section big enough to enjoy, and small enough to keep it fun. Creating these vegetable gardens has two major benefits for me. First, I am sharing the love and skills to make things grow. Growing your own veggies even if its just a few beans for a grade school project can be a profound experience. Second, this is an opportunity to serve others. It took me a while to develop an idea that would not only help my family and me but that also had the potential to help my community and the people around me.  

 There is an old saying, "the field is white and ready to harvest." That means that now is the time to go and put in the work. People are waking up to the idea that it is important to eat healthy and nutritious food. Also, that growing your food gives you more control and better quality. Your help will have a multiplying effect. With your help, I will be able to reach a great many people. Those people will gain the knowledge to teach their families and friends. A chain of knowledge and skills starts to form that we can keep adding links to. Now is the time to make a difference. 

The gardens we will put together will be 4x4 raised beds. These are a perfect size to start learning, or a nice size that is easy to maintain. Some of the possible combinations are:

Choose 4 to 6 veggies for this garden. The tomatoes or snap peas will grow in the middle. The outside of the garden will alternate between the other veggies.

Choose 4 kinds of leafy greens. Notice that the rows are all perpendicular. When the leafy greens are full grown the garden will look amazing.

Strawberries grow low to the ground. The strawberries will fill all the corners. In the center you can have blue berry bushes or rhubarb. They will grow taller than the straw berries giving the garden more visual interest. There will be lots of reds and blues. Rhubarb will grow every year. 

Rows are nice and vegetable gardens are nice to look at in themselves, but why not go the extra distance and create gardens that are extra beautiful. The gardens that MBYFLA put together will be utilatarian and artistic.

What I Need to Start

To start this endeavor I need to raise $5300. The following is the break down:

  •  Tools 
    • Rototiller (for the initial installation of beds only)
    • Electric saw
    • Electric Sander
    • Wheel Barrel
    • Specialty Tools
  • Initial Inventory
    • Planks, Seeds, Soil, Hardware, Other
  • Advertising
  • Printed Products
    • Forms
    • receipts
    • etc
  • Legal business start-up costs
  • Perks
  • Indiegogo Fees

 

In Gratitude and Appreciation

We are offering some very interesting perks. Some perks are cumulative. So, bigger commitments get all the perks mentioned up to the level contributed. 

  • First and foremost, our gratitude. Your name will be added to our thank you page on the website.  
  • We have 4x6 stickers with our awesome MBYFLA logo.
  • We will be making 50/50 blend cotton polyester T-shirts (great blend for being active). They will be fitted for men, women, and children.
  • We will be giving high-quality handmade cosmetic/pencil bags
  • There will be handcrafted tote bags. These make great gifts and are of very high quality.
  • Of course, we will be installing veggie gardens, or you can gift one (if you live in the greater Los Angeles Area).
  • For all the art lovers I will draw in colored pencil a 16x20 Portrait. You can choose who will be immortalized. 

A Better Quality of Life

These gardens are sowing the seeds for a better tomorrow. There are many generous people who are more than willing to help. We know that you want to make sure you are supporting things you believe in. MBYFLA is highly motivated and we believe 100% in what we are doing. My philosophy in life is that to be truly happy you need to serve others. This is exactly what we are doing here.

Challenges to Overcome

We have a hundred percent confidence in our product. However, we understand that we will face  challenges. The biggest challenge is getting our name and ideas out in to the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you. Just looking at our campaign is helping get the word out. One of the most important contributions you can do is to tell your friends and family. Letting as many people know about this project will set it on the path to success. Rember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very Much,

the My Back Yard farm LA team

story:
Short Summary

Ambedo Italian Cuisine is a startup company focused on mobile sustainability while providing delicious and local cuisine to the public at the same time. Our vision starts at a food truck but reaches beyond what we have planned currently. Leaders in any industry need to realize how important implementing sustainable business practices are and how our consumeristic society as it stands cannot continue to consume in the way we do today. Ambedo is here to change and challenge the way mobile and brick and mortar restaurants do business and to hopefully be the leader in sustainable innovation that can keep restaurants and food trucks around for decades to come.

The Menu

We're working with multiple local businesses here in Colorado to try and source our products as locally as possible to minimize our impact on the environment as well as preparing all of our food from scratch. We plan to offer seasonal menus throughout the year to offer variety in our menu and to utilize fresh ingredients offered by Colorado growers throughout the seasons. We're also working with local ranchers and farmers to provide the best quality proteins we can find. Our animal products will never be treated with antibiotics or hormones and are raised humanely and naturally.

Breakfast From Europe (Served till 11 am) 

-Quiche Loraine-

Savory Egg Custard, Panchetta and Gruyere Cheese

-Croque-Madame-

Breakfast Sandwich With Pain De Mie, Gruyere Cheese, Black Forest Ham And An Egg Sunny Side Up

What We Need & What You Get

Ambedo Italian Cuisine is a crowdfunded project and can only come to life with your help! Many of the perks we have not only help fund us for everything we need to get started but also benefit you as well when we open! We have perks from getting invited to our grand opening party all the way to a personal catering event for 50 and even links to our Free Italian Food For a Year giveaway*. 

If the truck gets fully funded, funds will be used as follows:

Truck and Vinyl Wrap - $75,000

Equipment and Licences - $25,000

Food and Rewards - $40,000

Miscellaneous Costs - $12,000

Indiegogo Fee -  $8,000

If the truck does not reach funding past $50,000 all funds will be refunded and further efforts will still be made to bring the truck to life but if funds exceed that amount but doesn't reach our goal of $160,000 the truck will still become a reality and further funds will be acquired through a local loan.

Please see the list to your right of all our perks for backing our project!

 

The Impact

The impact you're making by backing this campaign goes farther than just receiving food or getting a sticker. It's an investment in our future and for future generations to be able to eat at a restaurant or mobile business and not to feel guilty, but rather pride in knowing that the businesses you support have a positive impact on the environment and that your favorite place that you support will be there for generations to come. It's about being able to be apart of a movement that will shake the world and inspire others. It's about doing whats right. As mentioned in our video, we are trying to make a difference by implementing solar panels on our truck and running off of a battery instead of a gas-powered generator to power our food truck. All of our packaging is compostable down to the cutlery and we offer compost and recycle bins outside of our truck to curb the amount of waste that goes into landfills and are also working with Scraps composting services to be able to get our compost to the right place, just to name a few of many of the ways we're trying to make a difference. We're a concept trying to become a reality to prove that great food can still come at a sustainable level and if it can be done on a food truck, it can be done anywhere!

Risks & Challenges

As we strive to be as innovative as possible in how business is done in the mobile food industry, there are still some major challenges that need to be overcome to become completely sustainable. One of the biggest challenges is replacing the gasoline-fueled engine that almost every truck possesses into an electrically powered vehicle. We have dreams to work with Telsa in the future to possibly team up to tackle the issue of sustainable food trucks. Also, it would be pretty cool to have food trucks on Mars. 

Another challenge is teaching the public about sustainability, composting and recycling. Sadly, for many, waste is of no concern. It does not affect their daily lives and with how efficient our waste collection services are, it's hard to see the impact on our daily waste but it continues to grow on a daily basis out of our site. Every leader, in all industries, needs to find a way to make their practices sustainable but also must seek an informative way to educate a consumer on how to dispose of their product in a way that doesn't end up in a landfill. Ambedo has plans to implement a waste disposal system that is consistent and informative to ensure the right "waste" is going into the right bin. We put waste in quotations because when placed in the proper bin, "waste" is actually a renewable resource that can then be used to make other resources or products such as composting being used as fertilizer for future crops, or plastic and aluminum being continuously recycled into itself. Although not everyone knows exactly where to place their soda can or paper plate, we are still making efforts to be able to inform the public on how to properly get rid of the post-consumer product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're behind everything were about but don't have the funds to support us, that's okay. We have many ways that can help us still spread the word! Here are a few options.

1. Share this campaign on social media and tell everyone about it!

2. Enter our FREE giveaway* at   http://www.rafflecopter.com/rafl/display/0f0224...?  

Every post helps us show the world that we need sustainable business to be the new norm! Share our campaign now and make a world of difference. Thank you.

-Ambedo Italian Cusine

 

 

*Subject to terms and conditions
story_txt:
Short Summary
Ambedo Italian Cuisine is a startup company focused on mobile sustainability while providing delicious and local cuisine to the public at the same time. Our vision starts at a food truck but reaches beyond what we have planned currently. Leaders in any industry need to realize how important implementing sustainable business practices are and how our consumeristic society as it stands cannot continue to consume in the way we do today. Ambedo is here to change and challenge the way mobile and brick and mortar restaurants do business and to hopefully be the leader in sustainable innovation that can keep restaurants and food trucks around for decades to come.

The Menu
We're working with multiple local businesses here in Colorado to try and source our products as locally as possible to minimize our impact on the environment as well as preparing all of our food from scratch. We plan to offer seasonal menus throughout the year to offer variety in our menu and to utilize fresh ingredients offered by Colorado growers throughout the seasons. We're also working with local ranchers and farmers to provide the best quality proteins we can find. Our animal products will never be treated with antibiotics or hormones and are raised humanely and naturally.

Breakfast From Europe (Served till 11 am) 
-Quiche Loraine-
Savory Egg Custard, Panchetta and Gruyere Cheese
-Croque-Madame-
Breakfast Sandwich With Pain De Mie, Gruyere Cheese, Black Forest Ham And An Egg Sunny Side Up
What We Need & What You Get
Ambedo Italian Cuisine is a crowdfunded project and can only come to life with your help! Many of the perks we have not only help fund us for everything we need to get started but also benefit you as well when we open! We have perks from getting invited to our grand opening party all the way to a personal catering event for 50 and even links to our Free Italian Food For a Year giveaway*. 
If the truck gets fully funded, funds will be used as follows:
Truck and Vinyl Wrap - $75,000
Equipment and Licences - $25,000
Food and Rewards - $40,000
Miscellaneous Costs - $12,000
Indiegogo Fee -  $8,000
If the truck does not reach funding past $50,000 all funds will be refunded and further efforts will still be made to bring the truck to life but if funds exceed that amount but doesn't reach our goal of $160,000 the truck will still become a reality and further funds will be acquired through a local loan.
Please see the list to your right of all our perks for backing our project!
 

The Impact
The impact you're making by backing this campaign goes farther than just receiving food or getting a sticker. It's an investment in our future and for future generations to be able to eat at a restaurant or mobile business and not to feel guilty, but rather pride in knowing that the businesses you support have a positive impact on the environment and that your favorite place that you support will be there for generations to come. It's about being able to be apart of a movement that will shake the world and inspire others. It's about doing whats right. As mentioned in our video, we are trying to make a difference by implementing solar panels on our truck and running off of a battery instead of a gas-powered generator to power our food truck. All of our packaging is compostable down to the cutlery and we offer compost and recycle bins outside of our truck to curb the amount of waste that goes into landfills and are also working with Scraps composting services to be able to get our compost to the right place, just to name a few of many of the ways we're trying to make a difference. We're a concept trying to become a reality to prove that great food can still come at a sustainable level and if it can be done on a food truck, it can be done anywhere!

Risks & Challenges
As we strive to be as innovative as possible in how business is done in the mobile food industry, there are still some major challenges that need to be overcome to become completely sustainable. One of the biggest challenges is replacing the gasoline-fueled engine that almost every truck possesses into an electrically powered vehicle. We have dreams to work with Telsa in the future to possibly team up to tackle the issue of sustainable food trucks. Also, it would be pretty cool to have food trucks on Mars. 
Another challenge is teaching the public about sustainability, composting and recycling. Sadly, for many, waste is of no concern. It does not affect their daily lives and with how efficient our waste collection services are, it's hard to see the impact on our daily waste but it continues to grow on a daily basis out of our site. Every leader, in all industries, needs to find a way to make their practices sustainable but also must seek an informative way to educate a consumer on how to dispose of their product in a way that doesn't end up in a landfill. Ambedo has plans to implement a waste disposal system that is consistent and informative to ensure the right "waste" is going into the right bin. We put waste in quotations because when placed in the proper bin, "waste" is actually a renewable resource that can then be used to make other resources or products such as composting being used as fertilizer for future crops, or plastic and aluminum being continuously recycled into itself. Although not everyone knows exactly where to place their soda can or paper plate, we are still making efforts to be able to inform the public on how to properly get rid of the post-consumer product. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're behind everything were about but don't have the funds to support us, that's okay. We have many ways that can help us still spread the word! Here are a few options.
1. Share this campaign on social media and tell everyone about it!
2. Enter our FREE giveaway* at   http://www.rafflecopter.com/rafl/display/0f0224...?  
Every post helps us show the world that we need sustainable business to be the new norm! Share our campaign now and make a world of difference. Thank you.
-Ambedo Italian Cusine
 
 
*Subject to terms and conditions

story:
Safe Shelter for Tibetans in Nepal

The Journey began in 2009.  I decided to try something a little different, and took a volunteer vacation with Global Citizens Network.  GCN is a non-governmental organization dedicated to facilitating an authentic, total cultural immersion experience. There were many countries from which to choose, and I picked the small country of Nepal.

Nepal is home to several Tibetan refugee villages that are spread throughout the country.  Our destination was the village called Jampaling, which sits 45 minutes outside the small western city of Pokhara.  Our group lived with the Tibetan families, and we shared meals, listened and learned about the Tibetan culture, and worked daily on a basic roofing project.  The village is home to about 750 refugees, and it became quite clear there were many needs, much more than expected.  Ultimately, safe shelter would be the priority.  Many of the families live with leaking roofs, crumbling walls, or cannot afford shelter of their own.  Since the Tibetan people are refugees within Nepal, they have no legal citizenship, rights, and very few opportunities to earn income.

The trip with GCN to Jampaling village was so amazing that I returned in 2013 .  This time I brought my husband and we worked on another roofing project.  Although the roofing project was a success, there were other projects not done, due to lack of funds. This stuck with us and never felt right.

The beautiful Tibetan people, and the trips with GCN inspired us to form our own not for profit corporation called, The Roaming Sanctuary Inc.  Our mission is to assist impoverished peoples with basic needs such as, clean water, healthy food, and safe shelter, along with other necessary community projects to enhance the quality of life.

                                                                                                                                                             Safe shelter for the Tibetan people of Nepal is the focus of this campaign.  The Roaming Sanctuary's goal is to raise $25,000, which will provide at least 50 families with a safe, dry, clean dwelling.  The more we raise, the more families we can help. The Roaming Sanctuary will document every part of the projects, and the website will provide updates on each phase as it occurs.  Our gift of total integrity is for everyone that contributes to The Roaming Sanctuary.  The gift of seeing the projects and the families that you've positively affected, and the love that you spread with your gift.

Thank you for your continued support!

story:
Welcome to La’Ebony©..

The intention of my business is to get Afro art inspired products onto the high street, by renovating an abandoned building into a jaw droppingly colourtastic store with my products and to gather the funds for the completion of #ProjectLaEbony in which I aim to illustrate, write and publish 500 books to send to underprivileged children in Africa.

So c'mon! Let's give the UK high streets a stroke of colour and create a store with a feel like no other!

The goal and soul purpose is to get Afro art inspired products onto the high street, to grab the general public by their tired eyes and bring some life into the cold concrete, we want people to love themselves by having La'Ebony© products on their books and shelves. Now let's get the spring back in our step and create a store that will put the Las Vegas lights to shame!


Not to be funny, but what are you going to do with our money?

The money raised by you lovely people will help go towards buying, renovating and decorating an old building into the funkiest Afro art store ever! Bright colours, animal prints, huge Afros, silk smooth creations and the coolest hand designed products all created by myself. Are you ready for an amalgamation of awesomeness that will make you want to do backflips of joy? Oh you are? Well keep reading and prepare to have your world colourfully flipped upside down! (Don't worry we don't expect you to do backflips but if you can don't hesitate to)


#ProjectLaebony BOOK:

£12,000 will cover the costs of producing, printing, developing and shipping 500 La'Ebony children's books to send to young children in underdeveloped parts of Africa.
This part of the campaign is strictly non-profit, meaning La'Ebony© will only be using this sector of the donations to give the books free of charge as a token of thanks to those whom we take off every day.
As I will be hand illustrating the book I will be doing my upmost to ensure the book is as beautiful as the children they are  going to go to, however in order to do this we will need to raise the funds to carry out this project, La'Ebony© will not be financially benefiting from this gesture.

Abandoned building Project:
The remaining £66,000 will go towards buying an abandoned building to create the La'Ebony© store. The donations will cover the cost of the following:

-Insurance policies.
-Initial Tax, License, Planning Permission and Consent Cost Requirements.
-Labour work such as Electricity and Plumbing I.e providing the store with Initial heating, electricity,  hot water and proper drainage.
-Interior and Exterior maintenance as well as Painting and Decorating E.g plastering, blasting and sealing which will ensure the building will not be subject to any decay, dampness and corrosion of walls/floors.
-Any Downpayment's required to secure the location in order to start renovating the store.


As I hand design all of my products and hand make my own dolls, bookmarks and notebooks the money will also go towards sourcing out the right manufacturers so I can make the colour blasting and funktastic products on a mass scale that will have the public wanting to two step all the way to the checkout line!


Above: La'Ebony© Hand-crafted dolls, Hair, clothing and accessories all created by myself

The store will also be host to art classes for the public and local community, a place where everyone, especially women and children and even more especially for women and children of colour from all walks of life to express themselves in a colourful and creative way, with the help of workshops and programmes that will create a strong community cohesion, a store like this is truly needed.

As I use software to edit and finalise some of my funktastic designs, the money raised by your donations will also go towards helping me pay for the software I use, although my passion for my work is enough to create a blanket of warmth around this cold globe, I sometimes struggle to pay for the necessary programmes that are fundamental for my business to run. With your help I will be able to kiss the days of worrying about software payments and programmes being cut off goodbye and will be able to concentrate more on making products that will make you flash smiles that reach the sky!

If you believe in people power and everyone coming together to help the high street get a new store that cares for the people with an epically fresh, fabulous and fantastic pallet, then don't hesitate, vote with your wallet! We can't wait to see your big smiles and vibrant spirits walking into our store!

Why is Afro artistry so important to me?

As a child I grew up living in a society where I noticed that all the pretty princesses, beautiful queens, elegant dolls and cute toys did not look like me, like many other black girls I grew up believing that if my hair was not a certain texture, my skin was not a certain shade and if my features were not European then I was not beautiful or as pretty as the toys I played with.

This impression of beauty has proven to be very destructive in my community, causing many girls of colour in my community to adapt to a standard of beauty that is the complete opposite of how they were naturally born. Those little girls who felt that they were not beautiful because of their melanated skin and kinky hair have been permanently damaged from the negative images the media creates in relation to women of colour and from the chemicals they put in their hair and skin to conform to a standard of beauty that is completely opposite to them.


We are all different, diverse and our cultures range, but together we can make a change!

I felt it was time to reverse this cycle in a fresh and flavoursome way so that the next generation of little melanated girls will be proud of how they look and be proud of the skin they’re in. This collectively inspired me to create La'Ebony, where I design and create afro art products such as Dolls, Mugs, Canvases and much more frobulous products that can be loved by everyone no matter their skin colour, but to upscale from selling from a computer and phone in my back breakingly cramped room to my own store I will need your help.


Too cool for school, fresh enough for La'Ebony©!

I feel it is important for young girls to grow up feeling it is cool to be intelligent, which is why I have a range of distinctively bubbly products dedicated to stationary, such as awesome handmade Notebooks, Pretty Pencil Cases and Boomtastic Bookmarks all with a special coat of La'Ebony© Magic that will make you want to write down your wildest stories and delve into your favourite books once again and find some new classics along the way!


I feel my products inspire more women, especially women of colour to become even more intelligent and to feel motivated in accomplishing their goals no matter how much society tries to put them down, no one should feel they can't do something because of their sex or race, and if I raise the funds for my own store with your help I will be able to reach the rest of the public and give them a shot of some La'Ebony© flavour!  I want women to be comfortable in thinking like a queen as well as looking like one, so come on, let’s show them where we are coming from!

I have also created my own limited edition La'Ebony© Barbie style dolls, whose hair is as big and bubbly as the girls they were made for! With your help I will be able to find the right manufacturers to make the limited edition dolls into a full fleet of funky ebony dolls oozing with elegance so no one has to feel that they are not a beautiful princess because of their skin, along with finding the right manufacturers for the dolls, the donations will also go towards producing all of my products on a mass scale with manufacturers who actually care about the people and products they are working with and making, ready to be placed into the cave of colour that will be the La'Ebony© store!


#ProjectLaebony
I am also working on my own children's book to send to African villages in a bid to promote education and motivation in the less fortunate parts of the continent, living in the UK we take many of our day to day resources from the African people without really saying "Thank You", so I feel it's only fair we give something back to those who are always giving to us and show we love and appreciate them. With your generous donations I will be able to complete this project and may be able to carry out more initiatives like this and paint La'Ebony on the global canvas!


Why are we so sure that we will soar?
I have already sold internationally to the United States, Germany and to a woman in the Army! I feel if we raise the funds to create a store for my brand I will be able to reach the far corners of the world, one sassy product at a time!

Smiles that stretch for miles!
The hard work of hand designing and making my products is always worthwhile when I see the bright smiles of my customers posing with their fresh new products, I have a whole section of my customers with their products on my blog, one day I hope to have a whole wall full of pictures in my store with all the lovely diverse faces that have bought my products! You can also view all of my funkylicious products on my website, I will insert all the relevant links below so you know where to go!



Love makes the world go round!
I receive heart-warming messages from supporters telling me how my business has helped change their or their child's life, La'Ebony© has only been running for under a year, I sell from a computer in my room and have already made a positive impact, if we raise the funds to get the store up and running along with mass produced unique products imagine how much of a difference we can all make!


Teamwork makes the dream PERK

To say Thank you for your contribution, at the end of the campaign, there will be a considerable amount of people chosen to receive a La'Ebony goodie bag.
The contents of each goodie bag will vary depending on the contribution amount, whether it be small or big - remember the more you donate the more your goodie bag will contain but will be equally as incredible no matter the size or content.

Donations over £100 will include a CUSTOM CANVAS!

 Thank you in advance for your support!



It's not a mystery, here's how to check out La'Ebony©!

Feel free to visit my website where you can view all of my products www.instagram.com/laebonyarts

Here's where you can check out my blog, with many different features, from customer selfies to an about me section, a direct link to an advert I have created for a mainstream entertainment network and if you still want more I have many more animations on my website!

www.laebonyarts.wix.com/laebony-blog

Thanks for reading!

All Artwork subject to copyright since 2014

story:
To all the lovers, the thinkers, the feelers, the explorers, the quiet ones, the wild ones, the wild at heart. 

My name is Marnie Cameron and I am from Fremantle in Western Australia. I am an experienced perfumer and life lover with a deep calling to work intimately with people, botanical ingredients, art and community.  My products inspire people to connect with their inner Wild Self. 

I have chosen the path of a innovative entrepreneur and I am asking you to buy in to my vision, explore my story and products and share in my success. 

                   


Introducing the Product.

My business is called The Wild Self, a natural botanical perfumery which is focuses on inspiring connection and empowerment. Each and every perfume ignites the senses, the wonder, and the imagination for, what some might say, is an adventure of your own making. 

My perfumes seek to provide you with that in which you want and if you don't know what you want, thats is totally ok, because my perfumes will inspire those questions within you.

My unique perfumes are created by blending the highest quality essential oils into exotic blends that will respond to your individual essence. 

My perfumes are so unique that every effort has been made to ensure that the packaging speaks to product. This is why my perfumes come in hand crafted bottles, elegant jewellery bottles, brass lockets and brass compacts. 


What I am doing:

My history and education extends through  Art, herbalism, Ayurveda, psychology, travel, culture, aromatherapy, ritual, natural organic skincare manufacturing and production.

I have also been very blessed to have the opportunity to work alongside some amazing women around the world working with natural medicine and a special note my mentor Halka Beseda in the Perfume industry. I have helped facilitate perfume workshops in which I shared my skills with women who then went on to  follow their nose (heart) to create a scent just for them and their own unique Wild Self Expression.

My beloved scents are inspired by smell like the wet forest floor in the morning, or the desert lands of the Middle East. They capture timelessness of the Wild Self throughout history….. This is not your traditional floral perfume.

Here is a small example of some of my current collection. 

   

                

                                   



                            Me at the annual Fremantle hand made Bazaar.

                      


Smell is the most primordial sense. The first sense developed through evolution, directly connected to our deep subconscious mind. The sense of scent is directly connected to the limbic part of the brain where emotions and memory are stored.

The Wild Self was born out of years of exploring, creating, and pursuing my dreams alongside an innate passion for the finest, most exotic, natural botanical ingredients.

The heart of this business stems from my own personal and intimate journey of self- awareness and a deep calling to work with, evoke and explore by working with plants as my medium.


Business ethics: 

Integrity

Quality

Transparency

Sustainability

Against Animal Cruelty

Community Orientated

Supporting ethical farming across the globe

Supporting local businesses - Think locally act globally


What I need to raise…

I require $8,000 to establish the business in its initial start-up phase and purchase all the wonderful ingredients, equipment, and other start-up essentials that I require to get this baby rolling. 

I  appreciate any donation to the business so I can help give back in the way that I know how. The sooner I can raise the funds the sooner I can start the business.

Where the money is going:

$5000 - Initial start up stock of oils and bare ingredients.

o  I will need to purchase over 200 different oils from across the globe and Australia. These will be purchased from ethical companies that support their local growers and wherever possible they will be organic.

o  The purest and most refined quality oils are not cheap. Pure rose essential oil is $300 for just 30ml and Grade A Sandalwood essential oil costs $450 for 250ml.

$2000 - The face of the business. This money will be spent on:

o  Packaging

o  Perfume bottles

o  Boxes

o  Lockets

o  Design and all things that make it pretty

o  Commissioning the artist to help create the image  -  which will be the wild self

o  Setting up the website

o  Establishing social media

o  Business cards

o  Labels

o  Stamps

o  Spreading the love.

$1000 – All the necessary high quality lab equipment used in the process of:

o  Weighing

o  Measuring

o  Mixing

o  Storing

o  Sampling and testing

o  Bottling

$800 - Fees and Charges associated with the campaign.

To use Indiegogo and paypal they charge a small percentage of the total money raised (8-10%) for the ability to raise money through this platform. So I have added that amount to the funding I need.

Thank you for reading my story and I am eternally grateful for any donation to my life’s vision. I wish you all so much love and beauty on your path.

Warmly - Marnie

story:
We want to design a coffee house that is specifically designed to be a place where community meets and people can come together and improve themselves and improve their lives. The perfect equilibrium between coffee and art.

Although we will be a for-profit business, we are on a mission to promote positive interactions in the community and to expand the accessibility to art for everyone who comes into our shop, no matter the reason. 


So we asked 4 important questions


Question #1 Why does art matter to you?

Artists from the community will be featured on the walls of the GM Gallery. Good Mornings Coffeehouse & Art Gallery is happy just offering the space to these individuals who are just starting out on their artistic journey. 


Our Artists will be members of the community or organizations, such as schools, and each exhibit will be kicked off with an artist reception for the budding artists and their family and friends. The art will be available for purchase, and all of the money will go straight to the artist. 

Question #2 What can art teach us?


By offering art-related workshops, creative classes, and local art exhibitions, we will put art and coffee on an equal footing in our coffee house. No more will the creative side of this business be a mere incidental. Rather, just as much as we will be pushing our line of food and beverage products, we will be pushing an idea too. We will place art front and center, right alongside the pastry displays and our menu of diverse drinks


In addition to gourmet coffee, offerings will include espresso, drip coffee, lattes, smoothies, muffins, breads, cookies, scones, and rolls, with seasonal variations as appropriate. A well-known, well-established bakery will provide all of our pastries fresh every day, and our customers will come to expect only the finest dining from Good Mornings.

Question #3 What work of art has moved you?


Again, however, it is impossible to stress this enough: the Good Mornings experience will be just as much about seeing, creating, and experiencing art as it is about getting a quality cup of coffee.  We are putting together a uniquely styled coffeehouse that will have art and community at its heart.

Question #4 What's your best museum/art moment?


While this idea is not new, many people are simply fed up with the noise level and lack of personality that coffeehouses today produce. Our mission is to bring back community one cup at a time. That’s why Good Mornings Coffeehouse & Art Gallery has decided to start a crowd funding opportunity to get the ball rolling. We are confident that with enough funding we will be able to make this much needed project a reality!



This startup capital will cover our costs, which are numerous, including equipment, furnishings, supplies, art workshop materials, set up of the Art gallery,  legal expenses, insurance, marketing, remodeling, consultants’ fees, utility deposits, and one month of rent. 

With your contributions, we can make a huge impact in the community and change the lives of many people, filling the world with more local art and more local coffee.




Depending on your donation level, you will receive a very nice gift for you to enjoy. Even if you only donate one dollar, you will receive a thank you letter from The Good Mornings Coffeehouse Team



It's possible for one idea to change the world! 

Help us fund this project, every amount counts. A pledge of any amount is a generous vote of confidence that expresses your commitment and passion for our shared vision. We need your help to make it happen! Select a perk to get started. 

Thank you!

story:
Why Entrepreneurship?

Entrepreneurship equals ownership,economic prosperity, its self sustaining; which translate into freedom.  Entrepreneurs are problem solvers.  They change the world by offering something (product/service) that will simplify your life.  Its fun, you get to meet new people and it also challenges you.  You soon find out what your made of.  It pushes you to realize your true potential.  You get to enjoy what you do, fullgilling your passions and dreams.  It is rewarding; truly.  You get to engineer your vision.

The goals of Super Business Girl is to raise awareness about entrepreneurship to “at risk youth”.  We want to help low-income families acquire income.  SBG will equip children (and young adults) with the necessary tools to become self sufficient through sales, academic enrichment, youth development  and community involvement.  

To so this, we’ll need capital for the following;

Candle making supplies totaling $3000.00. As a result, increased production-(proper equipment, greater output, availability of materials/on-time shipment, purchase bulk/discounted rate)

The candle sells help fund our mission.  Its also a prerequisite of what the academy would offer .  As one of our ongoing pipelines for revenue, SBG will have a store in our facility where we would sell SBG merchandise (we will also contract with other start-up companies looking forward to bring awareness to their product/campaign).  It is also the product our trainees will be selling to earn money.  Our candles, and other SBG merchandise, help to continue to market and promote our company and spread positivity.

Uniforms for trainees totaling $6000.00. Professional appearance=credibility. It helps aid in marketing & advertising.  It adds an element of safety.  An unified image makes you identifiable and shows unity among staff. Ultimately, uniforms make our trainees feel proud and changes the mood of people around them, translating into increased sales!

Marketing supplies totaling $13,500.00 including re-launch of website.  Forums where consumers/interested parties can communicate (feedback, suggestions, reviews etc.)  Tips, blogs, & interactive live streaming helps the consumer to actively participate and follow SBG.  We’ll also be able to improve some major issues like: (* low on-line presence for many competitive keyword phrases, *unorganized social media accounts, *not compatible with all mobile devices, *many bad back links to website) resulting in increased sales!  

Packaging totaling $2000.00. Well thought, well executed, structural packaging.  What it’ll do for our product:

-packaging & product are intricabably intertwined

-intergrating the whole experience for the consumer

Helps our product stand out (sale itself), while inticing customers to buy our product instead of neighbors.  Our mission is also part of the package. Each time a candle is purchased, you contribute to helping at risk youth reach their full potential and develop intrinsic security that makes optimum use of their individualized talent.

Employees/talent totaling $50,000.00.  

*Accountant/financial officer*Social media manager/IT support*Lawyer*Manager/assistant (help with implementation & execution)

Company vehicle totaling $20,000. A reliable vehicle thats insured and bonded would save money from costly repairs of used, outdated transportation, that is not fuel efficient.  Allows more people to participate (recruit more members by eliminating that barrier).  A good portion of SBG success comes from being able to tour and visit other states promoting and selling our brand.

Miscellaneous totaling $2000.00. With these funds we will purchase necessities that are needed along the way.

Last, but not least, maintenance to existing workshop facility totaling $80,000.00.  SBG has invested into property in the city of Detroit.  It provides location and space for workshop.  Its paid for, but needs maintenance.  Operating out of our own home closely ties us to the community.  It’s a forced savings plan, therefore creating wealth/equity.  This investment will give us the capacity to do the work!

SuperBusinessGirl is a company thats centered on correct principles.  We will sustain our company through continuous growth and improvement throughout everyone within the organization. In closing, I want to invite you to help us reach our goal of developing a learning institution that is going to empower students to become self sufficient.

SuperBusinessGirl is a company thats centered on correct principles.  We will sustain our company through continuous growth and improvement throughout everyone within the organization. In closing, I want to invite you to help us reach our goal of developing a learning institution that is going to empower students to become self sufficient.

story:
I am Koi Nikole a divorced mother of 5.  I am a motivational speaker, writer, spoken word artist, women's advocate, volunteer, graduate student, and Training and Development professional. 

This project is important to me for many reasons. As a married, homeschooling mother, my children and I were told by my ex husband to see if we could go and live with my Dad.  We did.  I was devastated, confused, had nothing, and basically homeless.  I was married for almost 14 years because of my beliefs.  After that day, over the last 5 years I have walked in a world of discoveries of self, strength, and purpose.  In fact I have been Awakened!  I want others to be inspired and not have to go through my long process to reconcile their greatness.  Because I am that mother with no resources with an oppressive environment, people, and mindset, my journey is a trophy I love to give to all that want more.

Your help will not only make this a published work available to the benefit of men and women that are stuck but it will strategically give hope to women and children in dire need that are reaching out for help by at least seeking shelter.  You will be apart of the great restoration of Self!

These are survival mindsets that have helped me to acknowledge, survive, and move beyond controlling relationships.  This is my journey from being stuck in a downtrodden state to putting a mindset in place to elevate and reach for release.  Many are stuck in places they were never meant to be.  They are a few pivotal steps away from the freedom from life's dungeon of normal.    I needed a book like this!  There's at least one person there that needs it too!  Thank you in advance!

Phase 1 is to get a copy of Awakened And I Am Everything in every shelter around the nation.  Phase 2 involves a CD empowerment compilation that will benefit a girls' camp.  Phase 3 will encompasses hearing younger voices.

Help me Awaken them and let them know They Are Everything!

 

Originally our budget included a Poetic Audio collaboration, but as I continue to research, our budget entailed more than we thought.  Stay tuned for Phase 2 in summer 2016!

$ 650    Indiegogo & Payment services 10% fees

$ 500    Professional Editing

$ 400    Cover Design

$ 200    E-book & Print Layout

$ 400    Copyright, ISBN, Barcode, Library Control #

$ 200    Website

$1000    Professional Marketing & PR

$ 500     Packaging and Postage

$ 100      Author Photo

$2550   Rewards are usually 30-40% of goal

If our supporters give more, this is a viable option for bookstore sales

$ 750     Book Return Program (Necessary for bookstores to stock)

 

If we go over our budget that will allow us to fill more shelters and go onto Phase 2 which is our Empowerment CD to fund a Girl's Slumber Party Power Night!!!!

Thanks in Advance!!!!!!!!
