story:
Short Summary

Xprtly! enables freelancers/consultants and their customers to
improve their collaborative efforts using data analytics.

***************************************************************

Join our campaign to upgrade the Xprtly! design making our mobile app the only app on the market where you get a support response in 5 minutes (avg). Yes, five minutes. Right now, the industry average response time is 5 days!

The mobile marketplace has numerous apps for productivity and collaboration.

The challenge is that most of these apps were designed primarily for consumers or businesses. As a result, they tend to serve people in a general, non-specific social way. Xprtly!  is specifically about human to human interaction. Our ask anytime, anywhere mobile app works equally well for consumers and businesses!

Our clients' feedback drove how we designed Xprtly!  We felt their desire for more sincerity from freelancers, consultants, and consulting companies. We understood their eagerness for the promise of metrics and their application for achieving performance improvements.

We also felt hope regarding the challenges of finding a stellar business process methodology for clients and experts to interact with each other.

We designed Xprtly!  to improve how clients and their freelancers/consultants collaborate.



Who Are We?

As entrepreneurs, enterprise software consultants, business intelligence consultants, business users (controllers, plant managers, operations managers), developers, designers, and our mascot Windsor, we have worked in a variety of consulting environments.  Many of us have over 20 years of experience working with enterprise resource planning (ERP), customer relationship management (CRM), and supply chain planning (SCP) enterprise software products.

Why Xprtly!?

Poor consulting experiences can cost  millions of dollars from misaligned business processes to partially configured software to poor productivity. We know — because we've worked with companies and individuals recovering from consulting experiences that went "south." We created Xprtly! so that your consulting experiences are helpful, efficient, and cost effective!

You see, after more than 15 years of watching people struggle with enterprise software, we found a way to make the situation better — whether you’re in accounting or operations or in human resources.

Xprtly! is a metrics-driven platform with mobile and web technology that enables clients and their freelancers to improve how they collaborate with each other.

Your company can achieve optimum performance through exceptional processes with Xprtly!

What We Need & What You Get

The feedback we've received is that Xprtly!  is amazing. 

Connecting immediately with an expert who has your answer or solution at their finger tips is a serious game changer for more than software users. Other experts — coaches, small business and marketing consultants — are also included in the expertise areas in Xprtly!

We've designed our perks so that backers, individuals and organizations, can take advantage of Xprtly! 

Individual backers can opt for: 

  • our "Heartfelt Thank You" perk 
  • Xprtly! Communication and Collaboration Best Practices ebook
  • expert advice about software or small business or a career development challenge (and receive a beautifully designed, sustainable key chain from Rebike.)
  • conversation with our Product Architect

For organizations that want better insight into freelancer and consultant activities and value, sign up for one of the Xprtly! Enterprise or SMB perks.

Consulting firms that want to create additional revenue streams and have better insight into consultants' utilization can sign up for one of our Xprtly! Consulting perks.


The Impact

The success of this crowdfunding campaign enables us to create a more engaging single user interface, complete our web app that is accessible from a desktop, and add visualization and drill down to our analytics reports. Our users asked for this, and we plan to deliver. 

When we're finished, Xprtly!  will still be a robust mobile-first experience with an added web-based  "go anywhere and do  business fast" application that revolutionizes your consulting experience. Enterprise software customers and consultants use Xprtly!  to ask questions and get answers fast from their desks, between meetings, or on the road — anywhere, anytime.


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is integration. It takes a lot of development to get that right. We built the alpha version of Xprtly! in 90 days. Our developers and designers tell us that to create a more beautiful and engaging UI, along with final key web applications, will take roughly 90 to 120 days.

We are adding capability to an existing architecture. With that in mind, our biggest risk is also integration. During our initial development we had integration challenges with the mobile apps and the web based administrative portal. We solved these issues by performing numerous white box tests and conducting field tests with alpha/beta users. As a result, our Xprtly! product, as soft launched in the app stores (Apple, Google, Windows), is technically solid!

Our Timeline


Other Ways You Can Help

Crowdfunding is about so much more than funding. It's about community and networking and, generally, trying to find ways to make life better for all of us. So . . . help us meet our goal and:

  • Tell your friends and encourage *them* to visit our campaign  and make a donation.
  • Get the app free! Download Xprtly! and become a user!
  • Encourage your organization to sign up for a business-focused reward.
  • Spread the word on your social media networks.

Thank you for your help! Every little bit moves us closer to delivering a more beautiful, engaging, and robust consulting experience. 

See you in the app!

Join our campaign to upgrade the Xprtly! design making our mobile app the only app on the market where you get a support response in 5 minutes (avg). Yes, five minutes. Right now, the industry average response time is 5 days!
The mobile marketplace has numerous apps for productivity and collaboration.



The challenge is that most of these apps were designed primarily for consumers or businesses. As a result, they tend to serve people in a general, non-specific social way. Xprtly!  is specifically about human to human interaction. Our ask anytime, anywhere mobile app works equally well for consumers and businesses!



Our clients' feedback drove how we designed Xprtly!  We felt their desire for more sincerity from freelancers, consultants, and consulting companies. We understood their eagerness for the promise of metrics and their application for achieving performance improvements.


We also felt hope regarding the challenges of finding a stellar business process methodology for clients and experts to interact with each other.
We designed Xprtly!  to improve how clients and their freelancers/consultants collaborate.


Who Are We?




As entrepreneurs, enterprise software consultants, business intelligence consultants, business users (controllers, plant managers, operations managers), developers, designers, and our mascot Windsor, we have worked in a variety of consulting environments.  Many of us have over 20 years of experience working with enterprise resource planning (ERP), customer relationship management (CRM), and supply chain planning (SCP) enterprise software products.

story:
"The Juice Bar DREAM"

In two words, plenty of dreams and the most successful business plan ...
www.thejuicebars.gr



We were used to talk about the limited options, the things that actually were missing... We were seeking the pure, the healthy and the true full Greek taste from our childhood memories time.  Fresh ideas and endless talks for hours and hours created our Logo and our unique "Recharge your Day" slogan. Instead of the typical Juice bar  which you will  probably find in the most western capitals we reinvented flavors and mixed in the most balanced way our fruits while we offered a huge variety of supreme coffees.  We introduced the best espresso around the city and of course our favorite: Freddo Espresso (cold espresso), Freddo Cappuccino (cold Cappuccino) and Ice cold Nescafe. 

 Starting from the scratch visited more than 500 farms around Greece for developing our Cold Pressed Juice menu while our extremely experienced baristi were preparing the best coffee drinks globally available. The Best varieties of Greek pure organic fruits chosen while the effort of an Eco balance sustainability was first in to our list.  

One of us is the Marketeer, with the most relevant studies and professional background, and the other one is the Mixologist who created the most amazing flavors. The result was magical and inspired more than fifty people to work for a common dream-THE JUICE BAR DREAM !!


The ideal property had to be full of natural elements, like wood, stone and raw metal. Centrally located and with a lot of friends helping in the tough transformation procedure we introduced the first "The Juice Bar" 26th of November with an unbelievable rate of new and returning customers. 


The Expansion Process

The demand was so high that in less than three months we are counting three beautiful health and wellness spots. Major newspapers and magazines dedicated multiple articles which helped our flavors to reach thousands of extremely happy customers. The marketeer is constantly  looking for the gaps in the Market and focusing in the entry barriers while the mixologist is preparing endlessly mixed seasonal juices and unique coffee recipes for the spring.


Big international players put money in the table to take over the Logo and the slogan along with our Juice bars but that is simply against our philosophy and our dream. After all is not all about making money... but creating money for and with the people... Here, is were we need your help by contributing in money or simply by posting this campaign in your profile and make extremely loud noise. We believe in people and the things we may achieve all together. We don't really need multinational companies or strong governments to fulfill our dreams and sustain our local economy. In the Greece of today..the Greece of crisis we offer the best product in the best possible price while we provide well paid jobs in a family environment with a big warm smile. 

Your contribution will help us establish "The Juice Bar" in London -- the first people centered Greek business in the capital of the United Kingdom. We are going to use the construction materials from local Greek companies and a humanitarian bridge between the local bio farms is going to be active in the whole way.

We are not worried of the business risk since the Consumers love the Greek pure products and the success is gonna be huge. We simply need your HELP and of course we will never forget our supporters and we will have the chance to pay back your Love and contribution in every possible way.



Some last details: In April we will be in London examining properties and solving legislative issues while updating our friends around the globe through our website:

www.thejuicebars.gr

Hopefully (!) by the end of the summer we will be present in the United Kingdom and we will serve our amazing juices and coffees to a multinational crowd. 

ACT NOW - BE PART OF THE DREAM AND RECHARGE YOUR DAY !!

story:
Rachel Anne Cash is a third year corporate law student in Durham, North Carolina -- a city that is home to many young professionals who identify as dreamers, thinkers, and doers; in a state with a deep rooted history in textile manufacturing. It must be noted that Rachel’s journey to realize her dream has not been easy as completing a law degree, volunteering her strategic planning skills with a non-profit organization, and planning a business of her own have led to many restless nights. However, her dream is one that will help everyone to sleep easier - both figuratively and literally - as she plans to launch a cut and sew facility that will manufacture luxury bed sheets, and provide more manufacturing jobs in Durham. 

A quick Google© search defines luxury as “the state of great comfort…” --- Indeed, we spend 1/3 of our lives sleeping (presumably dreaming), the other 2/3 should be spent living life to the fullest and taking chances to achieve a state of great comfort. Rachel wants to provide dreamers, thinkers, and doers of all shapes and sizes with comfy bed sheets for that 1/3 of the time that is spent sleeping. Therefore, she is asking you to help her take this chance with the other 2/3 of her life and help get her company where she has dreamed it can be.


​



Our Needs. Your Benefits.

My plan is to manufacture luxury bed sheets right here in Durham, North Carolina. It must be noted that there are very few manufacturing based businesses launching in the U.S. and even fewer of those firms choose to manufacture their goods on U.S. soil.The result of which, has left a disparity between the labor supplied and the labor demanded; more specifically in North Carolina.To illustrate, there are people being educated to work manufacturing jobs that might not even exist by the time they graduate. However, I am seeking to change this by CHOOSING to keep the facility local, in an effort to create jobs in the community. Furthermore, I want to produce goods that are worth the time that people have invested into their development. Goods that employees will be happy to own and proud to produce. Currently, I am collaborating with a local community college that trains people for transferable industrial skills to align the jobs I will create with the people who dream to have them. 

Additionally, I am recruiting people, who've formerly worked for textile mills that are now closed because labor has been outsourced to outside of the U.S. It must be noted that I will insource the fabric from various suppliers around the world and then have the fabric finished, dyed, cut, and sewn here at home. Again, we CHOOSE to manufacture in the United States, so not only can we provide exquisite quality, but also exceptional value. Your support of the goods also means you pledge your support of the people.


Therefore, I have come to you, Indiegogo, for help in raising $25,000. These funds will cover start-up cost for marketing and operations: labor, packaging, machinery, insurance, and producing bed sheets. Through my business relations I am able to confirm that the labor in Durham is readily available, and my plan is a solid one that is supported by the community. With this boost, I know that I can turn this into a functioning, long-term business that will provide stable jobs and high-quality products.


Besides our continual gratitude, we have some great perks for you! 

Currently, we have 3 product lines: Our Private Label Classic Sheet, Luxury Sheet, and Organic Sheet Sets. 


Size Chart: 

Product

Twin

Twin XL

Full

Queen

King

Cali King 

Fitted Sheet

 39x 75

 39 x 80

54 x 75

60 × 80

78 × 80

78 x 84

Flat Sheet

 71 x 98

 71 x 104

86 x 104

92 × 104

110 ×104

108 x 102

Pillowcases

20 x 30

20 x 30

20 x 30

20x 30

20 x 36

20 x 36
Pillow Top and Extra Deep mattresses have become very common.  Our Sheets Are Deep and fit 10 inches to 15 inches.



The Impact of Lose of Textiles in the USA

Textiles, mostly cotton, once dominated the economy of the South. In the past, 40% of jobs were in textile and apparel manufacturing, but that number fell by 2013 to only 1.1% of jobs.  Textiles in the USA were called a dying industry, with plants closing and people losing thousands of skilled-jobs.

  1. We want to hire workers in the USA - training them with a transferable skill.
  2. We want to provide our workers with fair salaries that can support and empower the local community.
  3. We want to make Made In the USA as common as Made In China - helping to bring pride back to USA skilled workforces.


Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge has come from sourcing fabric; very few mills still produce sheeting fabric in the United States and those who do provide fabric are price prohibitive currently. Additionally, most of the foreign suppliers require large bulk orders for the pricing. In the future, we are very committed to using more USA made fabric and integrating it into our product line. 

Another problem we face is competing with large retailers and the international market. We are a minority-woman owned business, we plan to attain certifications that will enable us to seek contracts in the hospitality industry for sustainability. Our goal is to change the industry, by first starting with our online store, then moving into vendor agreements with brick and mortar stores, and finally hotels and hospital suppliers.  We have a sustainable business plan for success and growth.

As we continue to move forward we will be continuously perfecting our brand, website, and other facets of the start-up business. This journey will have its challenges, but your support would mean the world to us along the way.



As a third year law student, I know that sometimes you just can't always contribute monetarliy. But that doesn't mean you can't help! 

Please, Please, Please spread the word!!! 

Share, share, share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the left).

Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 

Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

Tell your mama and them! 


Email: info@rachelannelinens.com

** Terms and Conditions are Subject to Change: including but not limited to  Delivery Dates, Cancellation of Orders if contributions doesn't met amount necessary for minimum production (Funds will be returned to contributor), etc.**

story:
SKYFARMS:  A Space To Grow, Buy and Sell Fresh, Local Food

WHAT IT IS:  SkyFarms creates consumer access to farmers and empty spaces nearby that can be used as farms, to grow, sell and buy fresh, nutrient rich food.

WHO WE ARE:  SkyFarms is a platform that aims to bring a farming demand to market by creating access to local farmers, and space for local farms, to provide fresh grown food for the local consumer.

NASA innovations have shifted when, where and how we approach agriculture by developing a sustainable process of growing nutrient rich food in a soilless mist medium, requiring less space, energy, water and time, making it possible to grow quality food by anyone, anywhere, at anytime.  It is called Aeroponics. 

Driven by urbanization, sustainability, economic volatility, and technology, we have entered an emergent financial market that provides access to goods and services.  It is disrupting, and in some cases, replacing ownership.  It is called the shareconomy. 

In 2020, 70% of the population will live in urban cities.  Virtually all of these cities produce is outsourced and shipped in from hundreds of miles away.  Yet, many of these city's commercial and residential space sits empty and unused, and can be transformed into farms.  The solution is SkyFarms.

The challenge facing potential business farmers today who want to grow their own food locally isn't desire or capability, it's access to space.   Consumers who want to buy local produce also lack access to local farms outside of the weekend farmer's market. 

Enter SkyFarms.  Acting as the Airbnb or WeWork of farming, we fulfill the need in the market to open access to space for people who want to grow, buy and sell local food.    It is a technological resource for farmers to connect, exchange growing support, and for consumers to purchase fresh food grown near them, choosing from four farming methods of soil, aeroponics, aquaponics and hydroponics. 

WHAT WE DO:  SkyFarms is an open source, peer-to-peer portal that provides access to existing soil, aeroponic, hydroponic and aquaponic farmers and empty spaces to be transformed into farms that generate income by supplying fresh, nutrient rich produce to local consumers.  

How It Works: 

1.  Search for SkyFarm near you

2.  Sell and buy SkyFarm food near you

3.  Set-up your farm to sell food near you 

4.  Start a SkyFarm in a space near you

SkyFarm's platform gives space holders, or "hosts" the access to turn their empty qualified space into farms.  After a SkyFarm is set-up, produce orders are placed and managed through the SkyFarm portal. Quality control is assured through peer reviews and ratings, and both farmer and consumer can interact and be involved in the purchasing and growing process.

All transactions will be promoted, facilitated, managed and supported by SkyFarms.  Like other successful shareconomy financial models, a percentage of each transaction is taken for facilitating access of the farm to the consumer, and the consumer to the farm.   This is how the primary revenue stream operates to ensure financial momentum for the individual SkyFarms while maintaining overall company growth. 

WHO WE SERVE:  SkyFarms is the answer to the rising neo, urbanite, and millennial's demand for access to self-generated jobs and locally grown produce.  We serve both those who want to generate a farming business using empty unused space and the residential/business consumers who want to purchase fresh grown, local produce.  We create space for farming, profit for farmers, quality produce for the consumer, prosperity for the local economy and are committed to improving community sustainability and health by growing food.

WHY ITS PERSONAL:   Even though I was born in a first world country, I grew up sometimes living in third world conditions.  I'll never forget the morning I was so hungry for breakfast I ate cake mix donated from the leftovers of a food bank.  It was the last thing in our empty cupboard.  At the time, I felt my future was as empty too.  And while we didn't have the means to get food.  We did have the space to grow it.  

Having grown up around a lot of farmers, I decided if we couldn't buy the food then we would have to grow our own.  Rather than starve by looking at our pretty lawn, I ripped up the grass, which was inedible and wasted resources, and planted seeds that would harvest not only delicious things I could eat, but questions that long since have been with me, and that is, how do we sustain ourselves, each other and this planet?  

Growing up with my life-long friends Beth and Dan Soelberg, I watched them spend more than ten years developing and expanding their farming and homesteading experience.  Having a desire to be more self-reliant, they found ways to live sustainably and keep costs down, while also having a lot of fun with their kids and teaching them what it takes to get food on the table, and how it is made.  

Everyday I live vicariously through their urban farming life I learn something profoundly new, not just about farming, but about the independence, health, happiness, abundance, community, and generosity that flourish alongside the farming process. They are a strong example to the community, close to them, and abroad, of the intrinsic value of managing your resources, in this case food and energy production, and the prosperity that comes from it not just for the family but for the community and greater world at large.

WHAT IS NEEDED:  In order to meet our seed 1 development funding of $45k we need an average of $25 contribution from 2,500 people.  At 3% conversion rate, typical for crowdfunding campaigns, we need to reach at least 85,000 views.  

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can share your time and energy to support access to local farming.  Here are some ways you can immediately get involved. 

1.  Enter our A Space To Grow contest (post your space on Instagram and tag @Skyponics #skyfarmsapp so it will appear on our website and we will choose the winner on July 22.)

2. Share our message and status updates

3. Talk to friends, family and community, over a meal at the dinner table.

4. Stay updated with our weekly newsletter- Sign-up at Skyponics.com

5.  Become a sponsor, advisor, ambassador, or cross promote with us

This initial seed investment will be used to create the first online infrastructure of its kind and includes, but is not limited to, start-up costs such as, app and web development, outreach and marketing to farmers, consumers and space holders, populating the sight with qualified hosts, farmers and consumers, the running costs of network management, legal, marketing and advertising, labor, supplies and materials to plant the very first SkyFarm near you. 

CONTRIBUTION PERKS:

WHATS THE IMPACT:  In the 30 days that it will take to complete this SkyFarm crowdfunding campaign, almost 1,000,000 people will not have access to enough food and will die of hunger.  It happens every three seconds. This is a path that is unsustainable, threatens our security and stability at home and abroad.  

The U.N. declared in 2001 that we had the technology and resources to feed everyone.  It's not that it's not possible to feed everyone, it's just that it's not profitable.  Until now.  By combining the economic mobility of the shareconomy with accessibility of NASA designed aeroponics, SkyFarms is creating the incentive to grow food and earn an income.  

Future Philanthropic Opportunities Also Include Planting SkyFarms for:

-refugees

-earthquake/hurricane/disaster areas

-Africa/Haiti/impoverished urban areas 

-war torn, climate change effected areas 

-churches, schools

-underprivileged urban outreach

-prisons 

-hospitals/veteran/nursing homes

The key to prosperity for all, not just a few, is found within the principles of approaching things in a holistic, integrated and sustainable way.  Many people have been pushed out or will never join the work force.  Many people lack the ability to grow their own food.  Yet, everyone can have access to ways to provide for there basic needs.  We have the resources, technology and space.  Everyone has a right to live.  Our value is not determined by our fiscal worth.  SkyFarms aim to create business incentive opportunities for space owners, farmers and provide the consumer's growing demand for locally farmed produce.  

SkyFarms sustainable approach aims to diversify farming methods to ensure feeding the growing population, reduce pollution, consume less oil/energy, conserve water, fix failing economic/labor practices, instill healthier food quality and control, and finally alleviate hunger.  SkyFarms is designed to foster sustainable values, promote local economic growth, and most of all generate self-reliant individuals and communities.    

On behalf of myself and all those who will benefit from this shift to sustainable farm-space sharing, thank you for your generous seed contribution to our first SkyFarm.  We appreciate every amount of support and awareness in our mission to make it accessible for anyone, anywhere at any time to grow, buy and sell fresh, local food, while also being prosperous for people and the planet.
story_txt:
SKYFARMS:  A Space To Grow, Buy and Sell Fresh, Local FoodWHAT IT IS:  SkyFarms creates consumer access to farmers and empty spaces nearby that can be used as farms, to grow, sell and buy fresh, nutrient rich food.WHO WE ARE:  SkyFarms is a platform that aims to bring a farming demand to market by creating access to local farmers, and space for local farms, to provide fresh grown food for the local consumer.NASA innovations have shifted when, where and how we approach agriculture by developing a sustainable process of growing nutrient rich food in a soilless mist medium, requiring less space, energy, water and time, making it possible to grow quality food by anyone, anywhere, at anytime.  It is called Aeroponics. Driven by urbanization, sustainability, economic volatility, and technology, we have entered an emergent financial market that provides access to goods and services.  It is disrupting, and in some cases, replacing ownership.  It is called the shareconomy. In 2020, 70% of the population will live in urban cities.  Virtually all of these cities produce is outsourced and shipped in from hundreds of miles away.  Yet, many of these city's commercial and residential space sits empty and unused, and can be transformed into farms.  The solution is SkyFarms.The challenge facing potential business farmers today who want to grow their own food locally isn't desire or capability, it's access to space.   Consumers who want to buy local produce also lack access to local farms outside of the weekend farmer's market. Enter SkyFarms.  Acting as the Airbnb or WeWork of farming, we fulfill the need in the market to open access to space for people who want to grow, buy and sell local food.    It is a technological resource for farmers to connect, exchange growing support, and for consumers to purchase fresh food grown near them, choosing from four farming methods of soil, aeroponics, aquaponics and hydroponics. WHAT WE DO:  SkyFarms is an open source, peer-to-peer portal that provides access to existing soil, aeroponic, hydroponic and aquaponic farmers and empty spaces to be transformed into farms that generate income by supplying fresh, nutrient rich produce to local consumers.  How It Works: 1.  Search for SkyFarm near you2.  Sell and buy SkyFarm food near you3.  Set-up your farm to sell food near you 4.  Start a SkyFarm in a space near youSkyFarm's platform gives space holders, or "hosts" the access to turn their empty qualified space into farms.  After a SkyFarm is set-up, produce orders are placed and managed through the SkyFarm portal. Quality control is assured through peer reviews and ratings, and both farmer and consumer can interact and be involved in the purchasing and growing process.All transactions will be promoted, facilitated, managed and supported by SkyFarms.  Like other successful shareconomy financial models, a percentage of each transaction is taken for facilitating access of the farm to the consumer, and the consumer to the farm.   This is how the primary revenue stream operates to ensure financial momentum for the individual SkyFarms while maintaining overall company growth. WHO WE SERVE:  SkyFarms is the answer to the rising neo, urbanite, and millennial's demand for access to self-generated jobs and locally grown produce.  We serve both those who want to generate a farming business using empty unused space and the residential/business consumers who want to purchase fresh grown, local produce.  We create space for farming, profit for farmers, quality produce for the consumer, prosperity for the local economy and are committed to improving community sustainability and health by growing food.WHY ITS PERSONAL:   Even though I was born in a first world country, I grew up sometimes living in third world conditions.  I'll never forget the morning I was so hungry for breakfast I ate cake mix donated from the leftovers of a food bank.  It was the last thing in our empty cupboard.  At the time, I felt my future was as empty too.  And while we didn't have the means to get food.  We did have the space to grow it.  Having grown up around a lot of farmers, I decided if we couldn't buy the food then we would have to grow our own.  Rather than starve by looking at our pretty lawn, I ripped up the grass, which was inedible and wasted resources, and planted seeds that would harvest not only delicious things I could eat, but questions that long since have been with me, and that is, how do we sustain ourselves, each other and this planet?  Growing up with my life-long friends Beth and Dan Soelberg, I watched them spend more than ten years developing and expanding their farming and homesteading experience.  Having a desire to be more self-reliant, they found ways to live sustainably and keep costs down, while also having a lot of fun with their kids and teaching them what it takes to get food on the table, and how it is made.  Everyday I live vicariously through their urban farming life I learn something profoundly new, not just about farming, but about the independence, health, happiness, abundance, community, and generosity that flourish alongside the farming process. They are a strong example to the community, close to them, and abroad, of the intrinsic value of managing your resources, in this case food and energy production, and the prosperity that comes from it not just for the family but for the community and greater world at large.WHAT IS NEEDED:  In order to meet our seed 1 development funding of $45k we need an average of $25 contribution from 2,500 people.  At 3% conversion rate, typical for crowdfunding campaigns, we need to reach at least 85,000 views.  Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can share your time and energy to support access to local farming.  Here are some ways you can immediately get involved. 1.  Enter our A Space To Grow contest (post your space on Instagram and tag @Skyponics #skyfarmsapp so it will appear on our website and we will choose the winner on July 22.)2. Share our message and status updates3. Talk to friends, family and community, over a meal at the dinner table.4. Stay updated with our weekly newsletter- Sign-up at Skyponics.com5.  Become a sponsor, advisor, ambassador, or cross promote with usThis initial seed investment will be used to create the first online infrastructure of its kind and includes, but is not limited to, start-up costs such as, app and web development, outreach and marketing to farmers, consumers and space holders, populating the sight with qualified hosts, farmers and consumers, the running costs of network management, legal, marketing and advertising, labor, supplies and materials to plant the very first SkyFarm near you. 
CONTRIBUTION PERKS:WHATS THE IMPACT:  In the 30 days that it will take to complete this SkyFarm crowdfunding campaign, almost 1,000,000 people will not have access to enough food and will die of hunger.  It happens every three seconds. This is a path that is unsustainable, threatens our security and stability at home and abroad.  The U.N. declared in 2001 that we had the technology and resources to feed everyone.  It's not that it's not possible to feed everyone, it's just that it's not profitable.  Until now.  By combining the economic mobility of the shareconomy with accessibility of NASA designed aeroponics, SkyFarms is creating the incentive to grow food and earn an income.  Future Philanthropic Opportunities Also Include Planting SkyFarms for:-refugees-earthquake/hurricane/disaster areas-Africa/Haiti/impoverished urban areas -war torn, climate change effected areas -churches, schools-underprivileged urban outreach-prisons -hospitals/veteran/nursing homesThe key to prosperity for all, not just a few, is found within the principles of approaching things in a holistic, integrated and sustainable way.  Many people have been pushed out or will never join the work force.  Many people lack the ability to grow their own food.  Yet, everyone can have access to ways to provide for there basic needs.  We have the resources, technology and space.  Everyone has a right to live.  Our value is not determined by planet.

story:
My name is Tamara Solomson and I am co-owner of a technical production company named AFPC, Inc. I have recently branched out and expanded my opportunities by starting my own entity called Live Productions Group, Inc. 

I have spent a total of 17 years in the entertainment and event industry and I love what I do. Being able to take an idea and help build it from the ground up with each and every client is very fullfilling. We have the unique opportunity to not only be creative but to work in an ever changing environment as well. 
My goal for Live Productions Group Inc., is to take earnings as well as business opportunities to the next level. For the past four years we have continued to grow in the live events industry and would like to begin offering more services to our clients. We already own and lease a substantial amount of audiovisual equipment and would like to be able to add photo booths to the our inventory as well as being able to hire additional staff. By opening Live Productions we are able to be so much more versatile than just AV and have begun tapping into the wedding and gala industry which is thriving in Orlando, FL. When corporate events and trade shows slow down weddings pick up. This would be a great way to keep business going throughout the year without a lull in the summer months. 
Of course growing in size also means adding jobs. We would like to purchase multiple photo booths for weddings and events. We will need a staff to set them up, ensure smooth operation and take them down at the end of each event. We'd like to purchase several booths which include all equipment and software. Along with that we will need a few more company vehicles for deliveries as well as the means to market, hire and train staff. 
The risk is very low as we have spent several years in the events industry and have a four year successful track record on our own. We have the clientele, all we need is your help making our dream a reality. 
Thank you for taking the time to help a small business grow in today's tough economy. Your contributions are greatly appreciated!

story:
Dr Oz recommends Sacha Inchi to lose weight. Try our Inca Snacks (roasted Sacha Inchi seeds) rich in Omage 3 and Protein. The Ancient Superfood of the Incas.

Your support can change the lives of more than 1,750 farmers in Colombia. This is the chance they have to stop growing Coca leaves and start growing Sacha Inchi. 


Our Colombian partner buys Sacha Inchi seeds from Farmers in Colombia. We are helping 1,750 farmres in Colombia to grow Sacha Inchi instead of illegal crops like Coca leaves.
More then 450,000 people have died in Colombia due to illegal crops like Coca leaves and more than 6.5 million people lost their lands. Help us to make a change and help this farmers show that they can make a difference and Sacha Inchi can bring them the income they need to stop growing Coca leaves (Coca leaves is used to make Cocaine). 
The Sacha Inchi seeds are then roast, flavor, pack and ship as Inca Snacks (Roasted Sacha Inchi Seeds) worldwide. 


Sacha Inchi products contain a perfectly balanced mixture of healthy omega 3-6-9 fatty acids, and are considered one of the richest sources of protein in the world because they contain all nine essential amino acids. Sacha Inchi products are also loaded with fiber, antioxidants,Vegan, gluten-free, have a high content of vitamin E and A, and are Organic!

Benefit of Inca Snacks (Roasted Sacha Inchi)

1- Essential fatty Acids (EFAs) protect the central nervous system according to research published by the Archives of Neurology.

2- Increased levels of omega 3 EFAs also reduce age-related muscular degeneration and improve vision, according to the Journal of Ophthalmology.

3-Sacha Inchi can improve circulation and blood pressure

4- Sacha Inchi can lower bad cholesterol (LDL) and improve good cholesterol (HDL), according to a study undertaken by the Revista Peruana de Medicina Experimental y Salud Publica in 2011.

5- Omega 3 controls healthy blood sugar levels, reducing risk of Type II Diabetes.

6- EFAs are a great anti-inflammatory, reduce joint pains and rheumatoid arthritis.

7- Can be used as a weight loss aid; a study in 2002 by the Journal of Agriculture found the nuts high in tryptophan, and amino acid that increase the production of happy hormone serotonin which can suppress appetite.

8-Increase production of serotonin also improves mood and lift depression.

9- Helps to absorb Calcium and increase bone density.

10- 100 % Vegan, Organic, Natural, non-GMO, Gluten Free and Kosher.

Dr Oz recommends 600 mg of Sacha Inchi to lose weight

http://www.doctoroz.com/article/10-simple-rules-lose-5-pounds?page=1

For over 3 years our partners and us have been working in Colombia promoting farmers to grow Sacha Inchi. For more than 1 year our partners and us have work to improve the taste of Sacha Inchi seeds and now we have a product ready for the market.  Currently we have the following flavors:

* Chocolate

* Wasabi

* Honey Roasted

* Praline

* Smoke House

* Original

So how does our Inca Snack taste?

Let's ask a cute Squirrel!!


We want to give you the opportunity be part of this Ancient Superfood industry by purchasing our vending machine and selling our Inca Snack Product.

You can change the lives of over 1,750 farmers in Colombia by supporting this project.


Become your own Boss and enter the Health Snack Industry. 

Joint us promoting and selling our Inca Snacks and be part of a healthy Franchise.

By helping us to sell our product you can enter into the vending machine industry and provide a healthy product to your customers.

The global Omega 3 market is expected to reach $3.01 billion by 2022, according to a new report by Grand View Research, Inc. (February 2016).

Demand for Omega 3 was highest in supplements & functional foods, accounting for over 75% of the global volume share in 2014.

With our vending machines you can be part of this business at a very reasonable cost. 


Our Vending Machines are design for small locations where space is limited but you still need the capacity and flexibility of a professional vending machine. Our 12 selection snack vending machine offers 152 item capacity in the same space as a standard file cabinet. The 12 selection vending machine comes standard with the capability of adding on our satellite cold drink vending machine to address beverage demands.

Inca Snack Vending machine can be yours for $4,999. Avergage sales of a vending machine can range from $200 to $1,000 per month depending on location. You make a 50% or more mark up on our products. 

Since your machine will have the only snack with Omega 3 your vending machines should have a higher return than the competition. 

We will deliver the vending machine and our Sacha Inchi prodcuts to your location. 

Our partners and us have worked very hard to bring Inca Snacks and to promote health snacks worldwide. So help us promote our prodcuts and make some $$$ in the process. 

Your can start a new business and help promote health snacks, while helping farmers in Colombia. It is a win-win situation for everybody. 

Many of our farmers in Colombia are doing voluntary substitution from illegal crops like (Coca leaves) to legal crops like Sacha Inchi. What the video to learn more about our project. 


We are already working to bring new prodcust by the end of 2016. Our Vending machine franchises will be the first to get our Inca Milk and our Inca Butter. 


You can also help us by purchasing our Inca Snacks. You can buy a 2 oz, 8 oz or 1 pound sample. 

Please tell your friends and family about our Inca Snacks and the benefits of Sacha Inchi seeds.

5 Facts about Sacha Inchi rich in Omega 3 and protein and why you need to consume Sacha Inchi every day.

Watch this informative video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YcdNrxpiMPg

10 Amazing Health Benefits of Sacha Inchi https://sunwarrior.com/healthhub/10-amazing-health-benefits-sacha-inchi

story:
Hi, I'm Susan Metzger. Three years ago I had a series of unfortunate car emergencies within a short period of time. (No, I wasn't driving a carton jalopy.) I was unprepared to handle any of them and had to rely on roadside services and good Samaritans.

I researched auto kits to be able to equip myself with the right tools and know how for the future. I found the kits on the market to be confusing, poorly assembled and intimidating. As a woman driver I wanted to have a kit I was proud to own and confident to utilize.

With that in mind FLARED was founded. Our mission is to educate women drivers about auto emergency safety and provide them with the tools they need to be secure and empowered drivers. We wanted to design a kit that was organized, aesthetically pleasing, and user friendly.

We felt that one of the still standing stereotypes is that many women are not as knowledgeable or hands on with their cars like men are. They tend to rely on their husbands/ brothers/ fathers to help them out in an auto related crisis.  By putting together this kit, we felt that women drivers would be better equipped and confident to handle any car related emergencies. Even if professional auto assistance is necessary, the tools in the kit will help drivers stay safe until help arrives

We’ve carefully sourced and tested all our materials, including some custom fabrications, with an eye to value and quality.The classic FLARED kit includes jumper cables, box cutter, duct tape, first aid kit, flashlight, glow sticks, hand sanitizer, ice scraper , guidebook, pen, pepper spray, poncho, reflection belt, screwdriver, twine, tissues, and a tire gauge. Our deluxe model has all of the above in addition to a water bottle, sport jelly beans, an LED flare, power bank, and umbrella.


As will all new startup ventures, there is a limited amount of risk involved. At FLARED, we attempted to predict any potential problems that may come up with manufacturing and shipping. Based on our experience and incredible group of professionals on the FLARED team, we have solutions ready for these problems. We’re passionate about this project and will do whatever it takes to see it through, and build a safer more empowered community of women drivers.

When you back our goal, you’re helping to build a community of safe, empowered drivers. We’d like to send a big thanks your way for showing your support for the FLARED movement.

story:
Our business goals are to bring a small asian market to this area. With boba tea, asian coffees, groceries, accessories, wares, and a small take out menu. 

We were well on our way when the sublease/business arrangement was pulled out from under us and we were unexpectedly closed down by our business partner.

Our business "partner" spent all of our money and fled back to Egypt.

 When we opened we were operating from a negative - $700.00 business account balance due to his negligent spending.

The "partner's" older brother, still here in the states, changed the locks on our business. He was given permission to do so by his brother. I contacted the landlord and he confirmed, we were not legally on the lease, and the Brothers could lock us out. 

We are generating seed money to relaunch, hopefully in the Strawberry Street location, however we have found other locations of interest and a full blown restaurant would be ideal!

The year has been racked with set backs and pitfalls, but my team and I are still optimistic and willing to move forward with our business plans. 

Please help us get to the next phase of this trip. We are recovering losses, and building a new business without "partners". 

Thank you for your time, consideration and donation! 

Sincerely,

Jojo and the Strawberry Gang~
story_txt: Our business goals are to bring a small asian market to this area. With boba tea, asian coffees, groceries, accessories, wares, and a small take out menu. We were well on our way when the sublease/business arrangement was pulled out from under us and we were unexpectedly closed down by our business partner.Our business "partner" spent all of our money and fled back to Egypt. When we opened we were operating from a negative - $700.00 business account balance due to his negligent spending.The "partner's" older brother, still here in the states, changed the locks on our business. story:
Why Copper City Brewing?:

With a population of over 30,000 people and a National Monument that attracts nearly 90,000 visitors each year, Rome does not have a microbrewery. Rome's brewing history began around 1851 and existed in full force until roughly 1920. An attempt to revive it after prohibition was unsuccessful and the industry simply faded away.

Copper City Brewing Company will celebrate this rich history by bringing the brewing industry BACK to its rightful home in Rome, NY. Imagine an attractive gathering place where you can enjoy a hand crafted pint of beer, a tasting flight or even a glass of wine from one of our many great NY wineries. You'll be surrounded by copper, steel, and historical photos, capturing the manufacturing industry that helped shape Rome for centuries. We will highlight & pay homage to our impressive history while we progress forward to a new day.

Where the money goes:

We have invested a $100,000 of our savings to purchase the brewery site, and estimate an additional investment of $200,000 to complete renovations & purchase the brewing equipment. Your contributions will provide up front capital. Together, we will give the building an amazing face lift and create one of the best gathering places in Rome. To thank you for your contribution, you will be rewarded with some very cool perks; from Copper City merchandise, to "Beer for Life," Brewmaster-for-a-Day, and private catered parties in the tasting room. Every contribution receives a gift. Every contribution is appreciated.

Impact:

Rome needs this. Breweries are a destination for craft beer lovers & it is proven that craft breweries have a POSITIVE IMPACT on communities. Rome will draw more visitors as a result of the brewery, and these travelers will be consumers for other businesses in the city, including shops, hotels, restaurants and our many historic sites. Additionally, breweries are known CATALYSTS for new small businesses such as restaurants and retail shops, and often compliment recreational activities such as cycling, running, and sightseeing.

This project will join the transformation already taking place in East Rome and the brewery will create jobs. Just a few, at first, but with enough community & regional support, we believe an expansion is inevitable.

By supporting this campaign you are making a DIRECT IMPACT in changing the city’s image. You can have a hand in helping us create a business that Romans can be proud of and to which visitors will flock. YOUR GENEROSITY WILL HELP US CHANGE ROME, not just help build a brewery.

The building is located off of E. Dominick St, near Rt 49 and directly across from the Rt 365 off ramp. It is situated at a main entrance into the city from both the east & the west and positioned perfectly for making a POSITIVE first impression. 

Challenges:

We can brew great beer, but making enough for everyone in our basement is impossible. To provide this area with ample craft beer we have to make 150 gallons at a time and that is expensive. With 1/3 of our money already invested, making this campaign successful is very important. Many of our expenses are immediate (licensing, inspections, renovations, equipment down payments, etc…) and receiving our loans & grants are still weeks to months out. Your assistance will provide the springboard we need to get this project off the ground by our target date of Fall 2016.

Message from the owners:

Dan and Lori & Eric and Erica would like to thank you for your support in helping us bring this new venture to Rome.

We live here, we love it here, and we will serve this city until we lift our last pint.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask people to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
THANK YOU!

story:
What We Do!

Tri Cycle Farms Inc is a 501(c)3 non-profit urban community farm located in the center of Fayetteville, Arkansas that focuses on building “Community Through Soil”. Tri Cycle Farms Inc was founded to rehabilitate urban land with the goal of encouraging an agrarian lifestyle in Fayetteville and as a model for other cities across the US.  We focus on farming fresh, naturally grown food that we share with our neighbors who struggle with food insecurity. A third of the food we grow is shared with our volunteers, a third is distributed those in need, and a third is sold at our Crossroads Farmers’ Market. At Tri Cycle Farms Inc we educate children from pre-k through college about gardening, growing, and the importance of eating fresh food. We teach young people and families about building structures from gardens, to sheds, to chicken coops. Tri Cycle Farms Inc. strives to bring people back to a simple way of life that focuses on fresh, naturally grown food, a lifestyle of generosity, with a goal to decrease food insecurity. Donating to our organization will directly impact the lives of community members in Fayetteville, Arkansas by further decreasing the amount of people who go to bed hungry. We are growing community through soil and a 'farm-raising' movement and we need YOUR HELP!


Why We Need Your Donation!
As a local non-profit community farm, we rely on community support! Without donations from you there will be no us! 

Our Fundraising Goals: $75,000

Our fundraising goals are to hire a Farm Manager, pay for two Arkansas GardenCorps service members and transform our Community House into a neighborhood Food Hub!


One Year of Support for:

  • Farm Manager Salary- $23,000
  • Two Arkansas GardenCorps Service Members- $11,000
  • Community House Operations- $15,000
  • Phase 1 Food Hub Infrastructure- $13,000
  • Cold and Dry Food Storage- $8,000
  • Expand Classroom and Office Space $5,000

What Your Contribution Will Do 


Hiring a Farm Manager and two Arkansas GardenCorps service members will help us triple our capacity to grow more food in our annual gardens, establish a food forest throughout the property and meaningfully engage our growing number of volunteers. By tripling the amount of food we grow we can triple the amount of food we share with those in need!

Transforming our Community House into a neighborhood Food Hub!

Currently in our Community House we host classes, workshops, meetings, children's groups and administrative offices. We want to create a neighborhood Food Hub where we can prepare, store, and distribute food to our community. Renovating the kitchen of the Community House into a neighborhood Food Hub is an integral step toward our vision! The Tri Cycle Food Hub will be used to increase access to local foods by offering affordable storage, distribution  and outreach services. The food will be grown at Tri Cycle Farms as well as provided by other local producers. This food will be distributed to pantries, churches, schools and other people in need, as well as, directly to families and individuals.



How Do We Grow Community Through Soil?

Tri Cycle Farms is an urban community farm and a registered 501 (c)3 nonprofit located in the heart of Fayetteville, Arkansas. Tri Cycle Farms advances food security in our community through sharing, teaching and farming. We teach community members urban agriculture, nutrition and wellness principles and distribute naturally grown food to volunteers and neighbors in need. The Tri Cycle Farms mission is growing "community through soil" as we steward food awareness, education and empowerment. Our vision is a world with food security, sovereignty, and sustainability for all!


 Hands in the Soil


Almost 20% of Arkansans live in poverty and Arkansas routinely ranks between first and third in national reports for the number of food insecure, especially among children. Tri Cycle Farms is located in the center of Fayetteville less than a mile from the Flagship campus of the University of Arkansas. The neighborhood around Tri Cycle Farms has around 2700 residents who are living below the poverty level with approximately 650 households receiving SNAP benefits. Locally grown food is the key to directly impacting our community and creating a more resilient future for us all.


Tri Cycle Farms has both provided for and empowered the community. As we continue to build community through soil, we invite you to join us. We depend on your support to grow to the next level of our outreach to produce and distribute sustainable, naturally grown food, but most importantly community empowerment!



         

Harvesting for Sunday Supper Community Meal


                                                                                                                     

Kids at the farm work, learn, and eat!


           


       

Currently our gardens provide more than 20,000 square feet of bed space for growing the food we share with volunteers, give to community meals and pantries and sell at our Crossroads Farmers' Market.                                   


Farm Manager Profile:
The women in our community have so profoundly shaped our farm through hard work, dedication and ingenuity and we are proud to continue to support the future of women in agriculture as we hire our first Farm Manager. Nikki Halsel has been at Tri Cyclist since the idea for the farm was first being formed. She has been a leader on workday events, devoted countless hours of her time working in the garden and shared her vast knowledge of plants. Nikki's professional experiences include growing and maintaining thousands of plants at nurseries and botanical gardens, landscaping and farming. With her vast knowledge of perennials and native plants Nikki teaches us something new every time she's in the garden! Through all of her experience Nikki has proven that she will be a great person for this job!

               



 

 
                                                                                                                                                           What YOU Get                                                                                                                                When you contribute to Tri Cycle Farms you become part of an incredible group of people who work tirelessly to ensure that Fayetteville has a dynamic, healthy food system for generations to come! The perks for this campaign, described on the right, are designed to welcome you into our Tri Cycle community and express our sincere appreciation!

 

     


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute now you can still be part of the Tri Cycle team! Please share with your friends and networks and use the Indiegogo share tools. Visit our website and follow us on Facebook to learn about volunteer opportunities, classes and events!  Come visit the farm and see what YOU are a part of!

www.tricyclefarms.com      www.facebook.com/tricyclefarms

story:
Short Summary

The Shift is a neighborhood coworking and community space that supports, promotes, and connects people to each other and their local community, and provides affordable learning opportunities for all.

We are located in the Uptown neighborhood of Chicago which is a multi-cultural, economically diverse area that did not have any shared work spaces prior to our launch in 2014.

In just 1 year of operation we've:

  • Supported and promoted over 80 members on social media, in weekly newsletters, at community events, and in-person
  • Hosted more than 25 Lunches and Socials for Members to initiate networking and collaboration opportunities and build a professional community
  • Taught over 30 classes attended by over 450 people
  • Provided more than 50 hours of free meeting space for community groups
  • Donated over $1,000 in coworking services to local nonprofits

In order to serve and support more people in our community, The Shift is raising $25,000 to renovate our space so that we can increase our member capacity, improve functionality and comfort of our workspace, and widen our array of professional services and learning opportunities for all.


Your contribution to our campaign will allow us to:

  • Increase professional services available (ex: legal, accounting, tech, marketing)
  • Increase classes and workshops for both members and the general public
  • Buy additional desks, chairs, and office amenities to increase our capacity
  • Build a kitchen, countertop bar, and cafe seating area for members and events
  • Add lounge furniture for members and visitors to de-stress
  • Add sound absorbing panels to reduce noise and echo
  • Add additional electrical outlets, air circulation fans, lockers, and mailboxes
  • Add rugs, plants, and artwork for a cozier, more comfortable environment

To see a list of our previous classes & events, click here.

To express our gratitude and to keep in line with our mission to support and improve our local community, The Shift will donate 5% of its operating profit to a neighborhood nonprofit or community group effecting positive social change. This donation will continue throughout the life of our company!

Just a few of the organizations we plan to donate to:
Sarah's Circle, RefugeeOne, Chicago Market, Lakeview Pantry, Buena Park Neighbors, Uptown United, Inspiration Cafe, Chinese Mutual Aid Association

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise at least $25,000 which will allow us to remodel and improve our space for current members and event attendees, while increasing our capacity for new members, class offerings, and professional services.


Our perks are designed to accommodate YOU:

  • If you just want to show your support for The Shift, we'll send you a cool coffee mug and/or hoodie as a thanks-for-being-a-friend! 


  • If you are interested in a coworking membership at The Shift, we have perks that will provide you discounted membership AND fun freebies! The 2 coworking discounts available through this campaign is:


Our Anytime Membership is a NEW option (for use beginning January 1, 2016), and only available through our crowdfunding campaign! Want multiple months at this price? Select the "Shift Member" perk and for every additional $100 you contribute, we'll credit you 1 month of Anytime Membership!


This is your chance to get a 2-for-1 deal on our new Dedicated Desks (beginning January 1, 2016)! 

For the price of 1 month ($295), you'll actually get 2 MONTHS of Dedicated Desk Membership! 


  • If you are passionate about supporting small business, creating environments where people can come to work, learn, and get connected to each other, and a lover of all things local and community - we have perks that invite you to become a valued partner of The Shift. In return, we'll give you a free party for you and your friends, and/or proudly put your face on the famous Shift Mural!


The Impact We Have

Economic - As a hub for local professionals to gather and exchange services, we have the ability to drive economic development in our own neighborhood by attracting and retaining skilled professionals. Those professionals dine and shop at local businesses, and The Shift purchases all of its snacks and supplies locally too!


Community Building - By being close to where people live, we've created a place for people to meet their neighbors and learn about opportunities to get involved in their local community. 


Education - By hosting classes and workshops at affordable prices ($10-$25), we've made learning accessible to everyone. 


Growth - As The Shift grows, our ability to provide convenient and affordable work/study/meeting/learning space will grow too - meaning we can service more people and make a larger impact in our community!


Risks & Challenges

The concept of "coworking" (a shared work space and community) is still very new, and many people have never heard of it, or are not yet a believer in the benefits. 

The good news is that referrals are our #1 source of new business, meaning as we grow, our members will continue to refer their friends and family too! 

Additionally, as we grow, our impact on the surrounding businesses will grow too (ex: more members means more people going to lunch in the neighborhood). 


If You Can't Contribute Financially

We understand if you can't contribute financially (we're entrepreneurs, we KNOW ALL ABOUT IT). 

Please consider sharing this campaign with family or friends via email, social media, text, or calling them over the phone - or better yet, in person!

Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to easily tell people about our campaign.

And last but never least:


THANK YOU!

The continual support and encouragement by ambitious, forward-thinking people like you is what builds great communities and motivates entrepreneurs to keep going no matter what, and achieve great things!

For the price of 1 month ($295), you'll actually get 2 MONTHS of Dedicated Desk Membership! 





If you are passionate about supporting small business, creating environments where people can come to work, learn, and get connected to each other, and a lover of all things local and community - we have perks that invite you to become a valued partner of The Shift. In return, we'll give you a free party for you and your friends, and/or proudly put your face on the famous Shift Mural!



    The Impact We Have Economic - As a hub for local professionals to gather and exchange services, we have the ability to drive economic development in our own neighborhood by attracting and retaining skilled professionals. Those professionals dine and shop at local businesses, and The Shift purchases all of its snacks and supplies locally too!






Community Building - By being close to where people live, we've created a place for people to meet their neighbors and learn about opportunities to get involved in their local community. 




Education - By hosting classes and workshops at affordable prices ($10-$25), we've made learning accessible to everyone. 



Growth - As The Shift grows, our ability to provide convenient and affordable work/study/meeting/learning space will grow too - meaning we can service more people and make a larger impact in our community!





    Risks & Challenges The concept of "coworking" (a shared work space and community) is still very new, and many people have never heard of it, or are not yet a believer in the benefits. 

The good news is that referrals are our #1 source of new business, meaning as we grow, our members will continue to refer their friends and family too! 
Additionally, as we grow, our impact on the surrounding businesses will grow too (ex: more members means more people going to lunch in the neighborhood). 


If You Can't Contribute Financially
We understand if you can't contribute financially (we're entrepreneurs, we KNOW ALL ABOUT IT). 
Please consider sharing this campaign with family or friends via email, social media, text, or calling them over the phone - or better yet, in person!
Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to easily tell people about our campaign.
And last but never least:


THANK YOU!

The continual support and encouragement by ambitious, forward-thinking people like you is what builds great communities and motivates entrepreneurs to keep going no matter what, and achieve great things!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kesten Semso, a Bosnian,have lived in Malaysia for 33 years after got married to my wife. First thing i had in my mind when people ask me about Malaysia is - What a beautiful place it is, a true beauty ( but after my wife of course)-is  blessed with a lot of natural resources. Being an engineer, I can't help but to develop things i see in front of me. I picked the oil palm leaf. The one trivialized but in reality carries many benefits.

People discarded oil palm fronds when take the fruit that use to make vegetable cooking oil. I realized that the leaf can be made into livestock feed and the rib can be benefits in pulp and textile industry.But to make oil palm fronds as livestock feed, the leaf and mid-rib must be separated. This is because livestock such as cow and goat unable to digest wood cellulose that come from the mid-rib.So, i made the leaf-rib separator machine. The YouTube video link as prove is:




The further reading on oil palm leaf is:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B85TPfbIqhe4aXVRN01HX1NTbXc/view?usp=sharing
- (research on health benefit of oil palm leaf text)
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B85TPfbIqhe4VmZ2UUJ5WUE0YnM/view?usp=sharing
- (list of crude protein of livestock feed including oil palm leaf)
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B85TPfbIqhe4ai01WWxqS28tSUk/view?usp=sharing
- (research proposal text)

The oil palm leaf as livestock feed have many benefits. Besides the leaf that have many health components in it and high crude protein,the oil palm land itself can be used for the goat or cow to roam free, so they can play and socialize with each other. This is more humane than compact, overcrowded shed that being use widely in livestock industry. 

                                                                                  ***


In the mid process, i also invent machine to make broom from oil palm rib and i realize that broom that made from oil palm rib is very practical in real life sweeping.

So, this is the post all about, the broom (KestenBroom) after-all. To ask for funding to build more machines for it, to buy raw material and to rent small factory to operate and cost to commercialize it such as register on Alibaba.com.

Why don't i ask funding for my leaf-rib separator machine instead? It is more profitable and beneficial to the world, right? 

The answer to that question is: it needs a lot of funding-cost to complete the machine such as  buy oil palm land, goat, milking equipment, silage and many more to realize a pioneer plan so government and big companies can see for themselves the benefit and positive impact of leaf-rib separator machine.

So, i aim to use my broom project to fund my leaf-rib separator project myself in the future.


Key advantages of our broom

Our broom is from oil palm rib but unlike others typical oil palm broom, our broom are MACHINED.

This result in stronger and more durable AND beautiful brooms.

The broom market actually do not have broom that can sweep garden or tough sweeping area. The corn broom is soft. It is good for indoor sweeping but not for tough sweeping area like garden or roadside. The plastic broom is not environmentally friendly and still do not have the quality from oil palm rib that is – elastic and tough.

In conclusion, the world still lacks of outdoor broom that works. Yes, coconut palm broom already exist in the market and have positive review about it but then again, they are not strong and durable. They are easily dismantled as slowly one by one the coconut rib get uprooted. This is common problem in any coconut broom product as they are made by hands while our broom are made by sets of machine.

In short, KestenBroom is a great product with great market value for someone that in search of unique broom product that works.

And furthermore, our broom and stick are two separate items that can be permanently attached later.This make cost savings for storage and shipping.

Other advantages of our broom product is:

1. The first and only machined palm broom in the world.

2. Non electrostatic.

3. Environmentally friendly.

4. Beautiful and unique design.

5. Most of all; Highly durable.


What we need

In order the broom project to succeed, we need fund to build more machines that make the broom, we also need a small factory to operate and to store oil palm rib that we bought.We also need some fund to register our company and product in marketplace such as Alibaba.

For it we at least need US 80,000 Dollar.

If the broom sells well oversea, we will use the money on leaf-rib separator machine project.And all positive impact that revolutionize food-meat industry that more healthy to eat and more humane can be realized.

So, i really need your help in any way to make my dream come true-to bring positive impact on livestock industry. So it will be  healthier and more humane for our generation and generations to come.If you can fund my project you are most welcome. Any amount will do. But if you cannot donate, you can help spread the word so many people know about this project and its benefits. Thank you for your time and patience to read all through. Together, hopefully we can bring positive change to this world and last but not the least - Viva Revolution!

Link of to view broom catalog here:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B85TPfbIqhe4UE...

KestenBroom - The Broom Revolution.

story:
The 10 year reunion is coming up July 23rd at Waxy O'Connor's in Keene. As of right now, we have $650 in the class account. Many of you expressed an interest in contributing to the class reunions via Indiegogo campaign. 

The money raised will be transferred into the general class fund and be used for this, and upcoming reunions - it does not necessarily mean that there will be no costs  associated with the reunion to each attendee (i.e. individual drinks or food).

I have set the goal at $650 which I think this is a reasonable goal if everyone can contribute what they are comfortable with; the campaign will end in 30 days, but the funding page will remain open after that for contributions. The money is held by Indigogo until the campaign is ended, at which time it will be transferred as one lump sum into the class' bank account with TD Bank.

story:
10th Annual Whiteaker Block Party

The Whiteaker Block Party has successfully created a 100% free and volunteer run event for the past 9 years. Starting as a group of friends that wanted to celebrate the uniqueness of the Whiteaker neighborhood, it has grown into one of the largest block parties in the world with attendance reaching 8,000 people. 
The Whiteaker Block Party offers multiple stages showcasing local talent, vendors with local crafts and food, game areas, a kids zone, art galleries, beer gardens with locally made craft brews, and more! Our focus is on celebrating the Whiteaker community and sharing it with visitors from around the world.
As the event has grown, we need contributions to assist in the operating costs of the event.
To keep Whiteaker Block Party free, we rely on the fact that the event is entirely volunteer driven and donations from people like you! 


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise at least $10,000 this year for the operations cost of Whiteaker Block Party. Remember, this is a completely free event and 100% volunteer driven! Not a single cent goes toward the organizers of WBP.
Our operational budget last year was close to $42,000. All of that money went in to giving you and all who visit us access to multiple stages, over 30 musicians and bands, wild entertainment, and free fun! Even $5 from all of you that come to enjoy the event would get us to our goal and beyond!

What will your contributions go to?
  • Infrastructure costs including rentals for stages and lighting
  • Permit and city fees
  • Insurance
  • Security
All of the above are some of the necessary items that we are required to have for the WBP to have it's event. They're also the most expensive and cost far over the $10,000 we're looking to raise here!
If we don't reach our goal, any funds raised through this campaign will still go toward all the above listed areas.
Perks listed will be available for pick-up at the info booth day of event unless otherwise requested.


It's Free. Why Should I Donate???

As the Whiteaker Block Party has grown over the past 9 years, so has the cost and the demand on resources. 

As the late and great Brad Coffey said, the Whiteaker Block Party is "Seeking to preserve and enhance the social fabric of the Whiteaker Neighborhood. Engaging it in merriment, and exploring within it the pathways winding across the moral spectrum. We seek to foster communities through our libations, our celebrations, and our pop-up driveway dance parties by partnering with and promoting the creative pulse in our neighborhood."

Your contribution will help make the 2016 Whiteaker Block Party better than ever and aid in keeping this annual event free for you and anyone that attends!


Can't Contribute Right Now? We Understand. There are Other Ways to Help Us!

  • Share our event sites: WBP Website, Facebook, Instagram.
  • Share our indiegogo campaign with all your friends! Click on the magical, floating, favored social media icon. On your mobile phone? Copy and paste the link! https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/whiteaker-bl...

story:
Short Summary

We want to repair damages we suffered during storm Ophelia, and expand our business we need your help. Here are some project's we want to achieve:

  • Repair damages, this is the main project, after the storm our insurance refused to help so we have again turned to our loyal customers.
  • Expand our business, we want to expand the range of products we sell, along with open an online shop with nationwide delivery.
  • Expand our farmers market, we want to expand our Sunday market adding a community Marquee and expanding the market in general. 

For more info on each project follow us on Facebook or signup to updates here on Indiegogo,

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how you can help us!

  • By signing up to one of our membership deals you are investing in our future,
  • We believe that by signing up for our awards that not only will we benefit but so will you. With free coffee great savings on plants and member only offers, along with many events we are planning for the year.
  • Why not consider buying a membership for someone as a gift, it is the ideal gift for a garden enthusiast. 

The Impact

The impact of each membership sold will be massive, you are investing in the future of our business and our community:

  • You are helping us expand our business to better service our customers.
  • We have been very involved with community projects all over Cork, we are involved with 3 Tidy Towns communities long with community groups. 
  • We have also invested in many events which greatly benefit the community from our weekly Sunday market to our charity dog show's.

We believe we have made an impact in the community, can you help us to continue on this path.

Other Ways You Can Help

Have you already signed up to our membership scheme, well you can still help:

  • Please spread the work about our campaign both online and offline, tell everyone.
  • Refer people to our campaign, check out our Facebook page here

We really appreciate all the support we have gotten from our loyal customers over the last few months, through all the ups and downs you have been there.
