story:
Our Background

Ta-ha-wus is said to mean Cloudsplitter, referring to Mt. Marcy, the highest mountain in the Adirondacks.  To us that means reach for the sky because there is no limit to creativity and learning.  And that’s also why we need your help.

Today the Tahawus Center is a place for ideas - with room to move.  It emerged from a 104-year old building, the tallest in town, which had been neglected and was in boarded up condition when we, dance artists Craig Brashear and Rebecca Kelly, took it over through Appleby Foundation in 2010.

Tahawus demonstrates that a cultural center contributes in a healthy way to a community.  Each year progress is made to reclaim and improve space within the building to allow for new summer programs and activities to serve neighbors and visitors with an array of educational and cultural adventures.  Preservation of this historic building is the green pathway that connects past and future – and the surrounding community!   Improvements (including 22 window replacements) have been made possible entirely with crowdfunding support.  

And because of  people like you, Tahawus Center is now home to the Windows Gallery and the Cloudsplitter Dance Studio,  which has seen rehearsals for music-theater productions and dance groups including North Country Ballet Ensemble and Rebecca Kelly Ballet, and welcomed Adirondack Yoga  Adventures. Cloudsplitter Studio, with its permanent exhibit of dance photography by Todd Bissonette, keeps people active and engaged with summer swing dance workshops for adults, ballet classes for beginners, important symposia on climate change, women's issues, and more.   

The Gallery also serves as an important learning, meeting, and gathering place. Science Labs for youth (STEM) and Kids Co-Motion early childhood movement classes have continued since 2012.   Tahawus has hosted a Butterfly Talk, Music-in-the-Gallery events, and post-film chats accompanying the new Tahawus documentary film series.  

What We Need & What You Get

Insulation

$5,000 is needed now for attic insulation and repairs.  Not so glamorous perhaps – and mostly invisible, “sealing the envelope” remains the vital key to restoring this historic building to make it accessible.   When this is achieved, we can provide zoned heating on upper floors, which means they can be used ALL YEAR ROUND.  

The Impact

Your support cycles directly back into the local economy in creating a longer season to hold diverse art exhibits, community gatherings, youth workshops, ongoing cultural and education programming, and year-round yoga classes.  The Tahawus Center spurs economic development on Main Street by adding attractions and activities for all ages.  Hospitality businesses, restaurants and stores along Rt 9N and Main Street also benefit from increased traffic.

Future Plans 2016 summer: 

  • In June, Tahawus continues the new Au Sable Forks documentary film series
    in a partnership with its neighbor, the Hollywood Theater  
  • July presents the annual STEM Science lab for youth 
  • Dance classes for all ages including swing dance workshops for adults 
  • Weekly yoga classes  
  • August introduces Tahawus' first Plein Air Workshop and exhibit, and
  • Cello / Fiddle workshop, ceilidh, and concert with Celtic and classical cellist, Abby Newton

With improved insulation, the Tahawus activity period will extend into the late fall and early spring.  

When You Support the Tahawus Center

You can choose among some unique rewards.  Just imagine – a canoe trip on the Saranac River to a secluded beaver dam, followed by refreshments at Camp Clarion;  a private tour of the Tahawus building for you and a guest, tickets to a performance of Rebecca Kelly Ballet in NYC or in Lake Placid,  a series of yoga classes in Cloudsplitter Studio with Stefi Kearns, or just be very cool carrying  an attractive and  convenient Tahawus carry bag anywhere.  Every single dollar raised goes toward the repair and insulation of the attic of this historic building, while improving its function in the community. 

Each improvement milestone to date has come with a lot of elbow grease, determination, volunteers, and heartwarming contributions.  Some support has come from individuals not even located in the Adirondacks, but contributed because they want to support this effort, this vision, this community!  

Funding for infrastructure is very challenging to obtain.  It's mundane -- but it is the essential bricks and mortar of a much bigger vision.  Donations from local businesses and from individuals enable Tahawus to continue to make these critical renovations while maintaining its purpose every step of the way:  to strengthen community by providing access to - and participation in - the arts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is about more than just raising money.  It is about a group of people who support what is happening at the Center today and what can happen there in the future - which will enrich the lives of all who live and who visit the region.  It is also about winters – and summers - in the small towns of our beautiful mountains.  If we can work together on projects like this in Au Sable Forks, maybe our success will inspire other communities. Help us continue to transform lives through culture, education, empowerment, training, and imagination, coming together and caring about our community.  

Your help getting the word out is extremely valuable.  Please describe this venture to your friends.  Use the "share" to link the Tahawus Attic campaign from Facebook. More about Tahawus is found on Vimeo  and the Tahawus website.

Indiegogo reminder:  Donations are not 100% tax-deductible  unless rewards are "refused."  If you want to make a tax-deductible contribution, please contact us.  Or just click "make contribution." Then select at the bottom of the page where it says you don’t want to receive perks, and fill in your amount.   If you do not want recognition on the web, we can list you anonymously. Shipping within U.S. is included for most levels though we appreciate pick up. International shipping fees and certain restrictions apply.

Tahawus Center is now home to the Windows Gallery and the Cloudsplitter Dance Studio,  which has seen rehearsals for music-theater productions and dance groups including North Country Ballet Ensemble and Rebecca Kelly Ballet, and welcomed Adirondack Yoga  Adventures. Cloudsplitter Studio, with its permanent exhibit of dance photography by Todd Bissonette, keeps people active and engaged with summer swing dance workshops for adults, ballet classes for beginners, important symposia on climate change, women's issues, and more.   
The Gallery also serves as an important learning, meeting, and gathering place. Science Labs for youth (STEM) and Kids Co-Motion early childhood movement classes have continued since 2012.   Tahawus has hosted a Butterfly Talk, Music-in-the-Gallery events, and post-film chats accompanying the new Tahawus documentary film series.  

What We Need & What You Get

 


Insulation$5,000 is needed now for attic insulation and repairs.  Not so glamorous perhaps – and mostly
invisible, “sealing the envelope” remains the vital key to restoring this
historic building to make it accessible. 
 When
this is achieved, we can provide zoned heating on upper floors, which means they can be used
ALL YEAR ROUND.     The Impact 
Your support cycles directly back into the
local economy in creating a longer season to hold diverse art exhibits,
community gatherings, youth workshops, ongoing cultural and education
programming, and year-round yoga classes. 
The Tahawus Center spurs economic development on Main Street by adding attractions and activities for all ages.  Hospitality businesses, restaurants
and stores along Rt 9N and Main Street also benefit from increased traffic.   

Future Plans 2016
summer: 



In June, Tahawus continues the new Au Sable Forks documentary
film seriesin a partnership with its neighbor, the Hollywood Theater  
July
presents the annual STEM Science lab for youth 
Dance classes for all ages
including swing dance workshops for adults 
Weekly
yoga classes  
August introduces Tahawus' first Plein Air Workshop and exhibit, and
Cello / Fiddle workshop, ceilidh, and concert with Celtic and classical cellist, Abby Newton

With improved
insulation, the Tahawus activity period will extend into the late fall and early spring.  



When
You Support the Tahawus Center


 
 
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 
 
 

 
 
You can
choose among some unique rewards.  Just
imagine – a canoe trip on the Saranac River to a secluded beaver dam, followed
by refreshments at Camp Clarion;  a
private tour of the Tahawus building for you and a guest, tickets
to a performance of Rebecca Kelly Ballet in NYC or in Lake Placid,  a series of yoga classes in Cloudsplitter Studio with Stefi Kearns, or just be
very cool carrying  an attractive and  convenient Tahawus carry bag anywhere.  Every single dollar raised goes toward the repair and insulation of the attic of this historic building, while improving its function in the
community. 





Each improvement milestone to date has come with a lot of elbow grease, determination, volunteers, and heartwarming contributions.  Some support has come from individuals not even located in the Adirondacks, but contributed because they want to support this effort, this vision, this community!  
Funding for infrastructure is very challenging to obtain.  It's mundane -- but it is the essential bricks and mortar of a much bigger vision.  Donations from local businesses and from individuals enable Tahawus to continue to make these critical renovations while maintaining its purpose every step of the way:  to strengthen community by providing access to - and participation in - the arts. 



Other Ways You Can Help
This campaign is about more than just raising money.  It is about a group of people who support what is happening at the
Center today and what can happen there in the future - which will enrich the lives of all who live and who visit the region.  It is also about winters – and summers - in the small towns of our beautiful mountains.  If we can work together on projects like this in Au Sable Forks, maybe our success will inspire other communities. Help us continue to transform lives through culture, education,
empowerment, training, and imagination, coming together and caring about our community.  Your help getting the word out is extremely valuable.  Please describe this venture to
your friends.  Use the "share" to link the Tahawus Attic campaign from Facebook. More about Tahawus is found on Vimeo  and the Tahawus website.
Indiegogo reminder:  Donations are not 100% tax-deductible  unless rewards are "refused."
 If you want to make a tax-deductible contribution, please contact
us.  Or just click "make contribution." Then select at the
bottom of the page where it says you don’t
want to receive perks, and fill in your amount.   If you do not
want recognition on the web, we can list you anonymously. Shipping within U.S.
is included for most levels though we appreciate pick up. International
shipping fees and certain restrictions apply.

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are three sewing mavens who want to share our passion of working with and creating things from fabric with our greater community. While our individual roads to CBM SEWing & Design meandered in different ways, when we came together in our shared studio space just a few short months ago it was as if a giant lightbulb went off. Actually, it was more like a chandelier! Our ideas and goals aligned perfectly, and over Aver's cups of champagne CBM SEWing & Design was born!

Carrie Burnett (CB) is a working mom of two who manages to run her own small boutique brand, BeriBee Designs, while also maintaining many ties in the community.

Maggie Selo (MS) is based in Lafayette but ventures down to Bloomington part-time since retiring from Purdue. She is the Mags half of the mother-daughter team that is Bets & Mags, a small label maker of children's toys and baby accessories.

Elizabeth Winchester (EW) is a work-at-home mom of two & daughter of Maggie. She is the Bets half of Bets & Mags and also runs a boutique brand of children's clothing & accessories called Curly Pigtails.

WHAT WE HOPE TO BE

CBM SEWing & Design will be open for classes, events, and open stitch hours that are posted in advance. More than that though, we hope to become the place you think of when you want to sew or even just talk about sewing. We want to establish a warm, welcoming space where you can come and be creative, where you can come and learn new things, where you can come and meet other people who share the same passion! While we'd like to eventually expand to carrying fabric and notions, our main focus at this time is to establish a space for community sewing so we won't be a retail shop at this time.

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

In order to fully stock our space with machines and supplies, we need funds! Here's what we hope to obtain:

Sewing Machines ($1,000-1,600): We want to make sewing accessible to everyone, even if you can't or don't want to spend the money on your own machine. We will be purchasing 4 to 6 standard sewing machines for use in classes or rental during open sewing times. These will be machines that are readily available and affordable for even the casual sewer - there's no point in falling in love with a machine that you'll never be able to have in your own home!

Tables and Chairs ($1,000): We have a lovely but very empty 200 sq ft space that's perfect for classes and Sip and Stitch evenings! Sadly, right now we're using a variety of folding tables and chairs that are far from ideal for sewing comfortably. We would like to put in sturdy tables and chairs that will accommodate everyone who comes in to the space.

Rotary Cutters & Scissors ($400): While we already have a great table setup for cutting, we are in need of various cutting utensils for use during classes. 

Various Small Notions ($100): It seems like there are always lots of little items that we need when we are sewing: pins, pin grabbers, machine needles, rotary cutter blades, snips, pressing cloths, soft measuring tapes, and many other handy notions. Oh, and bobbins! Because some of us seem to go through those like they're going out of style, but we're not going to name any names....

WHAT IF YOU REALLY, REALLY LOVE US?

Are you wondering what happens if we appeal to lots and lots of you and we end up with more funds than we're initially requesting? Not to worry, we have dream goals that we will then be able to fulfill, meaning that we'll get to offer even more exciting options in classes and workshops. For instance:

Sergers & Serger Thread ($1,400): While they're definitely not required for sewing with knits (think t-shirts), they are preferred! We would absolutely love to have 4 basic level sergers (and the appropriate threads) available for classes and rental to help you learn what the heck a serger is and how to use one. Carrie and Elizabeth use their sergers regularly and have picked up many tips and tricks along the way - we want to share our knowledge!

Snap Press ($100): From baby clothes and bibs to pouches to interesting replacements for zippers - snaps can be used in so many different projects! We would love to be able to have a heavy duty, high quality press available for classes and workshops to make it a happy experience for all (and if you've used some of the alternatives, you know already that they can be extremely frustrating!).

Irons & Extra Board ($600): We already have a nice ironing table available for use, but our current iron may not be able to handle the amount of use we're anticipating. Unfortunately, nice quality irons come with a nice hefty price tag. We would love to have 1 or 2 of these beauties on hand, along with a second ironing board that we can pop up when needed. It would be great to also obtain some of specialty pressing pieces like tailor's hams or seam rolls.

Steam Press ($300): Some of the workshops we hope to offer will involve fusible interfacing, and the one of the best ways to do use this important item is with a steam press. It also can be used for heat-press vinyl (picture cool t-shirts you design yourself!), and we'd love to offer classes showing you how to use this really great tool.

We'd also love to be able to purchase a loveseat, coat closet, and other items to make the space more comfortable for everyone who comes to share our space - we want to create a place where we ALL love to spend time! 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Our greatest challenge for this sewing studio will be generating interest to fill our classes on a continuing basis. We have seen so much interest in sewing lessons the past few years from family, friends, and community members, but we will need to work hard to help that enthusiasm transfer to real commitment. We intend to heavily advertise on social media as well as local media outlets. We will offer a continually changing schedule of classes and workshops which should also help with student retention.


We would be truly honored to have your help and support in establishing an open community of people who share our passion!

Please note that if you would like to receive a perk, you must choose it from the right side of this page before proceeding with any contribution. Thank you!

story:
Angel Radiance candle and crystal company originally named Angelight has grown and expanded into the need for a storefront as well as a long term home for candle production. After five years of keeping our production location private our landlord has given us the opportunity to purchase this commercial property and make it ours.  For those who don't know us, our candle company specializes in pouring Angel blessings and healing qualities, hand-poured by Ayesha. We use only the highest qualities of eco and sustainable waxes with pure essential oils - organic when ever possible. Pouring both pillar and jar candles, we offer many sizes for your pleasure and affordability  For those who want our candles for scent or ambiance our lovely sacred line made of eco-soy wax with plant botanicals and pure essential oils (almost all organic) create a lovely aromatic experience.  

We have a large client base who love to have us pour special request candles for them.  This might be a birthing candle, a wedding candle, a candle that supports a harmonious home and or work place including areas of personal & spiritual growth , health & healing business success.  We pour candles that support you in what you want to create in your life.  Some call these prayer requests.  As always these divine blessings are poured and one has the potential to sit with and cultivate the creation as the candle burns while some just catch the blessing as it is poured and never pick up the candle.
Angel Radiance has been a founding vendor at the East Nashville Farmers Market, the 12ths Farmers Market, the West End Farmers Market at Vine Street and the original Richland Market. After 9 years of markets we are now blessed with many private clients and events as well.  ur main markets this year are 12th South and the new Richland Market. 


This growth and expansion will allow us to produce way more candles, help many more people and serve our community in a way that  many have been asking for the past few years. When we do events we are blessed to bring our crystal friends, which we bring in thru many wonderful crystal and mineral distributors, usually small family businesses that specialize in highest quality and well-intended wonderful people.  This enriches our hearts and all who they go to. Joining the Angelic realms with the mineral kingdom is 35 years of life's work and what a wonderful wonderful job it is.  


Immense GRATITUDE for your support to see this dream come true. Looking forward to pouring candles for you. Much love from Ayesha and all of us at Angel Radiance where "friends become clients and clients become friends."

For sales and inquiries call 615-385-1966 or email angelradiancesales@gmail.com.

story:
Penh Lenh Mission - to empower margenilized and at-risk young women in Cambodia to pursue their life goals through quality education, vocational training, and advanced career opportunities.

Question:

Have you ever given someone a gift that you just know they are going to love?  Or, have you ever been part of a team that makes you feel special?  Let's take this even further..... Have you ever been part of a cause you truly believe is making an impact and possibly changing lives for the better?  

I hoped and dreamed that I would feel that way when I first started Penh Lenh.  Now, nearly 3 years later, I can honestly say that not only have I found a Cambodian family with my Penh Lenh team, but I've seen the lives of young women...

Empowered. Impacted. And Changed. 

Penh Lenh Cambodia:

I know, that's a pretty bold statement and from the outside looking in, we might just look like a cool jewelry company with a social mission attached.  So...let me actually tell you more about what we do at Penh Lenh.  

All trainees and new employees are given assessments to determine their skill level, education level, and to assess any learning disabilities.  Penh Lenh's program has been developed to work with a wide range of education levels and our staff is trained to work with young women who suffer from cognitive delays and other learning disabilities.  Our curriculum is designed to "meet every girl where she is at" and fill in the gaps where she needs.  

We offer a free 2 month vocational training program with a focus on skill training and introduction to business and professional skills

Penh Lenh offers part-time and full-time job opportunities to any girl who completes the Penh Lenh training program.  Not only will we continue to build on their jewelry making skills, but our job training program includes: budgeting, communication skills, customer relations, professional skills, conflict resolution, teamwork, health & wellness, and life skills.

We are committed to seeing the impact of our work long term so we set goals and do regular evaluations of all of our trainees and staff to see how they are progressing and what areas they still need extra help.  Each staff member has daily goals and meets with her supervision weekly to check in about all accomplishments. 

We love celebrating successes.....big and small!  

Penh Lenh Artisan, MH

Why Support?

We are more passionate than ever about empowering young women in Cambodia, raising the standards, and impacting a culture!  

Opening a Penh Lenh Flagship Retail store will allow us to:

  • Expand our Vocational Training Program - to include product pricing, welcoming customers, customer relations & care, product arrangement and store aesthetics, taking inventory, working a register and being responsible for money, event planning, building and maintaining vendor relationships, and much more! 
  • & Offer Job Opportunities to MORE Young Women 
Your support will help us:
  1. Get registered with the Cambodian government to open a retail store 
  2. Maintain a higher standard of salaries and health care benefits for all on-boarded staff members for our Penh Lenh retail store
  3. Purchase necessary supplies and material - training and educational materials, product supplies, jewelry displays, signs/logos/marketing materials

Now back to our first question - have you ever given someone a gift you know they will love?  Think about that feeling wrapping the gift up just perfect for them and the anticipation you feel before they open it. 

Maybe you get the camera out because you have to capture that first moment they see that very special gift.  

If you are about to support Penh Lenh - THIS is exactly how you should feel.  Because for us, your gift is that special and will be treasured and appreciated more than you know.   Your gift will be used to 

Educate. Empower. and Impact.

the lives of some very amazing young women in Cambodia.

Penh Lenh Artisan, SY

Spread the word:

  • One more thing - help spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!  Share our link on your social media, via email, and any other outlets you might have.  

xx - 

Rachel

story:
At Levend Bagelry, we focus on transforming five simple ingredients into NY inspired beautiful, crackly, chewy bagels.  Since August 2015, we have been operating out of a commissary kitchen in Malden, selling at pop-ups in West Concord, delivering bagels to your homes and offices throughout the Boston area, and at the Cambridge Winter Farmer's Market.  We are now looking to make the leap into a retail space where we will bake bagels throughout the day for breakfast, sandwiches, pizza bagels, and grab bags for you to take home or to the office.

We'll have an open kitchen so you'll be able to watch the whole process from start to finish and we'll be serving them up hot from the oven.  Our bagels are always hand-shaped because I would never deprive you of the improved taste over commercial bagel conveyors, nor would I deprive myself and our bagelers of the enjoyment of shaping these magical gluten rounds.

In order to complete the build out, we'll need to buy a refrigerator for the bagels' long cold fermentation, a large mixer, a kettle for boiling, an oven, tables for prepping the bagel dough and sandwiches, and walls and a display case.  I'm hoping this campaign will cover a portion of these costs.

Instead of going to business or culinary school, I decided to start small and learn on the job.  It took a few months of planning for me to move from baking a couple dozen bagels in my home to making 400+ in a commissary kitchen.  As part of our next growth stage, I am sure we will hit some roadblocks as we move towards opening, but overcoming obstacles is one of my favorite parts of being a business owner.  

Thank you for supporting us in our mission to bring you the best bagels in Boston.  If you like good bagels, take a look at our rewards, pick your favorite and give yourself a pat on the back for helping your local bagelry come to life.  Then help us out and share this with your friends to keep the news spreading.  We hope to see you soon!

Note regarding perks:  Unless otherwise specified, bagel perks are for pickup only.  If you live far away, let us know and we'll give your bagels to a random customer and send you a picture of a stranger whose day you made.  T-shirts will be available for shipping.

the bagels' long cold fermentation, a large mixer, a kettle for boiling, an oven, tables for prepping the bagel dough and sandwiches, and walls and a display case.  I'm hoping this campaign will cover a portion of these costs.Instead of going to business or culinary school, I decided to start small and learn on the job.  It took a few months of planning for me to move from baking a couple dozen bagels in my home to making 400+ in a commissary kitchen.  As part of our next growth stage, I am sure we will hit some roadblocks as we move towards opening, but overcoming obstacles is one of my favorite parts of being a business owner.  Thank you for supporting us in our mission to bring you the best bagels in Boston.  If you like good bagels, take a look at our rewards, pick your favorite and give yourself a pat on the back for helping your local bagelry come to life.  Then help us out and share this with your friends to keep the news spreading.  We hope to see you soon!Note regarding perks:  Unless otherwise specified, bagel perks are for pickup only.  If you live far away, let us know and we'll give your bagels to a random customer and send you a picture of a stranger whose day you made.  T-shirts will be available for shipping.

story:
Help Us Launch Kalik

Kalik | գալիք

Kalik –  As in, Forthcoming. Next. The soon-to-come. Near Future.

Kalik is an interdisciplinary arts company & spaceship. We arrive at artmaking as generative and transformative mediums for expressing urgent truths, recalling ancestral stories and teachings, while simultaneously visioning future worlds that centre healing, justice, and love. Through Kalik we will create and produce original and participatory interdisciplinary art, performances, films, digital media, literature, events, gatherings and workshops, working with and alongside many artists, creatives, and advocates for the kinds of worlds and communities we know are possible and that we are actively building. 


Kalik has grown from the need to:

  • disrupt the (inequity, fuckery, and brutality of the) systems we live in
  • reclaim our cultural knowings and practices
  • celebrate our queer and gender-fabulousness
  • create great art that represents the experiences of those of us typically underrepresented or not at all represented in dominant media

We are called urgently to this work and know that it needs to sit centre.  In launching Kalik and this fundraiser, we are saying that our stories, our communities, our survival, our resilience, and our visions for the future, are vital and significant. We are setting the intention that this work is fundable, and we can do this.

 Especially with your help.

The Creators Behind Kalik

Kalik comes from the collaborative partnership between Kamee Abrahamian and lee williams boudakian. We are interdisciplinary artists, producers, and facilitators. We first came together to create Dear Armen. The project was conceived during a three-week artist residency in September 2013 at the Abrahamian Arts Centre in Yerevan, Armenia. Since its inception, Dear Armen has morphed from staged reading to interdisciplinary production featuring two distinct versions and five incarnations, which have toured throughout Canada, USA, and Armenia. Out of our work with Dear Armen has a grown a creative partnership, vision, and mission that is becoming Kalik.


What We Need & What You Get

We are raising startup money for Kalik!

We are actively seeking ways to make Kalik, as an entity, become sustainable. This means being able to fund all phases of our projects. It means being able to adequately compensate artists for their time and labour. It means being able to make a living wage, i.e. a wage that can cover the basics costs to live. And ultimately, it means funding towards the creation of works that can become the brilliant creations they are meant to be.

Your contributions to this fundraiser will go directly to our startup costs, including our initial operations expenses, time, labour, rental/purchase of equipment, communications costs, travel, as well as providing a base of support as we apply for and secure further funding. 

A glimpse into the projects we are working on:

    • Dear Armen (theatre incarnation, performance-installation incarnation)

    • World of Q (film)

    • Workshops & Curriculum development (ancestral storytelling, diasporic futures)

    • Boxes (theatre)

    • Kindred Analogues (documentary, transmedia)

As a contributor, you will get awesome perks including original art and limited edition merchandise, tickets to our shows, a spot in one of our workshops, producer credits, visibility for your own work through cross-promotion and opportunities for collaboration. 

Working collaboratively and within community is a high priority for our work, not only to execute the best possible art, but also politically to be building community and connecting with folks to create meaningful engagement and dialogue. We see Kalik as a platform that will engage artists and creative people at all stages of the learning/making process. 

We are looking to create dynamic projects with you.


The Details

Living as we do, in and between Canada and the US, we continue wrestling with capitalism as we explore our funding possibilities. We are actively searching for funding models that are ethical and in line with our politics. We do not have easy or clear solutions, but we are committed to asking hard questions towards answers. Currently, our funding model integrates live events and shows with ticket sales, workshops and educational programming, grants, sponsorship, fundraising and the sale of original art & merchandise.

We are a blend of creative and practical-­make­-it­-happen-­despite-­the-­odds. We are currently operating on very small budgets, and stretching these to make the absolute most and the best we can.

We have many ideas, and are excited to keep building.

Your Support Has Impact 

We have tiered donations/perks so that all levels of donations come with something awesome. And/but, It is possible to donate to this campaign outside of the listed perks. People are welcome/invited to donate any amount they can/are able, and we are grateful for each and every supporter. 

In addition to donations, our hope is that you can help us spread the word. We are aiming to get this campaign to people who are in positions to donate, and who will agree that this work is vital. 

Finally, if you have thoughts and/or feedback and/or recommendations, please be in touch with us. Your involvement is essential to us and this work. You can find us at: www.kalik.org

Thank you for being part of this journey with us.

story:
Janwaar Castle is a community organization in Janwaar Village of Panna District, Madhya Pradesh, India. To help community development, Janwaar Castle is focussed to unfold the passion in the lives of the kids. The tool to do so is skateboarding. A sport where you fall often and learn to get up and stand back on your feet, or rather the skateboard. one of the mid term goal of Janwaar Castle is to prepare some of the Janwaar kids to participate in the 2020 Olympics representing India in skateboarding. 


What We Need

We plan to buy a Canon XC10 professional camcorder. It is best suited for run-and-gun applications, such as documentary and many types of event shooting, where the larger form factor of an interchangeable lens cinema camera or DSLR might prove impractical.

The camcorder would cost us $3000.

Our Story

Since the past few weeks, Janwaar Castle is gaining a lot of attention. People from around the world are getting in touch with us and asking more about how Janwaar Castle is changing the village.

The change that is happening in Janwaar is not only limited to the village itself, but spreading rapidly all over. Policemen of the nearby town of Panna want to train themselves in skateboarding to learn balance. About 15 social entrepreneurs from different parts of India have already reached out to us to start a similar project in their own area.  

All these events have encourages us to record the activities of Janwaar Castle and keep the world updated about the growth of the kids and their programs. We believe that there are a few good things about life that the world can learn from this tiny little village of Janwaar.

In the upcoming months we have the following projects that we plan to document:

1. Training Programs - September to October

Two of the best skateboarders in India - Toni and Happy will come to Janwaar in September and October to help the kids prepare for the skateboarding challenge in November.


2. Janwaar Castle Skateboarding Challenge - November

Janwaar Castle has it’s own events time and again. Our first skateboarding challenge will be organized from 12-14 November. It is a nation-wide skateboarding event inviting all kids from the age of 6-16 to participate in a challenge at Janwaar. Apart from this we also have exchange programs.


3. Disappearing Dialogues - October

Ulrike Reinhard is participating in a research program to explore the rural communities and find a way to bridge the rural-urban gap

story:
reSports Tee-Shirts

We simply want to print a bunch of reSports T-Shirts and this is how to get them started. Order your reSports shirts now at at a special low price with free shipping to Canada and the USA! The shirts after this campaign will be priced at $30 each.

About reSports

reSports started as an eSports radio show on CKUW 95.9FM. We have since grown and have moved to be hosted on AYBOnline.com where we can reach more of our target audience, fans of eSports and gaming! Live recordings of reSports are broadcast on Sunday nights on Facebook (Facebook.com/resportsradioshow & Facebook.com/AYBOnline) and the episodes are posted Mondays on AYBonline.com and reTouchmedia.com. 

Stretch Goal

After we sell out of the Early Bird and Early-ish Bird price tiers (the $10 and $15 tiers), I will also put your name on the back of the shirt free of charge! So get your sweet gamer tag or whatever name you want on the back of your jersey [keep it PG ;)] just by telling your friends about these shirts and get them to buy-in. Support the show and look like a pro gamer [and who knows, maybe we'll start an reSports team some day :D].

story:
Short Summary

HISTORY:

Hello Everyone!  My name is Sheila Barsness and I am disabled. I suffer from Bipolar disorder and PTSD. I am currently stuck in the welfare system known as SSDI (Social Security Disability Insurance). Every month more than 14 MILLION people receive disability benefits from the United States Government.  I was so relieved when I was awarded disability benefits because I would be able to take care of my family since I was literally unfit to work for other businesses. 

In 2011 with the help of a friend I started the business Community Funding Solutions, LLC, a grant writing company that specializes in helping small nonprofits and start-up businesses get grants and small business loans for their projects. I have been writing grants and helping people achieve their dreams since 2002. Before the non-profit world I spent 12 years working in the Art/Craft Industry as a store manager. 

In 2015, I did something stupid. I went off of my medication because I wanted to fit in and be "normal" like everyone else.  Some people should just not be off of their medications (I am one of them).  Short story is, I ended up opening a store when I was manic and changing the name and adding to the focus of my business. It is now Art With A Purpose Co-op, a multi-shareholder cooperative for small business start-ups, nonprofits, and socially challenged individuals like myself. We put a special emphasis on creativity, community and working to educate and build social reform of the current government systems for people with mental health disabilities. I have 2 co-partners each one of them suffers from PTSD or Depression  and we all have a hard time conforming to a "normal" job.  

On SSDI I am able to earn up to $800 per month and keep my benefits. If I make $801 I lose my insurance and cash benefits.  The problem is that I can't support my youngest child on $801 or pay for my meds, my nurse and my bi-weekly psych visits and doctor appointments, my rent payment, and all of the bills associated with life.  

Why should you care?  You should care because I have a way of saving taxpayers more than $25 billion dollars per year, improving the economy by taking people who are barely scraping by because they are stuck in a system that does not work and find creative ways off of the system and give them the ability to afford things that they currently can not afford like a car, house repairs/house or the ability to create their version of the American dream.  

I want off of the welfare system as do millions of Americans in my situation. We went on the system thinking that it would be temporary only until we find the proper medication or treatment and to find out that in order for us to get off of the welfare system and be self-sufficient we would have to make in excess of $5,800 per month to live in the same poverty that we live in now having to make less than $800 per month.  The government gives me and my son approximately $1800 per month plus our health care and medication costs of approximately $3,200 dollars per month. This means that the government currently gives me approximately $5,000 per month. The current system is that if you go over your $800 you lose your benefits.  If people lose their insurance that means that they stop taking their medication and going to therapy and become a detriment to themselves and others.  

OUR CAMPAIGN

Our Campaign is to raise $51,000. Your investment will give 50 people the ability to apply creative self-help programs that reduce symptoms of depression and anxiety.

It will allow those 50 people to learn new skills that they will be able to use to generate an additional income, become employed or even self employed, through help from our business incubator.  

In addition it will generate conversation of millions of people throughout the state about the despair of the current system. It will lead to awareness and change of the system through the development of a working model, that you can say you helped to build.

$30,000 will provide 1 year of weekly art/craft/sewing scholarships to people with mental & emotional issues that would like to reduce the effects of the symptoms through creative outlets. This will provide 50 people with 52 classes.  The $30,000 covers the cost of the workshop space and material costs.  The instructors for the weekly classes have volunteered their time for 1 year.

$11,000 will be used for educating and empowering people with disabilities to develop skills and become financially sound. The funding will cover the costs of hosting a regional event in the Twin Cities or St. Cloud area that will introduce creativity for mental wellness strategies and social skills and will start the conversation between mental health providers, lawmakers and the people who have mental and physical disabilities to develop a strategy and support for a "scaled" Social Security Disability/Welfare system.

$10,000 will be used to develop a working model for social/welfare system reform. The funding will cover the actual costs of making changes to the system. It will cost more than that, but we have a lot of people who are willing to donate their time and services to make this work. 

What We Need & What You get

$30,000 will provide 1 year of weekly art/craft/sewing scholarships to people with mental & emotional issues that would like to reduce the effects of the symptoms through creative outlets. This will provide 50 people with 52 classes.  The $30,000 covers the cost of the workshop space and material costs.  The instructors for the weekly classes have volunteered their time for 1 year.  

* That comes out to $12 per week per person - where can you learn a new skill, provide self help therapy for $12 a week????

$11,000 will be used for educating and empowering people with disabilities to develop skills and become financially sound. The funding will cover the costs of hosting a regional event in the Twin Cities or St. Cloud area that will introduce creativity for mental wellness strategies and social skills and will start the conversation between mental health providers, lawmakers and the people who have mental and physical disabilities to develop a strategy and support for a "scaled" Social Security Disability/Welfare system.

$10,000 will be used to develop a working model for social/welfare system reform. The funding will cover the actual costs of making changes to the system. It will cost more than that, but we have a lot of people who are willing to donate their time and services to make this work. 


PERKS

$5 gets you a free beverage at the store. We have Coffee, Iced Coffee, Iced Espresso Shots, Lattes, Frappes, Tea, Iced Tea, and Smoothies. You also get a great big THANK YOU!

$20 gets you a one-of-a-kind handpainted dog tag by local artist, bi-monthly video project updates and a great big THANK YOU!

$35 gets you a Never Give Up... Never Surrender t-shirt, A Cyber Hug, A BIG THANK YOU and weekly updates!
$50 gets you 1 bag of our local Artisan Roasted Gourmet Coffee and one of our handpainted dog tags, a hand written thank you letter and weekly project updates!
$100 gets you a custom handcrafted item made by local artists! It also gets you a hand written thank you, and weekly project updates!
$5,000 will give you the opportunity to work with our team to help develop a solution and working model for the welfare/social security disability system!  Here is your chance to be heard!!! You will also be honored at our regional event as a guest or speaker (Your choice) and of course you will get all of the other perks including a monthly phone update!
$25,000 gets you the naming rights to the Art Safari Studio in Alexandria, MN. It also gets you all of the other perks!
If we do not raise the full amount we will do as many Art Scholarships as we get funding for and we will seek out partners to assist us with the education and social reform model.  We are going to do this, it is just a matter of time frame.  We have been working on this project for a few years and now is our time!

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Our project doesn't just benefit the 50 people who receive the training and self-help therapy. It benefits their families, the communities that they live in and the state's economy. It will change million of people's perception of disabled vs. lazy! Most people on welfare or the social security disability system don't want to be there. We are there because of the glitches in the current system that keep us stuck there. We may be unable to work at a "normal" job but through creativity we can find our place in the community and contribute. It doesn't mean that we are unable or unwilling to work, we just stand to lose too much the way the system is now.  

You have the ability to help millions of Americans help themselves out of poverty and the disability/welfare system.  You have the ability to work with us and our team to change the system for 14 million people. Please accept our call of action and invest in creative reform. It doesn't matter if you only have $1 to invest or $50,000 to invest. It is the long game that we are after and we want and need you to be part of our team, regardless of the size of your investment!

TRACK RECORD OF THE TEAM:

* 14 years of experience building small businesses

* 14 years of grant writing experience

* 1 successful state bill and 1 federal bill 

* 52+ work years of creative problem solving and system design

* 26 years of management experience

* 50+ years of Arts/Craft and Sewing experience 

* 9 years of being part of the social welfare/disability system

* 36+ years of helping people fulfill their goals and desires

*  The ability to work beyond party lines and social lines.  (We can work with Trump or Clinton or even Mickey Mouse if he decides to run!)

Risks & Challenges

We have created national scale models before and the biggest challenge is that some people hate change. Education is key and the more people that we can educate the more people will want the change.

To educate people we are going to set up a blog on our website and post weekly YouTube updates so that the information is easily accessible. Every week we will answer questions that we receive so that you can help spread the word!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to invest in the program there are other ways that you can help. If you live close to Alexandria, MN we would love to have you as a volunteer in the Art Safari, or donate art/craft/sewing supplies so that we can keep our costs low for EVERYONE who comes to the Art Safari. If you belong to an organization, please invite us to speak to your members about Art With A Purpose and the Art Safari.

If you are unable to travel to the Art Safari or Art With A Purpose you can still help. Here is how:

* Share our crowdfunding campaign and mission with your family and friends.

*  Keep up to date on our website blog at www.artwithapurpose.com

*  Educate yourself on the subject - ask questions.

$10,000 will be used to develop a working model for social/welfare system reform. The funding will cover the actual costs of making changes to the system. It will cost more than that, but we have a lot of people who are willing to donate their time and services to make this work. 
What We Need & What You get

$30,000 will provide 1 year of weekly art/craft/sewing scholarships to people with mental & emotional issues that would like to reduce the effects of the symptoms through creative outlets. This will provide 50 people with 52 classes.  The $30,000 covers the cost of the workshop space and material costs.  The instructors for the weekly classes have volunteered their time for 1 year.  
* That comes out to $12 per week per person - where can you learn a new skill, provide self help therapy for $12 a week????
$11,000 will be used for educating and empowering people with disabilities to develop skills and become financially sound. The funding will cover the costs of hosting a regional event in the Twin Cities or St. Cloud area that will introduce creativity for mental wellness strategies and social skills and will start the conversation between mental health providers, lawmakers and the people who have mental and physical disabilities to develop a strategy and support for a "scaled" Social Security Disability/Welfare system.
$10,000 will be used to develop a working model for social/welfare system reform. The funding will cover the actual costs of making changes to the system. It will cost more than that, but we have a lot of people who are willing to donate their time and services to make this work. 




PERKS

$5 gets you a free beverage at the store. We have Coffee, Iced Coffee, Iced Espresso
Shots, Lattes, Frappes, Tea, Iced Tea, and Smoothies. You also get a
great big THANK YOU!
$20 gets you a one-of-a-kind handpainted dog tag by local artist, bi-monthly video project updates
and a great big THANK YOU!
$35 gets you a Never Give Up... Never Surrender t-shirt, A Cyber Hug, A BIG THANK YOU and weekly updates!
$50 gets you 1 bag of our local Artisan Roasted Gourmet Coffee and one of our handpainted dog tags, a hand written thank you letter and weekly project updates!

$100 gets you a custom handcrafted item made by local artists! It also gets you a hand written thank you, and weekly project updates!

$5,000 will give you the opportunity to work with our team to help develop a solution and working model for the welfare/social security disability system!  Here is your chance to be heard!!! You will also be honored at our regional event as a guest or speaker (Your choice) and of course you will get all of the other perks including a monthly phone update!

$25,000 gets you the naming rights to the Art Safari Studio in Alexandria, MN. It also gets you all of the other perks!If we do not raise the full amount we will do as many Art Scholarships as we get funding for and we will seek out partners to assist us with the education and social reform model.  We are going to do this, it is just a matter of time frame.  We have been working on this project for a few years and now is our time!  The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:
Our project doesn't just benefit the 50 people who receive the training and self-help therapy. It benefits their families, the communities that they live in and the state's economy. It will change million of people's perception of disabled vs. lazy! Most people on welfare or the social security disability system don't want to be there. We are there because of the glitches in the current system that keep us stuck there. We may be unable to work at a "normal" job but through creativity we can find our place in the community and contribute. It doesn't mean that we are unable or unwilling to work, we just stand to lose too much the way the system is now.  
You have the ability to help millions of Americans help themselves out of poverty and the disability/welfare system.  You have the ability to work with us and our team to change the system for 14 million people. Please accept our call of action and invest in creative reform. It doesn't matter if you only have $1 to invest or $50,000 to invest. It is the long game that we are after and we want and need you to be part of our team, regardless of the size of your investment!
TRACK RECORD OF THE TEAM:
* 14 years of experience building small businesses
* 14 years of grant writing experience
* 1 successful state bill and 1 federal bill 
* 52+ work years of creative problem solving and system design
* 26 years of management experience
* 50+ years of Arts/Craft and Sewing experience 
* 9 years of being part of the social welfare/disability system
* 36+ years of helping people fulfill their goals and desires
*  The ability to work beyond party lines and social lines.  (We can work with Trump or Clinton or even Mickey Mouse if he decides to run!)
Risks & Challenges
We have created national scale models before and the biggest challenge is that some people hate change. Education is key and the more people that we can educate the more people will want the change.
To educate people we are going to set up a blog on our website and post weekly YouTube updates so that the information is easily accessible. Every week we will answer questions that we receive so that you can help spread the word!
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can't afford to invest in the program there are other ways that you can help. If you live close to Alexandria, MN we would love to have you as a volunteer in the Art Safari, or donate art/craft/sewing supplies so that we can keep our costs low for EVERYONE who comes to the Art Safari. If you belong to an organization, please invite us to speak to your members about Art With A Purpose and the Art Safari.
If you are unable to travel to the Art Safari or Art With A Purpose you can still help. Here is how:
* Share our crowdfunding campaign and mission with your family and friends.
*  Keep up to date on our website blog at www.artwithapurpose.com
*  Educate yourself on the subject - ask questions.

story:
Bead Geekz started two and a half years ago as crafters who travelled to small conventions selling the things we made, as a side business to pay for us being able to travel to different conventions and to suppliment our normal jobs.
This simple begining over the course of years turned into a business that was sustaining itself more and more with each passing week. On the weekend of the 7th-10th we were in Houston, Texas for a large convention. One of the largest we had the ability to sell at. We had a pretty good weekend, and were on our way out of town when we stopped to eat. During our 45 minutes eating, our van was broken into, and stolen right out of the parking lot. The van in addition to being our business vehicle, had contained inside of it all of our unsold liscenced merchandise stock, the tools in which we make our crafting items, our personal items including clothing. In addition all of our cash transactions for the weekend were inside the van as well, so all but a small percentage of our profits from the weekend were lost. That van was our business, two and a half years worth of starting from a handful of perler designs a box of glasses and twelve buttons designs and working to build it into a self sustaining business with thousands of dollars invested in liscened merchandise, crafting items, setup, and the van. We are utterly devestated. We have a desire to start over, but little in the way of funds to do so. We do not make a habit of asking for money, but we are caught in a difficult spot, and it has required us to look for a different means to get the funds needed to begin the process over again. Anything you can give, even if it's just a dollar will help and would be appreciated. If you can't help finacially then please share this out to your friends, any help we can get is greatly appreciated. While the van was recovered we lost alot of things includinging 95% of our merchandise, gps, and all the cash we had made from the show so we are basically starting over. This campaign will help us out and will also give everyone a chance to get some pretty cool loot! Thanks! Go like us at www.facebook.com/beadgeekz. Also if you prefer to do a direct donation you can do it through paypal or directly through our gofundme at https://www.gofundme.com/help-bead-geekz-recover.

story:
The idea

We are building an Ecological Surf Camp in Busua, Ghana, because we believe that West Africa has great potential for economic development through responsible tourism. 

The Ahanta Eco Lodge is for the conscious surfer who wants to explore the amazing, uncrowded waves of Gulf of Guinea, while protecting the environment and making meaningful connections with people in the local community.

We wish for the Ahanta Eco Lodge to be an environmental hub for guests and locals alike to get educated and inspired about sustainable living.

 

This is us

Julia and Peter met in Ghana in 2012 when she was doing her Master's degree in Environment and Sustainable Development at University College London. She has studied and worked in Ghana for several years since 2011. Peter is an experienced surf instructor, life guard and the founder of Ahanta Waves Surf School in Busua. In December 2014, Julia & Peter bought a piece of land on the beach and started making plans for how they could combine their passion for surfing and environment to make a positive impact in the local community. In November 2016, Herman Hetland, a Norwegian surfer with a Master's degree in Economics and Business Administration joined the team. We will now work to complete the Eco Lodge together.


What is an Eco Lodge?

To us, an Eco Lodge is based on ecological values and is in itself a closed ecosystem: using biodegradable and recyclable materials, cleaning and recycling waste water, harvesting rain water, generating its own energy and leaving minimal changes in the surrounding landscape. 

Ahanta Eco Lodge is the first rammed earth house in coastal Ghana, and the only Surf Camp on the African continent founded 100 % on ecological principles both in its construction and management ethics.

 

The Impact

Goal #1: Improved local economy in Busua

Objectives: 

a. Attract more tourism to Busua to generate income for local businesses
b. Create meaningful and sustainable jobs at the Surf Camp
c. Offer training and professional development to employees

Actions: 

- Finish the construction of the house and have the Surf Camp fully running by the end of 2017
 

Goal #2 Improved environmental conditions in Busua

Objectives:

a. To have a clean beach for locals and tourists to enjoy
b. Prevent destruction of ecosystems for financial gains

Actions:

a. Collect plastic waste from the beach and send it for recycling
b. Start a turtle conservation program together with Surf & Impact NGO and local fishermen
c. Encourage environmental awareness and action at community meetings
d. Organize workshops for children in Busua primary and secondary school on environmental protection and the importance of healthy ecosystems

 

Why crowdfunding

Because we want to keep our freedom to re-direct a part of the profits from the business to projects that benefit Busua community. Our priority is environmental and social sustainability rather than quick profits, something that doesn't match well with conventional ways of financial investment.

 

Next steps

In order to open the Surf Camp and kick off our environmental projects we need to finish the house. So far, we have worked hard to put all our available funds into the house construction, but being young people still trying to make it in this world, we have realized that we need help to finish. This fundraising will give us the opportunity to keep the construction at full speed, and we will continue to dedicate 110% of our time and efforts to this project. We hope to complete the Eco Lodge and to open the doors to our first guests by the end of 2017.

Risks & Challenges

This is the first rammed earth eco-house we have built so that is new to us. Luckily we have good advisors in the people that helped us in the first stages of the project and a team of experienced workers in Ghana to seek advise from should any issue arise. Julia has a solid education in environmental management from London and Ghana and knows most of the dos and don'ts of a project like this.

Secondly, we are not looking to impose any measures in the community which the people themselves do not want. We will do our best to be a good example by running an ethical business and embracing environmentally friendly practices, but there is no guarantee that other people will do the same. However, we have great support in the locally run Surf & Impact NGO who will join us in the projects we undertake. We promise to involve the community in anything we do that will affect them and we will keep the door open to other suggestions than the ones we have envisioned.

We believe that Ghana has great unfulfilled potential for eco-tourism. Recognizing that the Western African region has had its challenges in recent years, we are nevertheless optimistic that the best days are yet to come.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be so happy if you could share this campaign with anyone you can think of that could be interested in supporting us!

We appreciate any kind of support, even if you, or someone you know, have advice on different sustainable solutions or ideas for the Eco Lodge.

story:
What is the Buzz About!

My name is Vanessa Bright and I am establishing a socially conscious enterprise, BeeHavin’.  BeeHavin’, is an online wholesaler and retailer of bee inspired products that aim to solve a social and environmental problem through business activities that focus on triple bottom line:  people, planet and profit.

Social Problem:  A lack of employment opportunities represents one of the greatest barriers to an individual’s successful reentry into society from incarceration.

Social Solution:  Breakdown employment barriers by hiring returning citizens, helping them to acquire marketable skills along with a living wage, helping them gain tools for self-sufficiency.

Environmental Problem:  If bees disappear from the face of the earth, man would only have four years to live.  Maurice Materlink is known to say.

Environmental Solution:  Save the bees with a managed apiary. Provide high quality, natural products that are good for the skin and environment.

Imagine if you had no place to live, no job and no money. What would you do to survive? To get by, would you commit a crime? Former inmates are faced with these questions far too often. Ex-offenders confront one pressing re-entry challenge after another, everything from finding a place to live and arranging drug abuse treatment to getting a job. A setback in any one of these areas can easily lead to relapse and a return to prison, what public policy analysts call "recidivism."

A Bureau of Justice statistic study finds that inmates released from state prisons have a five-year recidivism rate of 76.6% and federal prisoners released have a 44.7% re-arrest rate after five years.

In the spring of 2015, I purchased my first beehive at the convincing of a friend who felt we needed to do our part and to educate others about the importance of honeybees, which were decreasing at an alarming rate.  In the summer of 2015, I began teaching an entrepreneurship class at a women’s prison.  My thought was that entrepreneurship was a viable option for individuals facing difficulty in finding employment. I am a Family and Consumer Sciences Educator for  University of Maryland Extension. 

I mentioned my new venture to one of the students in my class.  She told me that they wanted hives at the prison and  the warden was on board.  She also told me about a company in Chicago selling products made from the bee’s honey and wax.  Additionally, they were hiring ex-offenders to work in the company, providing them with training, marketable skills and transitional employment.

I thought this was a novel idea, and thus the concept for BeeHavin’ was born in that classroom.  The name is a pun.  Our employees, the formerly incarcerated are no longer misbehaving – and our apiaries are havens for our honeybees.

A Sustainable Solution to Recidivism

Employment represents one of the greatest barriers to an individual’s successful reintegration into the community.   On average only one in five prisoners have employment lined up prior to their release.  The reasons for lack of employment are manifold.  Some individuals do not possess proper skills, work experience, or education to secure employment.  Others have erratic work histories, mental impairments or life skill deficits.  The ones that are qualified to work, simply do not have the proper identification or credentials to demonstrate eligibility; do not know how or where to look for jobs and must meet parole requirements that limit their ability to find and keep employment.

Sustainable employment may be our single best opportunity to significantly reduce recidivism.  In 2015, the Manhattan Institute released a study that revealed a 20% reduction in recidivism of non-violent offenders that could obtain employment.  This study also revealed that the sooner employment was obtained, the less likely they were to commit further crimes. 

Beehavin’ breaks down employment barriers by hiring returning citizens and helping them acquire work experience, marketable skills and credentials through employment.  At its most basic level, employment provides former prisoners with a consistent source of funding for necessities and basic amenities.  It also increases self-efficacy and self-sufficiency, while building confidence that one can support oneself without need to resort to criminal activities or reliance on friends, family or handouts.

Employees earn a living wage with benefits.  They acquire concrete skills such as inventorying products, sales, customer service, and production that can be transferred to a variety of industries.   

They learn sound financial management and are encouraged to participate in company sponsored workshops on budgeting, buying a home, entrepreneurship and asset building.  While we cannot provide for their every need, we will have a human resources/case manager who will refer employees to other organizations in the community for additional assistance to help increase their chances for successful reintegration.

The Product

BeeHavin’ produces all-natural lip and skin care lines that are powered by honeybees and our amazing employees and beekeepers.  The first product we will introduce is our lip balm which is made of three ingredients: avocado oil, a natural sun block and skin moisturizer; beeswax, which is anti-inflammatory, antibacterial and an antioxidant; and an essential oil for flavoring, such as peppermint, orange ginger or lemon.

We will use the funds raised in the campaign to purchase a commercial printer so that we can make custom labels for our products; to hire three employees and to purchase hives, equipment  and bees for our apiary.

Unique Perks

Our unique perks were designed by individuals who are currently incarcerated.  We held a contest that was promoted in State, Federal and Local correctional institutions across the country.  Inmates submitted entries for our perk designs. The winning entry came from a graphics design class currently taught by Thomas Lane of Graphics Needed, www.graphicsneeded.webs.com. 

The Impact

The prison cycle takes a toll on everyone, including the communities where people cycle in and out of jail.  Some communities, like Sandtown-Winchester in Baltimore have a higher than average percentage of their residents incarcerated in state presents at an annual cost of $37,000 per person.  Maryland’s state budget allocates $17 million each year to this impoverished neighborhood, not for job training, family services or education, but solely for incarceration.  For BeeHavin’ there exists a real opportunity to disrupt the continuous cycle of quarantining humans-----through sustainable employment.  For the sake of society at large, it may represent our best opportunity to significantly disrupt recidivism and  growing population of Americans with criminal records.

According to the American Civil Liberties Union, America, land of the free, has earned the disturbing distinction of being the world’s leading jailer.  Although the U.S. represents just 5% of the world’s population, it holds 25% of its inmates. The U.S. spends over $80 billion on incarceration each year.  Local, state, and federal governments spend anywhere from $20,000 to $50,000 annually to keep an individual behind bars.  Studies say that states spend almost four times per capita on incarcerating prisoners than educating students.

Risks & Challenges

  • Establishing our company and setting our products apart from our competitors could be a challenge.   To overcome this challenge, we have chosen a different business model from our retail competitors.  Although, our product will be available in natural food markets and on our website, our product will also be available wholesale to businesses for customized branding.  Additionally, we will pursue state and federal contracting opportunities, as well as nonprofit partnering opportunities.
  • Overcoming the stigma of hiring the formerly incarcerated could pose a challenge. Too often society negatively label persons with criminal records, often citing that they got what they deserved.  We plan to overcome stigma associated with incarceration through education.  Ex-offender reentry happens every day.  Many emerge from prison without much more than the clothes they are wearing and their criminal records.  We all have the opportunity to either help empower them to become positive, contributing citizens of society or to reoffend and commit new offenses that also jeopardize our safety and well-being as a community.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute monetarily, but you can still help us spread the word about our company, our mission, and our products!  And, you can use the share tools on this page to help you do that. 

Also, you can support us by purchasing our product either from our website at www.beehavinproducts.com or through one of our Retail Partners which will be listed on our website.

Thank you for your consideration of the support of this campaign!

beeswax, which is anti-inflammatory, antibacterial and an antioxidant; and an essential oil for flavoring, such as peppermint, orange ginger or lemon.We will use the funds raised in the campaign to purchase a commercial printer so that we can make custom labels for our products; to hire three employees and to purchase hives, equipment  and bees for our apiary.Unique PerksOur unique perks were designed by individuals who are currently incarcerated.  We held a contest that was promoted in State, Federal and Local correctional institutions across the country.  Inmates submitted entries for our perk designs. The winning entry came from a graphics design class currently taught by Thomas Lane of Graphics Needed, www.graphicsneeded.webs.com. The ImpactThe prison cycle takes a toll on everyone, including the communities where people cycle in and out of jail.  Some communities, like Sandtown-Winchester in Baltimore have a higher than average percentage of their residents incarcerated in state presents at an annual cost of $37,000 per person.  Maryland’s state budget allocates $17 million each year to this impoverished neighborhood, not for job training, family services or education, but solely for incarceration.  For BeeHavin’ there exists a real opportunity to disrupt the continuous cycle of quarantining humans-----through sustainable employment.  For the sake of society at large, it may represent our best opportunity to significantly disrupt recidivism and  growing population of Americans with criminal records.According to the American Civil Liberties Union, America, land of the free, has earned the disturbing distinction of being the world’s leading jailer.  Although the U.S. represents just 5% of the world’s population, it holds 25% of its inmates. The U.S. spends over $80 billion on incarceration each year.  Local, state, and federal governments spend anywhere from $20,000 to $50,000 annually to keep an individual behind bars.  Studies say that states spend almost four times per capita on incarcerating prisoners than educating students.Risks & Challenges
Establishing our company and setting our products apart from our competitors could be a challenge.   To overcome this challenge, we have chosen a different business model from our retail competitors.  Although, our product will be available in natural food markets and on our website, our product will also be available wholesale to businesses for customized branding.  Additionally, we will pursue state and federal contracting opportunities, as well as nonprofit partnering opportunities.
Overcoming the stigma of hiring the formerly incarcerated could pose a challenge. Too often society negatively label persons with criminal records, often citing that they got what they deserved.  We plan to overcome stigma associated with incarceration through education.  Ex-offender reentry happens every day.  Many emerge from prison without much more than the clothes they are wearing and their criminal records.  We all have the opportunity to either help empower them to become positive, contributing citizens of society or to reoffend and commit new offenses that also jeopardize our safety and well-being as a community.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand not everyone can contribute monetarily, but you can still help us spread the word about our company, our mission, and our products!  And, you can use the share tools on this page to help you do that. Also, you can support us by purchasing our product either from our website at www.beehavinproducts.com or through one of our Retail Partners which will be listed on our website.Thank you for your consideration of the support of this campaign!

story:
Online Vegan Community & Social Network Site

The Vegan Sandwich is the world's first free online vegan community and social media networking site, with the first vegan only international directory, that connects and empowers people from around the world in an engaging and meaningful way. It is a way to bring vegans and non-vegans alike in a global community to share, support, and encourage one another to the vegan lifestyle. However, it is more than just an online community of learning, sharing, and friendship. The site will include:

  • One-on-one or group video and audio messaging
  • Ability to add and join groups
  • A complete vegan directory, with restaurant listings, buy & sell, dating, community listings, vegan companies, supermarkets/health stores, services and more.
  • Online community forum
  • Fully integrated why vegan section, including, vegan alternative section, animal ingredient list, FAQ page, Vegan Challenge, etc.
  • Blog section with the ability to add your own blogs/articles.
  • Ability to add videos, photos, and other files, and share them with your friends
    and/or the community.



What We Need and What You Get

Even though this project is a massive undertaking, we've already completed a big part of the site. Still, though, there is a lot that needs to be completed and with your help, we can finish it.

  • We will need to implement a video, audio, and messaging system through cometchat ($500)
  • Website developers and programmers to complete the design and programming with a paid monthly subscription for users and companies who want to further their business and receive additional options and features. (at least $500)
  • Upgrade to a basic dedicated hosting plan. (Fast site and no crashes) (at least $1300 - for one year)
  • Other software and development $200

Other Upgrades

  • Advanced dedicated hosting plan. (much faster website with no crashes)
  • Ability for users and companies to pay for site advertisements (similar to Facebook)
  • Other software and cool features

Unique Perks
  • We are only asking for $2500 USD, something, in fact, that would cost thousands more. The more money we can raise the more we can implement and the further we can promote veganism.
  • We offer unique VIP packages, first-hand perks for supporters to join before the site is officially launched.



The Impact

A site like this would attract millions of users from around the world in an engaging and social way. Vegan education is a big part of the site and would inspire and awaken many to the vegan lifestyle. In spite of this website being the world's first social media site with the first vegan only directory, it would catch the media's attention, sending out an avalanche of coverage across the globe.

  • This site will potentially turn millions or even hundreds of millions of people vegan and set the scale for veganism to reach the global mass media.
  • This website will be the world's first vegan social media network, with the first vegan only directory, therefore creating the largest vegan website and social media platform ever!

Risks and Challenges

We can honestly say that in an imperfect world such as ours, there will be issues with this sort of endeavour. The animal industry will not favour such strength and push. However, the more support we get from vegans like yourself, the stronger and more powerful voice we will have and the larger audience we can attract.



Other Ways You Can Help

Your support goes a long way! Even if you cannot afford to contribute even $5, we would appreciate sharing this important campaign to as many people as you can. 

  • Share this campaign through the Indiegogo share tools provided.
  • Share it on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.)
  • Help fundraise through bake sales, potlucks, etc.

Once again we'd like to thank all fans and supporters for making it happen! There would be no way we could do it without you.

Yours Truly,
The Vegan Sandwich team
