Initial research shows I am zoned to be a B&B or Inn. I have done some of the code requirements like smoke detectors wired and battery, exit signs and have the cost for the other code requirements.
I have a experience engineer and lawyer standing by to carry the project forward
I can do all the marketing and radio,print and video advertising.
I have accounts for Air BnB, Home Away and Navy housing for the Saratoga Base
I will join the chamber of commerce and lodging bureau.

I am a hands on guy and remolded my former video office into 2 more bedrooms with a living room like a suite. I take care of the landscaping, fall leaf cleanup and snow removal. I do the cleaning and can cook too 
 


Other Ways You Can Help. If you can't donate come and stay with us anyway.

Spread the word.
Use Indiegogo share tools and help the cause 
Share us on your social media accounts

story:
“When I was an awkward, mentally ill teen, arts programs saved me from myself. Now, as a sightly-less-awkward adult, I'm working with friends to build an awesome, inclusive arts program to help teens and adults discover and nurture their own creativity.” - Roz Kromhoff

 

Short Summary

Origins Creative Arts Company will offer arts programming for teens and adults in our community (Langley, British Columbia, Canada), with a special focus on designing programs for students with chronic physical and/or mental health issues.

We will offer regular weekly music, dance, drama and musical theatre lessons, along with monthly workshops in a variety of disciplines, from writing to stagecraft to podcasting. Our studio space will also act as a gathering place for small events like movie nights, gallery shows and student performances.

Our goals are:

  • To build a robust, supportive environment in which our students can flourish creatively and emotionally.
  • To provide our students with ample performance and exhibition opportunities.
  • To provide local employment opportunities for instructors, workshop leaders and auxiliary staff.
  • To create and share outreach projects in Langley and surrounding communities.

By building and supporting a close-knit arts community, Origins Creative Arts Company will empower students and change lives.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Through this campaign, we hope to raise $45,000. This is enough for our first six months of operations, including licensing and insuring the business ($900), procuring and renovating our space ($28,000), paying instructors ($10,000), and other operating expenses ($6,100) including everything from advertising to security to office supplies and sheet music. After five months in operation, we'll be applying for a traditional bank loan for the remainder of our funding needs.

If we don't meet our entire goal, the funds we do raise will go toward licensing, insurance and instructor wages before anything else, even if it means we have to offer programs in weird church basements.

Our perks are community-focused, just like our project is! They fall into three categories: Recognition, Advertising, and Experiences!

  • Recognition is simply that – us letting the world know that you helped out! We have the capacity to give social media shout-outs (including linking to your business or personal web site) and to include recognition in our on-line student newsletters and in printed programmes for student performances.
  • Advertising is available to all supporters who give $200 or more, and range from small ads in our student newsletters to full-page ads in our recital programmes. You can choose to advertise your own business, display a personal message, or donate your advertising space to your favourite local non-profit!
  • Experiences are the very best perks we can offer! From a simple half-day workshop to an entire YEAR of “unlimited” weekly lessons (up to a $3,000 value), we're really putting ourselves out there by offering a variety of experiences to those who give $200 or more. If you are unable to use your Experience vouchers, you may choose to donate them back to the Company so we can pass them on to a deserving student!

 

The Impact

Origins Creative Arts Company will impact our community by:

  • Providing artistic opportunities to students who might not be comfortable expressing themselves otherwise.
  • Adding cultural value through our student recitals, exhibitions and performances.
  • Connecting the public with local supports and services related to chronic illness.
  • Providing local employment opportunities in the arts.

 

Risks & Challenges

Origins Creative Arts Company has been in the “pre-planning / planning phase” for nearly a decade, and translating all of that pre-planning into real-world figures and action steps has been a challenge... but a very fun one!

Beyond that, we foresee three distinct challenges for the business:

  • Start-Up Financing: Here we are. Start-up financing is easily our biggest obstacle. No one involved in these early stages of the Company is in a position to put forth any capital (for example, Roz is a janitor who lives paycheck-to-paycheck), so crowd-funding -followed by a tradition loan 5-6 months down the road- is our best option, for the moment.
  • Human Resources: While we have a list of interested instructors already, it's a challenge to find the right people to instruct in a program like this. Not only must they be qualified in their respective artistic fields, but because of the range of students they will be interacting with, our instructors need to have a sense of patience and compassion above and beyond what is expected in an “average” arts program. We will overcome this challenge by turning to our personal networks and our local community (via social and traditional media) for instructor recommendations, by starting small (with just a few instructors) and by taking student feedback seriously. We will hold our instructors to a very high standard.
  • Trust-Building: We need to build trust on several levels. Within our community, the public needs to be able to trust our name to be indicative of caring, quality programming. Students need to be able to trust that they are receiving quality instruction. Instructors and staff need to be able to trust their employer. And so on. We will rise to meet the challenge of student trust-building by being organized, courteous, and conscientious in every student interaction. We will treat our instructors and staff well, to ensure they are inspired to do their best possible work for us. We will be the trust we wish to earn.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. There are three other ways you can contribute:

Share this campaign! Indiegogo has awesome, robust sharing tools right here on the campaign page, for all kinds of social media – please use them! You can find links to all of our social media through our website ( www.originscreative.ca ) and if you need more information, please e-mail us at info@originscreative.ca !

 

Donate artsy stuff! If you happen to be re-homing any sheet music, gently-loved instruments (including keyboards) or accessories (music stands, for example), or any audio equipment, and you want to see things go to an awesome little start-up, please consider sending them our way. We have a whole Wish List of odds and ends we will be on the hunt for once we have a space –from furniture to curtains-- and we're happy to share it with you! If you have something you think might help us out, please e-mail info@originscreative.ca

 

Volunteer! We're going to need an excellent team of volunteers to help out with a whole bunch of things, especially during our first year of operations. These jobs will mostly be related to student performances -things like ticket-taking and concession working- but it helps to have people lined up well in advance. If you're interested in volunteering (including if you are a secondary school student looking for work experience) please e-mail info@originscreative.ca

 

Thank you so much for reading! Have a super day!
story_txt:
“When I was an awkward, mentally ill teen, arts programs saved me from myself. Now, as a sightly-less-awkward adult, I'm working with friends to build an awesome, inclusive arts program to help teens and adults discover and nurture their own creativity.” - Roz Kromhoff Short SummaryOrigins Creative Arts Company will offer arts programming for teens and adults in our community (Langley, British Columbia, Canada), with a special focus on designing programs for students with chronic physical and/or mental health issues.We will offer regular weekly music, dance, drama and musical theatre lessons, along with monthly workshops in a variety of disciplines, from writing to stagecraft to podcasting. Our studio space will also act as a gathering place for small events like movie nights, gallery shows and student performances.Our goals are:
To build a robust, supportive environment in which our students can flourish creatively and emotionally.
To provide our students with ample performance and exhibition opportunities.
To provide local employment opportunities for instructors, workshop leaders and auxiliary staff.
To create and share outreach projects in Langley and surrounding communities.
By building and supporting a close-knit arts community, Origins Creative Arts Company will empower students and change lives. What We Need & What You GetThrough this campaign, we hope to raise $45,000. This is enough for our first six months of operations, including licensing and insuring the business ($900), procuring and renovating our space ($28,000), paying instructors ($10,000), and other operating expenses ($6,100) including everything from advertising to security to office supplies and sheet music. After five months in operation, we'll be applying for a traditional bank loan for the remainder of our funding needs.If we don't meet our entire goal, the funds we do raise will go toward licensing, insurance and instructor wages before anything else, even if it means we have to offer programs in weird church basements.Our perks are community-focused, just like our project is! They fall into three categories: Recognition, Advertising, and Experiences!

Recognition is simply that – us letting the world know that you helped out! We have the capacity to give social media shout-outs (including linking to your business or personal web site) and to include recognition in our on-line student newsletters and in printed programmes for student performances.

Advertising is available to all supporters who give $200 or more, and range from small ads in our student newsletters to full-page ads in our recital programmes. You can choose to advertise your own business, display a personal message, or donate your advertising space to your favourite local non-profit!

Experiences are the very best perks we can offer! From a simple half-day workshop to an entire YEAR of “unlimited” weekly lessons (up to a $3,000 value), we're really putting ourselves out there by offering a variety of experiences to those who give $200 or more. If you are unable to use your Experience vouchers, you may choose to donate them back to the Company so we can pass them on to a deserving student!
 The ImpactOrigins Creative Arts Company will impact our community by:
Providing artistic opportunities to students who might not be comfortable expressing themselves otherwise.
Adding cultural value through our student recitals, exhibitions and performances.
Connecting the public with local supports and services related to chronic illness.
Providing local employment opportunities in the arts.
 Risks & ChallengesOrigins Creative Arts Company has been in the “pre-planning / planning phase” for nearly a decade, and translating all of that pre-planning into real-world figures and action steps has been a challenge... but a very fun one!Beyond that, we foresee three distinct challenges for the business:

Start-Up Financing: Here we are. Start-up financing is easily our biggest obstacle. No one involved in these early stages of the Company is in a position to put forth any capital (for example, Roz is a janitor who lives paycheck-to-paycheck), so crowd-funding -followed by a tradition loan 5-6 months down the road- is our best option, for the moment.

Human Resources: While we have a list of interested instructors already, it's a challenge to find the right people to instruct in a program like this. Not only must they be qualified in their respective artistic fields, but because of the range of students they will be interacting with, our instructors need to have a sense of patience and compassion above and beyond what is expected in an “average” arts program. We will overcome this challenge by turning to our personal networks and our local community (via social and traditional media) for instructor recommendations, by starting small (with just a few instructors) and by taking student feedback seriously. We will hold our instructors to a very high standard.

Trust-Building: We need to build trust on several levels. Within our community, the public needs to be able to trust our name to be indicative of caring, quality programming. Students need to be able to trust that they are receiving quality instruction. Instructors and staff need to be able to trust their employer. And so on. We will rise to meet the challenge of student trust-building by being organized, courteous, and conscientious in every student interaction. We will treat our instructors and staff well, to ensure they are inspired to do their best possible work for us. We will be the trust we wish to earn.
 Other Ways You Can HelpWe completely understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. There are three other ways you can contribute:Share this campaign! Indiegogo has awesome, robust sharing tools right here on the campaign page, for all kinds of social media – please use them! You can find links to all of our social media through our website ( www.originscreative.ca ) and if you need more information, please e-mail us at info@originscreative.ca ! Donate artsy stuff! If you happen to be re-homing any sheet music, gently-loved instruments (including keyboards) or accessories (music stands, for example), or any audio equipment, and you want to see things go to an awesome little start-up, please consider sending them our way. We have a whole Wish List of odds and ends we will be on the hunt for once we have a space –from furniture to curtains-- and we're happy to share it with you! If you have something you think might help us out, please e-mail info@originscreative.ca Volunteer! We're going to need an excellent team of volunteers to help out with a whole bunch of things, especially during our first year of operations. These jobs will mostly be related to student performances -things like ticket-taking and concession working- but it helps to have people lined up well in advance. If you're interested in volunteering (including if you are a secondary school student looking for work experience) please e-mail info@originscreative.ca Thank you so much for reading! Have a super day!

story:
Glam Curlz

Hi I'm Katelyn Alexander and I'm 15 years old. I'm starting my first company to help raise money for dance and  my Amazon business with a private label product, Glam Curlz.

I was adopted at birth ( and so I have abandonment issues- Just wanna be real)*and growing up my mom has straight hair and I have frizzy curly hair so it was hard growing up, as we both had different hair types, used different shampoos and polar textures.  Whats funny growing up, I would get the double take look, your moms asian.  I've created  a hair care line that truly works for curly hair,  I work with professional laboratories that have been around for 50 years .  They carry over 4,000 live products and have a team of 200 workers daily building private label  for many reputable companies.   Our partners and laboratories are in the USA and have International Distribution to Europe, Latin America, Canada, Australia and the Middle Eastern and Asian Pacific Rim Markets.  They are part of the following organizations

Member in good standing with the Personal Care Product Council (PCPC), Independent Cosmetic Manufacturers and Distributors Association (ICMAD) and Society of Cosmetic Chemists (SCC)

Philanthropy:  One of the main reasons I want to start my own business is to help foster teens aging out of the system to have a job.  I hope my business can employ foster teens to help ship, design, product development  or teens to learn a skill that can help them never to go broke.

I was adopted and want to give back to foster teens, because I know how it feels being abandoned.

Specific details on where the monies will be used:

Production Batch 1 $2,350.00

Production Batch 2 $2,650.00

Production Batch 3 $2,350.00

Production Batch 4 $2,350.00

Bottle supplies and printing $4,000.00 

Logo Art work and graphics $1200.00

Marketing and social media FB ads $2,033.00

My dad is helping me be frugal and cut cost in my business, I'm grateful I'm frugal because I want to learn how to support my self financially. Our family is big on war on debt and wasteful monies spent. 

Why this is important to me?  (katie)  This business is important to me to start young and learn how to gain skills in running a business.  You tube and Amazon provide tools that make it fun yet challenging to sell.  

I was recently accepted to Mayor Eric Garcetti's Youth Team (Mayor of Los Angeles) and this is a great opportunity to share with other teens that you can start a business and do what you love and give back to the community.  

Dream goals: I want to build a legacy company like a Johnson & Johnson, I know thats a tall order, but dreams can come true.  My mom and dad have been an inspiration to push me to do what I love and make money doing it, so I will never struggle financially. 

Challenges:  Growth.  We will be selling on You tube first as we can control the inventory.  We will sell on Amazon as well.  We currently have orders and with this Indiegogo campaign we plan to raise monies to help with our first run.  We will do USA Trade shows first and then move to international 2019.   We will not have issues with inventory as our laboratories can handle the volume as they make products for large beauty companies and have been around over 30 years. 

Our products and formulas are registered and in the process of being patented.

 

We understand that money is tight and some cannot contribute at this time.  We ask if you could kindly share our link 10 times with in the 30 days of the campaign to help spread the word.  No amount is too small.   

Special Features about Glam Curlz:

- Made in the USA

- Red Algae from the North Shore of Hawaii (Super Vitamin E) helps protect from dangerous free radicals .

- Free of Paraben & Sulfate, hypoallergenic

- No testing on animals

- Kukui Nut Oil aka Candlenut Oil

-Kava Root for conditioning agent, hair moisturizer 

- Super fruit blend Includes Goji, Coffea Arabica, Acai, Noni and Pomegranate

We focus on natural products, antioxidant boost, and moisture for healthy hair.

My Great Grandmother Juanita Molina Aquino lived in Kalihi, Hawaii and used many of these products to keep her hair healthy and moisturized.

story:
El Taller del Hobby será un espacio físico ubicado en Sevilla, donde aprender, practicar y difundir el modelismo, miniaturismo y otros hobbys y artes manuales. Contará con una tienda propia en la que encontrar materiales, modelos a construir, publicaciones y todo lo que puedas necesitar. Además de un espacio habilitado para practicar y aprender. Queremos enseñar a todo aquel que quiera a disfrutar de su hobby, fomentando el arte. Nuestro deseo es que tengas un espacio de trabajo propio en el taller, donde adquirir práctica, mostrar tus trabajos, exponer y sobre todo, relacionarte con otros amigos. Uno de los objetivos es que los mas jovenes, tengan un nuevo canal de ocio, con contacto humano y desarrollo artístico. Lejos de la frialdad y el aislamiento de las redes sociales.

En El Taller del Hobby se darán cita artistas experimentados y noveles, se organizarán cursos y talleres específicos, exposiciones, jornadas de ocio y reuniones periódicas de asociaciones y clubes. En todos ellos, puedes participar. Además, vosotros mismos propondreis que tipo de actividad relacionada os interesa. Podrás acudir a el cuando gustes, visitanos cada dia, o pasate un dia a la semana a saludar. Tu marcas tu tiempo.

Podrás usar nuestro espacio para presentar tu último proyecto, para que tu asociación o club se reuna, para impartir clases, para exponer tus trabajos, para contactar con otros artistas, para adquirir tus herramientas, para recibir consejos de como mejorar en tu hobby, para acudir a charlas, debates, etc...

Para nuestro taller, es necesario contar con unas instalaciones adecuadas, cómodas y accesibles, asi como con el material necesario para ponerlo en marcha. El dinero recaudado será destinado integramente a la consecución de estas instalaciones y de dicho material ( muebles, taquillas, mesas, lámparas, herramientas, etc). Obviamente, todo contará con la transparencia necesaria y cualquier persona interesada en el proyecto, podrá acceder a la memoria de gastos, para comprobar exactamente en que se emplea su dinero. Iremos informando periódicamente de los avances obtenidos, de forma transparente y pública.

story:
Background: Ten years ago Neni and I turned our lives upside down and moved from Brazil to London, immersing ourselves in a world of new sights, sounds, flavours, spices and cuisines. Five years later we embraced veganism and slowly gravitated from West to East London, now calling Hackney home.


Chocolate and Blueberry Cake
 

I’ve always enjoyed learning and with my newfound interest in veganism, I found myself exploring more and more in the kitchen while revelling in the challenge of veganising my favourite recipes and traditional Brazilian dishes. With my friends always asking for the recipes, the inevitable happened. In 2012 the Essential Vegan blog was born.


Brazilian Coconut Sweet Bread
 

The blog quickly gained a loyal readership which led to the development of a fully-fledged website. Neni documented my dishes with his camera as I continued to bake, braise, boil, steam and stir… and before we knew it we were taking our Essential Vegan cookbook out of the oven in September 2013.


Essential Vegan Cookbook
 

Things were getting serious! I quit my day job and went back to school, studying to become a vegetarian and vegan nutritional consultant. I launched a stall in Brick Lane’s Boiler House selling cakes and burgers, I started giving cookery classes, Neni and I ran a kitchen residency in Portobello Road and we staged other pop ups, becoming regulars at major fairs such as VegFest (London and Brighton) and the Animal Aid Xmas Market.


Essential Burger
 

In the Summer of 2015 we took over a little shack at PUMP Shoreditch, serving our classic Essential Burger and cakes, making our mark in East London with regulars coming back for more. It was around this time that we started experimenting with making cashew nut based cheese, which is now stocked in a handful of wholefood shops and in 2017 we orchestrated an eight-week kitchen residency at Haunt in Stoke Newington. It was such a successful residency that the owner turned vegan and the venue remains vegan to this day!

 


Our nut base cheese
 

It doesn’t get much better than that really. And we can’t convey how good a feeling it is when people recognise our brand, when they’ve come back to one of our stalls to say our burger was the best thing they’d eaten that day, when they get emotional to discover they can have our cheesecake because it’s dairy free, or when they’ve asked… where are you guys based? Where can I find you…?
 


Reusable cotton tote
 

It’s been a good couple of years of dreaming and searching for the perfect spot to open a place of our own and now we’ve finally found it. The whole adventure is happening so very fast and we’d love for you to be a part of making it become what we’ve always dreamed of.

Come and visit us soon!
Vanessa & Neni x


Facade project

 

This sounds awesome - how can I be a part of this story?

We’ll be opening our doors as of 30th September, so we would naturally love to see your good selves coming through the door as soon as you can for a cuppa, to share a piece of cake with a friend, to give one of those Jackfruit burgers a try, or to pick up a copy of the cookbook.

But naturally in the meantime we’re looking to raise some serious funds, with £30,000 being our target, to make sure the business gets off the ground, and stays off the ground!

Making a donation through Indiegogo is the best way for you to support our dream of creating a great place to call home for all of us in the community.

Where will my contributions will go?

Your immensely appreciated contributions will help us:

  • cover the initial costs of setting up a new business;
  • purchase new equipment for the kitchen and to fix some of the existing items;
  • fit out the space and remodel it in an authentic manner and make it comfortable and welcoming for all.

Why back this project?

  • quite simply, because you want to support us!
  • you want to see an independent vegan business grow and flourish;
  • you want to see a lovely new space in the neighbourhood;
  • you love the Essential Vegan concept and want to help us build our reputation, and you’re curious to try our new Brazil-inspired dishes;
  • you love good quality food and coffee!

Spread the good word

Let the world know about our café and this campaign: it only takes a few moments, a couple of clicks, but in telling all your friends and family about this project you could be making all the difference!

Share away to your heart’s content on your blog, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, whatever you ‘Like’…

Thanks, and see you soon!


Credits:
Video by C.M Jackson & Jan Solberg D.O.P. 
Music by Ollie Axon & C.M Jackson
Text by Milo Steelefox


Tofu minced meat

The Ability Accelerator is a virtual community of business professionals helping individuals affected by disabilities become entrepreneurs through funding, support, and training.

According to the US Department of labor, fully 70% of working-age people with disabilities in America are not working.  https://www.dol.gov/odep/

This leads to poverty, powerlessness and prison.

In the early 1990s, about half of disabled Americans were employed, according to Census data. Today that has fallen to just 41%.  Some of the decline is due to an aging population. Older workers are more likely to have disabilities, especially physical ones.  But it's telling that the employment rate of disabled Americans has dropped more than for the non-disabled.

 

Just like their able body peers, individuals with disabilities are seeking new ways to earn a living.  Many through entrepreneurship. 

Today, entrepreneurship is on the rise:

-400,000 businesses are started each year

​-By 2020, 40% of our workforce will be self-employed

-60%-80% of new jobs created can be attributed to entrepreneurs 

Entrepreneurs need access to cash to be successful:

-77% of small businesses rely on personal savings for their initial funds

-Over 80% of businesses fail because of cash

The Ability Accelerator is a virtual community of business professionals designed to help entrepreneurs through funding, support, and training.  The Ability Accelerator will raise capital, invest in Metro Detroit businesses, and help them succeed by increasing sales or finding more funding. 

We are selling memberships to the Ability Accelerator to pay for our website and marketing expenses.  Members receive a portion of the profits produced by the Ability Accelerator investments.  Members will also gain access to potential sources of funding, support, and training.  Members are required to be on our email list to receive these benefits. 

Check out our perks for further details.
